PeachCastleTownGate.Notes: The gate used in Peach's Castle used to block off the path behind the start of Peach's Castle.

TeresaAtomic.Name: Big Boo Group
TeresaAtomic.Notes: A Big Boo that is followed by four smaller Boos. They move on a set path.

ClipAreaBoxBottomHighModel.Name: Box-shaped Matter Splatter Hole [Base Centered, "HighModel"]
ClipAreaBoxBottomHighModel.Notes: A box-shaped Matter Splatter hole. The origin is the center of the lower base.

HipDropMoveCylinderMiddle.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Dual-Sided Medium Ground Pound Block
HipDropMoveCylinderMiddle.Notes: A medium dual-sided ground pound block used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

WanwanObstaclePile.Name: Chompworks -- Moving Metal Blockade
WanwanObstaclePile.Notes: A blue metal platform used to block Chomps on the starting planet in Chompworks Galaxy.

AstroBaseCenterTop.Name: Comet Observatory -- Peak
AstroBaseCenterTop.Notes: The top of the Comet Observatory where a 1-Up can be found.

MarioFaceShipChimney.Name: Starship Mario -- Decorative Chimney
MarioFaceShipChimney.Notes: The chimney used on Starship Mario.

RollingDrumPlanet.Name: Clockwork Ruins -- Rolling Wheels Planet
RollingDrumPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the end of the first mission of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

SpinGuidanceArea.Name: Spin Tutorial Area
SpinGuidanceArea.Notes: An area that tells the player how to use the Spin Attack when entered.

GoroRockDashStartStep.Name: Melty Monster -- Starting Planet Ramp
GoroRockDashStartStep.Notes: A purple extension for the starting planet used in the second mission of Melty Monster Galaxy.

BigFanNoLeg.Name: Large Fan without Legs
BigFanNoLeg.Notes: A large fan that creates a gust that can push Bubbles and the player if with the Boo power-up.

BigCoinBlockStep.Name: Supermassive -- Huge ? Block
BigCoinBlockStep.Notes: A large ? Block from Supermassive Galaxy.

ClipAppearBattleShip.Name: Fearsome Fleet -- Moving Airship
ClipAppearBattleShip.Notes: The airship that appears from the portals in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

CrystalCageOpa.Name: Small Opaque Crystal
CrystalCageOpa.Notes: A small destroyable crystal that is not transparent.

ForestObstacleWoodA.Name: Honeyhive: Ground Pound Platform
ForestObstacleWoodA.Notes: The big ground pound platform that appears in the Honeyhive Galaxy.

SphereRailDash.Name: Fast Star Ball Rail
SphereRailDash.Notes: An invisible path that the Star Ball will fastly move on once touched.

RockBreakCageL.Name: Large Purple Rock Mushroom Crystal
RockBreakCageL.Notes: A large purple rock crystal used in Boulder Bowl Galaxy that can be destroyed with the Rock power-up.

DeathCube.Name: Death Area [Cube]
DeathCube.Notes: An area that kills the player and several other objects when entered. The cube's origin is the base's center.

MysteryCandyDecoratePartsB.Name: Sweet Mystery -- Decorative Pretzels, Candy Canes, etc.
MysteryCandyDecoratePartsB.Notes: A set of candy canes, pretzels and more; used in the background of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

IceMeramera.Name: Li'l Brr
IceMeramera.Notes: A burning rock enemy that floats around and chases after Mario. It will freeze the player upon contact.

DashYoshiTimerBridgeCometPlanet.Name: Hightail Falls -- Destroyed Stone Platforms Planet
DashYoshiTimerBridgeCometPlanet.Notes: The third planet used in the Comet mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

RepeatTimerStageNormalStep.Name: Beat Block -- Large Platform
RepeatTimerStageNormalStep.Notes: A set of four solid purple blocks used in Beat Block Galaxy.

WaterfallCaveCover.Name: Beach Bowl -- Breakable Rock Wall
WaterfallCaveCover.Notes: A breakable rock wall which covers the entrance to Beach Bowl Galaxy's underwater cave.

GarigariCutStepWithSwitch.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Short Piece of Dark Wood
GarigariCutStepWithSwitch.Notes: A short piece of dark wood; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy as the base for the Ground Pound Switch.

JumpStandAuto.Name: Jump Spring
JumpStandAuto.Notes: A blue spring that bounces the player into the air when jumping on it.

KillerGunnerTriple.Name: Bullet Bill Blaster (Triple)
KillerGunnerTriple.Notes: A set of three cannons that shoot Bullet Bills.

HipDropSwitch.Name: Ground Pound Switch
HipDropSwitch.Notes: A switch that activates something when Ground Pounded.

YoshiSendOffArea.Name: Waving Yoshi Area
YoshiSendOffArea.Notes: When the player dismounts Yoshi in this area, Yoshi waves them goodbye.

HugeBattleShipPlanetEntrance.Name: Battlerock: Metal Platform
HugeBattleShipPlanetEntrance.Notes: A metal platform used in the third mission of Battlerock Galaxy.

PieFortress.Name: Good Egg: Chomp Saucer Planet (Early)
PieFortress.Notes: An early unused version of Good Egg Galaxy's Chomp Saucer Planet (DorayakiFortressPlanet), with a destroyed tower in the center.

GarigariCutStepCircleHalfLeftB.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Large Green Semi-Circle Piece of Wood
GarigariCutStepCircleHalfLeftB.Notes: A semi-circular green piece of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

TamakoroFlipPanelPlanet.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Flipswitch Planet
TamakoroFlipPanelPlanet.Notes: The planet with Space Junk blocks, Flipswitch panels and colorful disks used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

PeanutMudPlanet.Name: Good Egg: Peanut Planet
PeanutMudPlanet.Notes: The peanut-shaped planet used in the first mission of Good Egg Galaxy.

RosettaPictureBook.Name: Rosalina's Storybook
RosettaPictureBook.Notes:
The storybook which Rosalina reads in the Library at the Comet Observatory as the player progresses through the game (SMG1).

Extra notes: This is not the object you're looking for if you want to edit the actual story told by Rosalina, whether it be the text or the images, it doesn't contain either of those, it's just a prop.

BombTimeAttackLv2Planet.Name: Gearmo Challenge Planet [Dreadnought]
BombTimeAttackLv2Planet.Notes: The planet used for the trash minigame in Dreadnought Galaxy.

StarPieceFollowGroup.Name: Following Star Piece Group
StarPieceFollowGroup.Notes: Creates a bunch of Star Bits that will move around the player. Usually used during Launch Star flights.

GarigariCutStepCircleHalfLeftA.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Large Brown Semi-Circle Piece of Wood
GarigariCutStepCircleHalfLeftA.Notes: A semi-circular brown piece of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

GhostShipCaveClosedRockA.Name: Deep Dark: Barricade Rocks
GhostShipCaveClosedRockA.Notes: A set of rocks that blocks the entrance to the ghost ship area in the Deep Dark Galaxy.

Polta.Name: Bouldergeist
Polta.Notes: The boss fought at the end of the third mission in Ghostly Galaxy and Boss Blitz Galaxy.

PurpleCoinStarter.Name: Purple Coin Spawner
PurpleCoinStarter.Notes: Once activated, spawns the purple coin UI and the purple coins in the area.

CylinderInsidePlanetA.Name: Toy Time -- Cylindrical Bonus Room
CylinderInsidePlanetA.Notes: The tall cylindrical bonus room from Toy Time Galaxy.

KoopaAssaultFallObj.Name: Decorative Falling Crystal
KoopaAssaultFallObj.Notes: A crystal cage that falls from the sky during Bowser's attack in the opening stroybook level.

NewBossStinkBugPlanet.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Bugaboom Planet
NewBossStinkBugPlanet.Notes: The planet where Bugaboom is fought in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

GliderShooter.Name: Cannonballs Undergrunt Gunner
GliderShooter.Notes: An Undergrunt Gunner that shoots cannonballs; used in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

YoshiCaptureRelayPlanet.Name: Yoshi Star -- Tiny Dirt Planet
YoshiCaptureRelayPlanet.Notes: A tiny spherical dirt planet with a small decorative fossil.

UnizoLand.Name: Land Urchin
UnizoLand.Notes: A red furry Urchin with spikes on its body; intended for land areas.

SurpSnowCapsuleGalaxy.Name: Portal to Snow Cap Galaxy
SurpSnowCapsuleGalaxy.Notes: A green portal that opens Snow Cap Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

SurpTearDropGalaxy.Name: Portal to Drip Drop Galaxy
SurpTearDropGalaxy.Notes: A green portal that opens Drip Drop Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

MemoryRoadSky.Name: Flash Black Sky
MemoryRoadSky.Notes: The sky model used in Flash Black Galaxy.

ScoreAttackCounter.Name: The Chimp Challenge Score Controller
ScoreAttackCounter.Notes: A controller that sets up the required points and time limit in The Chimp's challenges.

BalloonFruit.Name: Blimp Fruit
BalloonFruit.Notes: The blue fruit that Yoshi can eat to expand and fly like a balloon.

MorphSwitchArea.Name: Power-Up Switch Area
MorphSwitchArea.Notes: Activates a switch if the player enters it while using a specific power-up.

DashYoshiWallClimbCometPlanet.Name: Hightail Falls -- Destroyed Tall Wall Climb Planet
DashYoshiWallClimbCometPlanet.Notes: The second planet used in the Comet mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

ExterminationSkeletalFishBaby.Name: Power Star Spawner [Swimming Gringills]
ExterminationSkeletalFishBaby.Notes: A controller that spawns a Power Star if all assigned ChildSkeletalFishBaby objects have been killed.

PlayerSeCube.Name: Player Falling Sound Area [Cube]
PlayerSeCube.Notes: Plays the "long fall" sound effect while the player is airborne inside this area. The cube's origin is the base's center.

SkullPlanet.Name: Boo's Boneyard: Starting Planet
SkullPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Boo's Boneyard Galaxy.

FineAndStormSky.Name: Throwback Sky
FineAndStormSky.Notes: The sky model used in Throwback Galaxy.

ShellfishCoin.Name: Clampy with Coin
ShellfishCoin.Notes: An underwater clam that opens its mouth periodically; contains one Coin inside.

GorogoroPair.Name: Rhomp Pair
GorogoroPair.Notes: A set of two Rhomps attached to each other; used in Slipsand Galaxy.

CircleShell.Name: Seashells Circle
CircleShell.Notes: A circle of seashells that spawns Star Bits when the player shakes the Wii Remote nearby.

Jiraira.Name: Bowser Land Mine
Jiraira.Notes:
A large land mine with Bowser's emblem on the trigger. If the button is activated, it will charge
for half a second and cause an explosion after that. This explosion affects any actor with Player,
Enemy or MapObj sensors. If the actor is "killed", it will trigger the event that is attached to
its SW_DEAD setting.

By Someone

PoleSquareNoModel.Name: Invisible Wood Pole
PoleSquareNoModel.Notes: An invisible version of the square-shaped pole.

GorogoroPyramidPlanet.Name: Slipsand -- Pyramid Slide Planet
GorogoroPyramidPlanet.Notes: The large pyramid planet and slide used in the first mission of Slipsand Galaxy.

MeetKoopaDemoObj.Name: Bowser's First Appearance Cutscene Object Holder
MeetKoopaDemoObj.Notes: A holder that creates and registers several objects that are used in the cutscene where Bowser is encountered for the first time in Peach's Castle.

KoopaShipManholeCover.Name: Airship Manhole
KoopaShipManholeCover.Notes: A flippable manhole found on certain airships.

DeathSandEnvironmentRock.Name: Dusty Dune -- Background Rocks
DeathSandEnvironmentRock.Notes: A set of rocks used in the background of Dusty Dune Galaxy.

DarknessRoomDoorA.Name: Mansion Door
DarknessRoomDoorA.Notes: A mansion door that can be unlocked and opened.

Steam.Name: Steam (Effect)
Steam.Notes: A steam effect from Gateway Galaxy.

BeeJumpBallB.Name: Pink Honeybloom Berry
BeeJumpBallB.Notes: One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.

BeeJumpBallC.Name: Purple Honeybloom Berry
BeeJumpBallC.Notes: One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.

BeeJumpBallD.Name: Yellow Honeybloom Berry
BeeJumpBallD.Notes: One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.

MagmaMeteor.Name: Lava Meteor
MagmaMeteor.Notes: A lava meteor that creates a lava pond once it lands; used on the skating planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

PlaneCollisionCube.Name: Extended Item Sensor Area [Cube]
PlaneCollisionCube.Notes: An area which extends the sensor range when trying to collect items along the camera's view direction. For example, this allows the player to collect an item while thy stand behind or in front of it. The cube's origin is the base's center.

SliderBranchZoneSlopeA.Name: Rolling Coaster -- Split Path Planet
SliderBranchZoneSlopeA.Notes: The planet with the split path used in the first mission of Rolling Coaster Galaxy.

FireBubble.Name: Blue Podoboo
FireBubble.Notes: A blue Lava Bubble that can only be defeated by shooting a Star Bit at it.

SliderBranchZoneSlopeB.Name: Rolling Coaster -- Single Path Planet
SliderBranchZoneSlopeB.Notes: The single path planet used in the Comet mission of Rolling Coaster Galaxy.

ForestHomeGate.Name: Honeyhive: Honeycomb Wall
ForestHomeGate.Notes: A large honeycomb wall used in the second mission of Honeyhive Galaxy.

LuigiTalkNpc.Name: Luigi
LuigiTalkNpc.Notes: Mario's younger brother who can be talked to.

WorldWarpPointExit.Name: Decorative World Map Exit Portal
WorldWarpPointExit.Notes: A decorative portal from the World Map that appears if the player is close to the currently selected world's exit portal.

FallsArea.Name: Waterfall Effect Area
FallsArea.Notes: An area that makes waterfall splash effects appear around the player.

ForestBarricadeRockA.Name: Honeyhive: Rolling Boulder
ForestBarricadeRockA.Notes: A rolling boulder used in both Honeyhive Galaxy and Gold Leaf Galaxy.

CoinLinkGroup.Name: Coin 1-Up Bonus Controller
CoinLinkGroup.Notes: Rewards the player a 1-Up when all grouped Coins have been collected.

PetitPorter.Name: Bonus Planet Teleporter
PetitPorter.Notes: A teleporter that can be used to temporarily teleport the player to another place.

FollowerDrillPearPlanet.Name: Spin-Dig -- Starting Planet
FollowerDrillPearPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Spin-Dig Galaxy.

TakoBarrelA.Name: Octopus Barrel
TakoBarrelA.Notes: A barrel that is used to protect an Octopus.

BattleWanwanSearchPlanet.Name: Battle Belt -- Silver Chomp Planet
BattleWanwanSearchPlanet.Notes: The large metal planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that feautures several Silver Chomps.

TakoBarrelB.Name: Small Octopus Barrel
TakoBarrelB.Notes: An unused smaller version of TakoBarrelA.

FireBallBeamKameck.Name: Fire Ball Magikoopa
FireBallBeamKameck.Notes: A Magikoopa that casts fire balls.

KoopaFinalStarPlanet.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Grand Star Planet
KoopaFinalStarPlanet.Notes: The planet where the player finds both Princess Peach and the final Grand Star; used in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

MarioLauncherTargetC.Name: Boom Bunker -- Dark Matter Planet Cannon Target
MarioLauncherTargetC.Notes: A target for a cannon used on the Dark Matter planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

GlobalPlaneGravity.Name: Planar Gravity [Sphere Range]
GlobalPlaneGravity.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects parallel to the plane. This one has a spherical range.

MarioLauncherTargetB.Name: Boom Bunker -- Cloud Ferris Wheel Planet Cannon Target
MarioLauncherTargetB.Notes: A target for a cannon used on the cloud ferris wheel planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

MarioLauncherTargetA.Name: Boom Bunker -- Hammer Bros. Planet Cannon Target
MarioLauncherTargetA.Notes: A target for a cannon used on the Hammer Bros. planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

WaterDropMiddle.Name: Long Water Droplets Effect
WaterDropMiddle.Notes: A dripping water effect from Deep Dark Galaxy's Boo Box planet that shows many long droplets.

SnowCapsulePlanet.Name: Snow Cap Planet
SnowCapsulePlanet.Notes:
The main and only planet in Snow Cap Galaxy.

Note: This planet does not include the snow it has in the game, the snow is a separate object named SnowFloor.

YoshiEgg.Name: Yoshi Egg
YoshiEgg.Notes: An egg that hatches into Yoshi if destroyed.

CoinAppearSpot.Name: Coin Spawn Point
CoinAppearSpot.Notes: An object that spawns several Coins when activated.

MameMuimuiAttackMan.Name: The Chimp [Skating Challenge]
MameMuimuiAttackMan.Notes: The Chimp NPC used for the skating challenges in both Freezy Flake Galaxy and Shiverburn Galaxy.

AstroOverlookAreaCylinder.Name: Show Comet Observatory Labels Area [Cylinder]
AstroOverlookAreaCylinder.Notes: Displays the labels for the different parts of the Comet Observatory. Requires an actual AstroOverlookObj placed in the stage.

LuckyDice.Name: 1-Up Chance Cube
LuckyDice.Notes: A dice cube used in the Luma Shop room of Starship Mario. Can reward the player with a Star Bit, a 1-Up, a 3-Up or a 5-Up.

Monte.Name: Pianta
Monte.Notes: An exotic NPC originated from Super Mario Sunshine used in Starshine Beach Galaxy.

AstroDecoratePartsA.Name: Comet Observatory -- Beacon Ring
AstroDecoratePartsA.Notes: The red-purple ring found around the Beacon in the Comet Observatory.

BarrelColonyOuterPlanet.Name: Sky Station -- Cylindrical Banzai Bill Planet Exterior
BarrelColonyOuterPlanet.Notes: The exterior parts of the large cylindrical planet from Sky Station Galaxy's second Star.

MarioFacePlanetPrevious.Name: Starship Mario -- Main Planet before Transformation
MarioFacePlanetPrevious.Notes: The damaged planet that gets transformed into Starship Mario at the beginning of the game.

DepthOfFieldCylinder.Name: Field Depth Area [Cylinder]
DepthOfFieldCylinder.Notes: An area that changes the screen depth if the player enters it.

CoconutTree.Name: Decorative Palm Tree
CoconutTree.Notes: A decorative palm tree that can be seen in Loopdeeloop Galaxy, Loopdeeswoop Galaxy and Drip Drop Galaxy.

CoinReplica.Name: Deactivated Coin
CoinReplica.Notes: A Coin that can only be collected if a specific switch is activated.

GhostPlayer.Name: Cosmic Mario
GhostPlayer.Notes: Cosmic Mario, in use on Cosmic Prankster Comets.

KoopaJrCastle.Name: Boomsday Machine
KoopaJrCastle.Notes: The large tank boss fought at the end of Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

BeyondGalaxySky.Name: Chompworks Sky
BeyondGalaxySky.Notes: The starry sky model from Chompworks Galaxy, Fleet Glide Galaxy and Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

BringEnemy.Name: Gearmo Enemy Checker
BringEnemy.Notes: An object used to check if the player brings the correct enemy to the Gearmo in Boulder Bowl Galaxy and Space Storm Galaxy.

ValveSwitch.Name: Valve Switch
ValveSwitch.Notes: A screw-like green valve that the player can spin on top of to bring it up or down to activate a switch.

CoconutTreeLeaf.Name: Palm Tree Leaves
CoconutTreeLeaf.Notes: A set of animated palm tree leaves that the player can stand on.

KoopaBattleLv2Planet.Name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Bowser Battle Planet
KoopaBattleLv2Planet.Notes: The planet where Bowser is fought in Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

WoodBox.Name: Crate
WoodBox.Notes: A wooden box that can be destroyed through most attacks. It can spawn various different items.

GravityFollowPanel.Name: Upside Dizzy -- Moving Gravity Panel
GravityFollowPanel.Notes: A moving gravity display wall used on the first planet of Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

SpaceMineRail5m.Name: Mine Path Marker (Line)
SpaceMineRail5m.Notes: A line marker for a mine.

GliderForestPlanet.Name: Wild Glide -- Forest Cliffs Planet
GliderForestPlanet.Notes: The forest cliffs section used in Wild Glide Galaxy.

MarioFaceShipJet.Name: Starship Mario -- Rocket Booster
MarioFaceShipJet.Notes: A rocket booster used on the back of Starship Mario.

EffectTicoL.Name: Large Luma Sparkles
EffectTicoL.Notes: A sparkling effect that is used in the Comet Observatory.

KoopaVs2.Name: Bowser (Dark Matter Plant Battle)
KoopaVs2.Notes:
The Bowser battle that takes place on Bowser's Dark Matter Plant (SMG1).
This is the 2nd Bowser battle of SMG1.

KoopaVs1.Name: Bowser (Star Reactor Battle)
KoopaVs1.Notes:
The Bowser battle that takes place on Bowser's Star Reactor (SMG1).
This is the 1st Bowser battle of SMG1.

RotateSeesawTrampoline.Name: Starshine Beach -- Buoy Trampoline
RotateSeesawTrampoline.Notes: The large moving buoy trampoline used in Starshine Beach Galaxy.

NormalEndingDemoObj.Name: Ending Cutscene Object Holder
NormalEndingDemoObj.Notes: A holder that creates and registers several objects for the ending cutscene where Rosalina appears on Starship Mario.

ExtraWallCheckCylinder.Name: Wall Shadow Cast Area [Cylinder]
ExtraWallCheckCylinder.Notes: An area that when entered creates a blob like shadow to the wall perpendicular to the player.

KoopaVs3.Name: Bowser (Galaxy Reactor Battle)
KoopaVs3.Notes:
The Bowser battle that takes place on Bowser's Galaxy Reactor (SMG1).
This is the 3rd and final Bowser battle of SMG1.

MirrorAreaCube.Name: Mirror Reflection Area [Cube]
MirrorAreaCube.Notes: An object that mirrors some compatible objects onto a compatible surface.

SubmarineVolcanoBigColumn.Name: Bonefin Planet Stone Column
SubmarineVolcanoBigColumn.Notes: Large stone pillars used on the Bonefin planet.

BigBubbleCameraSphere.Name: Big Bubble Camera Area [Sphere]
BigBubbleCameraSphere.Notes: An area that causes the camera to change when the player enters it while riding a Big Bubble.

AstroChangeStageCube.Name: Comet Observatory Change Stage Area [Cube]
AstroChangeStageCube.Notes: An area that will exit the current scene and start another one. For example, this is used to go to the different Domes on the Comet Observatory.

MuimuiAttackPlanet.Name: The Chimp's Skating Challenge Room
MuimuiAttackPlanet.Notes: The planet where The Chimp is located in both Freezy Flake Galaxy and Shiverburn Galaxy.

AudioEffectSphere.Name: Audio Effect Area [Sphere]
AudioEffectSphere.Notes: Enables a different audio effect once entered.

SwitchingMoveStartAreaBlockRed.Name: Flip-Out -- Starting Planet Red Walls
SwitchingMoveStartAreaBlockRed.Notes: A set of red walls used on the starting planet of Flip-Out Galaxy.

TropicalCloudTowerPlanet.Name: Starshine Beach -- Main Planet
TropicalCloudTowerPlanet.Notes: The sandy beach planet used in Starshine Beach.

BattleShipElevator.Name: Battlerock -- Yellow Elevator
BattleShipElevator.Notes: The yellow elevator platform used in the third mission of Battlerock Galaxy.

BigRepeatWarpLift.Name: Supermassive -- Huge Yellow Disappearing Platform
BigRepeatWarpLift.Notes: A huge yellow platform that disappears and then reappears again after a short time; used in Supermassive Galaxy.

MiniKoopaBattleVs3Galaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Galaxy Reactor
MiniKoopaBattleVs3Galaxy.Notes:
Unused, yet fully functional dome warp to the final galaxy of the main game, Bowser's Galaxy Reactor, which is normally accessed by talking to Rosalina after collecting enough Power Stars.

Extra notes:
1) Does not have any special model, re-uses the same Bowser head model as the other Bowser dome warps.
2) Needs to have obj_arg0 set to 2 (Boss) to have it's expected functionality.

EffectTicoS.Name: Small Luma Sparkles
EffectTicoS.Notes: A sparkling effect that is used in the Comet Observatory.

KoopaCastleFireTowerA.Name: Lava Lair -- Tower with Torch
KoopaCastleFireTowerA.Notes: A background tower with a torch used in Bowser's Lava Lair.

GliderTreeA.Name: Wild Glide -- Palm Tree
GliderTreeA.Notes: A decorative palm tree used in Wild Glide Galaxy that swings if the Fluzzard bonks against it.

CoinSpot.Name: "CoinSpot" [Broken]
CoinSpot.Notes: A broken object that would have made a single Coin appear when using the Spin Attack nearby.

KaninaRed.Name: Red Crabber
KaninaRed.Notes: A red crab enemy that runs towards the player. Drops Star Bits when defeated.

KoopaLv2BattleRelayPlanet.Name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Meteors Planet
KoopaLv2BattleRelayPlanet.Notes: The planet where some meteors and the large Bowser door are found at the end of Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

DashYoshiBridgeSlopePlanet.Name: Hightail Falls -- Destroyed Starting Planet
DashYoshiBridgeSlopePlanet.Notes: The starting planet used in the first mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

MagmaMonsterPole.Name: Melty Monster -- Blue Pole
MagmaMonsterPole.Notes: A blue pole used on the second planet of the first mission of Melty Monster Galaxy. The actual climbing occurs on an invisible pole object that is placed inside of it.

KillerShooter.Name: Bullet Bill Undergrunt Gunner
KillerShooter.Notes: An Undergrunt Gunner that shoots Bullet Bills.

BarrelColonyDoor.Name: Sky Station -- Cylindrical Banzai Bill Planet Door
BarrelColonyDoor.Notes: The small door that covers the entrance into the cylindrical planet from Sky Station Galaxy's second Star.

TicoFatStarPiece.Name: Hungry Luma [World Map]
TicoFatStarPiece.Notes: A pink Luma that is hungry for Star Bits. Appears on the Starship Mario when requested on the World Map.

BossStinkBug.Name: Bugaboom
BossStinkBug.Notes: The boss fought in both the third mission of Honeyhive Galaxy and in the secret mission of Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

Mario.Name: Spawn Point
Mario.Notes: Sets the spawn point for the player at the start of a mission or at Checkpoints in a mission.

WoodDrumPlanet.Name: Tall Trunk -- Cylinder Log Planet
WoodDrumPlanet.Notes: The cylindrical tree planet from Tall Trunk Galaxy.

GravityFallBlockSnow.Name: Falling Snow Block
GravityFallBlockSnow.Notes: A snow block that can be destroyed with fire balls; used in Freezy Flake Galaxy. Always falls down if nothing is below it.

CompleteEndingDemoObj.Name: Library Cutscene Object Holder
CompleteEndingDemoObj.Notes: A holder that creates and registers several objects for the last cutscene in the Library Room.

Pichan.Name: Jibberjay
Pichan.Notes: An orange bird NPC that is used in the gliding galaxies.

FlipPanelInfernoPlanet.Name: Sky Station -- Cosmic Clones Flipswitch Planet
FlipPanelInfernoPlanet.Notes: A planet where Flipswitch panels and Cosmic Clones appear in the second mission of Sky Station Galaxy.

ReverseFlowSandPlanet.Name: Slipsand -- Cluckboom Planet
ReverseFlowSandPlanet.Notes: The second planet used in the first mission of Slipsand Galaxy.

ForbidWaterSearchCube.Name: No Edge Dive Area [Cube]
ForbidWaterSearchCube.Notes: This prevents the player from performing a special dive action when jumping off an edge while above a WaterArea. The cube's origin is the base's center.

RasterScrollCube.Name: Wobbling Screen Area [Cube]
RasterScrollCube.Notes: An area that, when entered, creates a wobbling screen effect. The cube's origin is the base's center.

RepeatBlock.Name: Snake Block
RepeatBlock.Notes: A set of blocks that move along a set path.

FlipPanelFrame.Name: Flipswitch: Starting Planet (Frame)
FlipPanelFrame.Notes: The frame used on the starting planet of Flipswitch Galaxy.

WoodWallDownRotate.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Thin Falling Wood Piece
WoodWallDownRotate.Notes: A thin piece of wood which collapses down; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

MysteryCandyBrightPlanet.Name: Sweet Mystery -- Main Platforms [Invisible]
MysteryCandyBrightPlanet.Notes: The invisible platforms used in the major portion of Sweet Mystery Galaxy that are set to appear when Bulb Yoshi is nearby.

FlipPanel.Name: Flipswitch Panel
FlipPanel.Notes: A blue panel that changes to yellow if the player steps on it.

GoroRockLanePartsRotate.Name: Bowling Challenge -- Blue Rotating Platform
GoroRockLanePartsRotate.Notes: A rotating blue platform used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

AssemblyBlock.Name: "AssemblyBlock" [Unused]
AssemblyBlock.Notes: A Space Junk block that retrieves a proper model using ShapeModelNo. However, no more models exist for this object.

TsukidashikunBig.Name: Large Bomp [Unfinished]
TsukidashikunBig.Notes: An unfinished large version of the Bomp, but the model is still visually the same size as the regular one, leading to visually weird collision.

DarkMatterCube.Name: Dark Matter Area [Cube]
DarkMatterCube.Notes: An area containing Dark Matter. The cube's origin is the base's center.

AstroDomeEntrance.Name: Comet Observatory -- Dome
AstroDomeEntrance.Notes: The entrances to the several Domes in the Comet Observatory.

SwitchGravityBombHeiPlanet.Name: Upside Dizzy -- Timed Gravity Section
SwitchGravityBombHeiPlanet.Notes: The upper portion of the first section in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

DustMetal.Name: Metal Debris
DustMetal.Notes: A set of metal particles used as space debris.

ItemDrill.Name: Spin Drill
ItemDrill.Notes: A drill power-up that allows the player to dig through certain dirt upon spinning.

OtaKing.Name: King Kaliente
OtaKing.Notes: The octopus boss fought in both the third mission of Good Egg Galaxy and all missions of Boss Blitz Galaxy.

Terebo.Name: Octoboo
Terebo.Notes: An undead version of an Octoomba.

LavaYoshiActionPlanetA.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Dash Pepper Planet
LavaYoshiActionPlanetA.Notes: The planet where the Dash Pepper is found in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

BigBubbleGoalAreaBox.Name: Pop Big Bubble Area [Cube]
BigBubbleGoalAreaBox.Notes: An area that pops any Big Bubble inside it. This may also activate a switch. The cube's origin is the base's center.

TreasureBoxKinokoLifeUp.Name: Treasure Chest with Life Mushroom
TreasureBoxKinokoLifeUp.Notes: A brown treasure chest that reveals a Life Mushroom when opened.

StaffRollSky.Name: Credits Sky
StaffRollSky.Notes: The sky model used in the credits that consists of several overlapped sky models.

StardustHillPlanet.Name: Good Egg: Level Select Model Part
StardustHillPlanet.Notes: A small hemisphere planet bearing the name for Space Junk Galaxy. Despite this, it is featured in the level selection model for Good Egg Galaxy.

PicketSwitch.Name: Small Ground Pound Stump
PicketSwitch.Notes: A small tree stump that can be Ground Pounded to activate something.

TreasureSpot.Name: Coin Spot
TreasureSpot.Notes: A golden spot on the ground that reveals a Coin when it is hit with a Star Bit.

MiniKoopaBattleVs1Galaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Star Reactor
MiniKoopaBattleVs1Galaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Bowser's Star Reactor.

TreasureBoxCrackedBlueChip.Name: Cracked Treasure Chest with Blue Chip
TreasureBoxCrackedBlueChip.Notes: A gray treasure chest that reveals a Blue Chip when opened.

SpinLeverSwitchForceAnim.Name: Lockable Lever Switch
SpinLeverSwitchForceAnim.Notes: A variant of SpinLeverSwitch that automatically flips over and locks irreversibly in the activated position if its SW_B gets activated, making it unusable. See Fiery Flotilla's starting planet for an example use case and setup.

BattleShipElevatorCover.Name: Battlerock -- Yellow Elevator Cover
BattleShipElevatorCover.Notes: The yellow lid that covers the hole after you ride the elevator in Battlerock Galaxy.

OtaKingBath.Name: King Kaliente's Planet (Duplicate)
OtaKingBath.Notes: An almost identical copy of King Kaliente's planet used ingame.

Buzz.Name: Chopper
Buzz.Notes: A green flying enemy used throughout Super Mario Galaxy 2.

PeachCastleNightPlanet.Name: Ending Credits -- Peach's Castle
PeachCastleNightPlanet.Notes: A nighttime version of Peach's Castle used in the credits.

ForestNarrowStepA.Name: Gold Leaf: Tower Section
ForestNarrowStepA.Notes: The huge tower section used in the third mission of Gold Leaf Galaxy.

YoshiClipGhostRoomPlanetClipParts.Name: Haunty Halls -- Bulb Berry Planet Platforms

MagmaSliceRotateStepB.Notes: A set of rotating platforms used on the lava platforms planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

GarigariCutStepCircleHalfRightB.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Small Green Semi-Circle Piece of Wood

This variant opens clockwise.

WoodyDecoratePartsB.Notes: Decorative wood debris from Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

WoodyDecoratePartsA.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Decorative Wood Debris with Tools
WoodyDecoratePartsA.Notes: Decorative wood debris from Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

RayGunPlanetPartsGear.Name: Toy Time: Rotating Wood Gear

YoshiClipGhostRoomPlanet.Name: Haunty Halls -- Bulb Berry Planet Solids
YoshiClipGhostRoomPlanet.Notes: The solid platforms of Haunty Halls Galaxy's bulb berry section.

SwitchCylinder.Notes: An area that activates a switch once the player enters it.

GoodWeatherSky.Notes: The sky model used in Yoshi Star Galaxy and Cloudy Court Galaxy.

TreasureBoxCrackedEmpty.Notes: A gray treasure chest that reveals nothing when opened.

CloudSky.Name: Generic Cloud Sky

MorphItemNeoFoo.Notes: A Flying Star that transforms the player into a Flying character.

BeyondPhantomSky.Notes: The sky model from Haunty Halls Galaxy which features a large moon.

BombZoneGravityDisplayPanel.Name: Upside Dizzy -- Red Gravity Indicator Wall
BombZoneGravityDisplayPanel.Notes: A red wall piece that is used to indicate the direction of gravity in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

A large moon planet with a bright half and a dark half, just like the real life moon.

Seen in Deep Dark Galaxy as a full moon on Kamella's battle entrance cutscene.

SliderStartSlopeA.Name: Rolling Coaster -- Starting Planet

Kameck.Name: Fire Ball Magikoopa
Kameck.Notes: A Magikoopa that casts fire balls.

RepeartTimerSwitch.Notes: A timer switch that activates and deactivates something periodically.

MiniTamakoroExLv1Galaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Rolling Green Galaxy.

SwitchBox.Name: Red "?" Block

An unusual looking red and pink "?" block.

Behaves like a regular "?" block but does not drop anything, instead it fires the events linked to it's SW_DEAD

AttackRock.Notes: A yellow orb that appears during the boss fights against Bowser.

TamakoroJumpGuidanceCube.Name: Star Ball Jumping Explanation Area [Cube]
TamakoroJumpGuidanceCube.Notes: An area which shows the player how to jump with the Star Ball while inside it. The cube's origin is the base's center.

DodoryuClosedCylinder.Name: Block Major Burrows Area [Cylinder]
DodoryuClosedCylinder.Notes: An area that blocks Major Burrows from entering it.

StringSpider.Name: Sprangler
StringSpider.Notes: A spider-like enemy that hangs from a web.

BossKameckMoveRail.Notes: Specifies an individual subpath that Kamella can move on.

CaretakerGarbage.Name: "CaretakerGarbage" [Unused]
CaretakerGarbage.Notes: An unused garbage cart for a Gearmo. Has no collision.

GhostShipCavePipeCollision.Name: Deep Dark: Invisible Pipe Collision
GhostShipCavePipeCollision.Notes: Invisible collision for the water pipes in the Deep Dark Galaxy.

AssemblyBlockPartsTimerA.Name: Timed Space Junk Block
AssemblyBlockPartsTimerA.Notes: A long rectangular transparent Space Junk Block; used in Bowser's Galaxy Reactor.

CollectTico.Name: Silver Star Controller
CollectTico.Notes: A controller that keeps track of Silver Stars the player has collected. See StrayTico for individual Silver Stars.

HugeHammerPlanet.Name: Clockwork Ruins -- Hammers Planet
HugeHammerPlanet.Notes: The planet with the rotating hammers from Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

BattleIceMerameraPlanet.Notes: The ice planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Li'l Brrs.

SandyFlowSandAfterBattlePlanet.Name: Slipsand -- After Squizzard Battle Planet
SandyFlowSandAfterBattlePlanet.Notes: The planet without the moving sand that appears after Squizzard is defeated in Slipsand Galaxy.

JewelRelayPlanetA.Name: Boulder Bowl -- Crystal Planet

PlantSlider.Notes: A vine that can be used to reach other places in a galaxy. This one leads into one direction only and the player doesn't have to shake the Wiimote.

LavaFloaterTrapezoid.Name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Sinking Trapezoid Platform
LavaFloaterTrapezoid.Notes: A trapezoid-shaped platform that sinks when the player stands on it.

CoinRoomBrickFlatBrownPlanet.Name: Flat Bonus Room
CoinRoomBrickFlatBrownPlanet.Notes: The bonus room used in several galaxies.

SliderSnowFrontWall.Name: Freezy Flake -- Slide Blockade
SliderSnowFrontWall.Notes: A blockade used to block the entrance to the slide during the second mission of Freezy Flake Galaxy.

KoopaJrRobotBreakPlanet.Name: Boom Bunker -- Destroyed Megahammer Planet
KoopaJrRobotBreakPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

KuriboMini.Notes: A small round Goomba that drops one Coin when jumped on and a Star Bit if spun (always a Coin in SMG1).

MeteorStrikeEnvironment.Name: Decorative Meteors
MeteorStrikeEnvironment.Notes: A decorative version of the falling meteors that appears in Melty Molten Galaxy.

SeaBottomTriplePropeller.Name: Buoy Base: Propellers
SeaBottomTriplePropeller.Notes: A group of three yellow propellers inlined with each other found under Buoy Base.

BeyondOrbitSky.Name: Fiery Flotilla Sky
BeyondOrbitSky.Notes: The sky model from Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla and Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

CoinInsidePearPlanetCover.Name: Spin-Dig -- Pear Planet Exterior
CoinInsidePearPlanetCover.Notes: The exterior of the pear planet used in the first mission of Spin-Dig Galaxy.

DarknessRoomAir.Name: Green Void Atmosphere
DarknessRoomAir.Notes: The green void atmosphere used in Ghostly Galaxy and Matter Splatter Galaxy.

VsKingTossinPlanet.Name: Boulder Bowl -- Rollodillo Planet
VsKingTossinPlanet.Notes: The planet where Rollodillo is fought in Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

GarigariCutStepFlatMiniB.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Short Piece of Wood
GarigariCutStepFlatMiniB.Notes: A short piece of wood; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

Gesso.Name: Blooper
Gesso.Notes: A squid-like enemy usually used underwater.

GarigariCutStepFlatMiniA.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Short Piece of Wood with Nails
GarigariCutStepFlatMiniA.Notes: A short piece of wood with nails; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

PoleUnizoPlanet.Name: Red Urchin Pole Planet (Unused)
PoleUnizoPlanet.Notes: A strange rocky planet with a name referring to the fuzzy red Urchins found in hot galaxies. It has a low-poly model, but it is identical. Unlike the other unused planets, this one has an entire unused zone dedicated to it.

GravityFollowLiftLongPanel.Name: Upside Dizzy -- Platform with Long Gravity Panel

BattleAsteroidCloud.Name: Battle Belt -- Decorative Asteroid Belt

Takobo.Notes: A blue Octopus Goomba-like enemy. In SMG1 it swings its head at the player when they get close. In SMG2 it spits rocks at them.

PoisonSwanpRailMoveSeesaw.Name: Boom Bunker -- Tilting Seesaw Platform
PoisonSwanpRailMoveSeesaw.Notes: A tilting seesaw-like platform used on the Dark Matter planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

BeyondSummerSky.Name: Fluffy Bluff Sky
BeyondSummerSky.Notes: The cloudy sky model from Fluffy Bluff Galaxy and Starshine Beach Galaxy.

GliderChangeVisiblePillar.Name: Fleet Glide -- Long Pillar
GliderChangeVisiblePillar.Notes: A long pillar that becomes transparent; used in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

DepthOfFieldArea.Name: Depth of Field Area
DepthOfFieldArea.Notes: An area that changes the screen depth if the player enters it.

BossPlanetR50.Name: "BossPlanetR50" [Unfinished]
BossPlanetR50.Notes: An huge unused planet with 14 smaller planets surrounding it.

CloudSliderObstacle.Name: Cloudy Court -- Wooden Obstacle
CloudSliderObstacle.Notes: A box-shaped wood obstacle used in Cloudy Court Galaxy.

Meister.Name: Lubba
Meister.Notes: The large purple Luma that helps the player throughout their adventure in Super Mario Galaxy 2.

DiskGardenPlanet.Name: Good Egg -- Starting Planet
DiskGardenPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Good Egg Galaxy.

IceMeteor.Name: Falling Ice Crystal
IceMeteor.Notes: A falling ice crystal that creates an ice platform that can be stood on.

RailMoveWaterAreaPlanet.Name: Cosmic Cove -- Water Cubes Planet
RailMoveWaterAreaPlanet.Notes: The planet with moving water cubes used in the second mission of Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

GarigariCutStepCircle.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Circle Piece of Wood
GarigariCutStepCircle.Notes: A circular-shaped piece of wood; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

DeathSphere.Name: Death Area [Sphere]
DeathSphere.Notes: An area that kills the player and several other objects when entered.

LavaProminence.Name: Fireball
LavaProminence.Notes: A fireball used in lava-themed galaxies.

SweetDecoratePartsOrange.Name: Decorative Orange
SweetDecoratePartsOrange.Notes: A decorative orange from Toy Time Galaxy.

ArrowSwitchMulti.Name: Multi-Use Arrow Switch
ArrowSwitchMulti.Notes: An arrow-shaped switch that rotates once it gets triggered. Can be triggered multiple times.

UFOKinokoLanding.Name: Landed Starshroom
UFOKinokoLanding.Notes: A landed spaceship in the shape of a Toad head.

GrandStar.Name: Grand Star
GrandStar.Notes: The Grand Star that is collected at the end of a major boss level.

UFOBlueStarCupsule.Name: Pull Star UFO Platform
UFOBlueStarCupsule.Notes: A UFO platform with a usable Pull Star inside the glass capsule on the top side.

CloudStep.Name: Cloud Platform
CloudStep.Notes: A small cloud platform that can be stood on with the Bee or Cloud power-ups.

YoshiBlock.Name: "YoshiBlock" [Broken]
YoshiBlock.Notes: Model files have been removed. Therefore, the object is useless.

AquariumPlanetB.Name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Sea Mine Planet
AquariumPlanetB.Notes: The large planet found in Cosmic Cove Galaxy's 2D section that features Jammyfish and Sea Mines.

AquariumPlanetA.Name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Underwater Planet
AquariumPlanetA.Notes: The large planet found in the 2D underwater section from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

CannonUnderConstructionB.Name: Under-Construction Cannon 2nd Stage
CannonUnderConstructionB.Notes: A decorative cannon that is still under-construction.

CannonUnderConstructionA.Name: Under-Construction Cannon 1st Stage
CannonUnderConstructionA.Notes: A decorative cannon that is still under-construction.

TicoCoin.Name: Comet Medal
TicoCoin.Notes: A collectable octagonal-shaped medal with a picture of a Comet on it.

BigCloudStep.Name: Fluffy Bluff -- Large Cloud Platform
BigCloudStep.Notes: A large cloud platform that can be stood on using the Bee and Cloud power-ups.

MarioActor.Name: Mario/Luigi
MarioActor.Notes: Creates a clone of the player that can be controlled. May also be used as the actual spawn point. Should not be used in actual levels!

MiniPhantomGalaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Ghostly
MiniPhantomGalaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Ghostly Galaxy.

Dodoryu.Name: Major Burrows
Dodoryu.Notes: The boss fought at the end of the second mission of Gusty Garden Galaxy and in the Boss Blitz Galaxy.

LavaAcrossFloater.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Small Sinking Platform
LavaAcrossFloater.Notes: A small platform that sinks into the lava in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

WorldMap07Sky.Name: World S Sky
WorldMap07Sky.Notes: The sky model from World S.

GiantRotationPlanet.Name: Clockwork Ruins -- Starting Planet
GiantRotationPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

TubeSliderCoinCreatorPurple.Name: Slider Purple Coin Group
TubeSliderCoinCreatorPurple.Notes: A group of Purple Coins that appear during slide sections.

AstroChildRoom.Name: Comet Observatory -- Gateway Planet
AstroChildRoom.Notes: The small planet from the Comet Observatory that leads to Gateway Galaxy.

KoopaVS1Sky.Name: Star Reactor Sky
KoopaVS1Sky.Notes: The sky model used in Bowser's Star Reactor, Bowser's Lava Lair and Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

Grapyon.Name: Swaphopper
Grapyon.Notes: A blue bug-like enemy with a spike that hops around; intended to be used in 2D sections.

BreakDownFixStepA.Name: Hurry-Scurry -- Stationary Platform
BreakDownFixStepA.Notes: The stationary platform used in Hurry-Scurry Galaxy.

TeresaMansionPlanetB.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Interior
TeresaMansionPlanetB.Notes: The three interior rooms of the haunted mansion, the lobby, the inner room, and the secret attic.

ElectricBazooka.Name: Electric Undergrunt Gunner
ElectricBazooka.Notes: The electricity-shooting Undergrunt Gunner fought at the end of Toy Time Galaxy.

TeresaMansionPlanetA.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Exterior
TeresaMansionPlanetA.Notes: The exterior of the haunted mansion.

AstroDomeGalaxySelector.Name: Level Select Controller
AstroDomeGalaxySelector.Notes: A controller for the galaxy select in the Domes.

TeresaMansionPlanetD.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Lobby
TeresaMansionPlanetD.Notes: A standalone version of the haunted mansion's lobby from TeresaMansionPlanetB but without the staircases.

MiniKoopaBattleVs2Galaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Dark Matter Plant
MiniKoopaBattleVs2Galaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Bowser's Dark Matter Plant.

TeresaMansionPlanetC.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Top Floor
TeresaMansionPlanetC.Notes: The top floor and roof of the haunted mansion.

CloudAcrossValleyCliffPlanet.Name: Fluffy Bluff -- Wall Jump Planet
CloudAcrossValleyCliffPlanet.Notes: The planet with the tall wood walls; used in Fluffy Bluff Galaxy.

SlopeRunningCancelArea.Name: Stop Steep Slope Running Area
SlopeRunningCancelArea.Notes: An area that immediately cancels running on a steep surface when entered.

SwitchingMoveBlockMainPlanetA.Name: Flip-Out -- Main Planet
SwitchingMoveBlockMainPlanetA.Notes: The main planet of Flip-Out Galaxy.

LavaHomePlanet.Name: Melty Molten: Starting Planet
LavaHomePlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Melty Molten Galaxy.

Tongari2D.Name: Spiny Hermit [2D]
Tongari2D.Notes: A variant of a Spiny Hermit for 2D sections.

ElectricBall.Name: Rotating Electric Balls
ElectricBall.Notes: A set of rotating electric balls that are used in Battlerock Galaxy and Dreadnought Galaxy.

DimensionAir.Name: Purple Void Atmosphere
DimensionAir.Notes: The purple void atmosphere used in the background of several bonus areas.

FlowerBlossomRellayPlanet.Name: Supermassive -- Flower Planet
FlowerBlossomRellayPlanet.Notes: The flower planet used for the secret Star mission of Supermassive Galaxy.

SpaceMine.Name: Space Mine
SpaceMine.Notes: A space mine that can be destroyed with a Star Bit or by jumping right into it.

LightCtrlCylinder.Name: Light Area [Cylinder]
LightCtrlCylinder.Notes: An area that changes lighting when entered.

MeteorStrike.Name: Meteor
MeteorStrike.Notes: A falling meteor used in several galaxies, including Melty Molten Galaxy and Hightail Falls Galaxy.

DigMineBigStrongBlockStep.Name: Spin Dig -- Medium Used-Block
DigMineBigStrongBlockStep.Notes: A Medium sized Used-Block used in several galaxies (Flip-Swap Galaxy, Spin-Dig Galaxy, etc.).

SurfRay.Name: Manta Ray (Surfing Minigame)
SurfRay.Notes: The Manta Ray from the Surfing minigame of the Loopdeeloop and Loopdeswoop galaxies.

CubeCameraBowl.Name: Camera Area [Bowl]
CubeCameraBowl.Notes: An area that causes the camera to change when the player enters it.

BrightSun.Name: Sunlight Effect
BrightSun.Notes: A bright sunlight effect that is used in the background of some levels.

CoinRoomWoodFlatBrownPlanet.Name: Wooden Bonus Room
CoinRoomWoodFlatBrownPlanet.Notes: The wooden bonus room used in Rightside Down Galaxy and Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

SkeletalFishBabyRail.Name: "SkeletalFishBabyRail" [Useless]
SkeletalFishBabyRail.Notes: A useless object that has no actual effect in-game.

DesertSky.Name: Dusty Dune Sky
DesertSky.Notes: The clear blue sky model used in Dusty Dune Galaxy.

KoopaJrNormalShipA.Name: Airship
KoopaJrNormalShipA.Notes: A standard airship with nothing special about it.

MiniPlanetAcrossPlanetMistA.Name: Yoshi Star -- Grass Bonus Planet Trails
MiniPlanetAcrossPlanetMistA.Notes: The planet path trails used on the grass bonus planet in Yoshi Star Galaxy.

FollowerDrillInsidePlanetCover.Name: Spin-Dig -- Silver Star Planet Exterior
FollowerDrillInsidePlanetCover.Notes: The large metal cover used on the exterior of the Silver Star planet in Spin-Dig Galaxy.

SwitchingMoveBlockStartPlanet.Name: Flip-Out -- Starting Planet
SwitchingMoveBlockStartPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Flip-Out Galaxy.

TicoStarRing.Name: Trial Galaxies Launch Star
TicoStarRing.Notes: The green launch stars spawned on the Planet of Trials to take you to each Trial Galaxy.

Jellyfish.Name: Jammyfish
Jellyfish.Notes: A small white jellyfish that can be defeated with a spin attack.

ChallengeGliderStartPlanet.Name: Fleet Glide -- Battleship Planet
ChallengeGliderStartPlanet.Notes: The starting planet and battleship used in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

EarthenPipeInWater.Name: Underwater Warp Pipe
EarthenPipeInWater.Notes: A Warp Pipe with a vortex that sucks in the player if they are nearby.

ViewGroupCtrlArea.Name: View Group Area
ViewGroupCtrlArea.Notes: When entered by the player, all compatible objects in its ViewGroup will be forced to render.

CannonStormGCapturePlanet.Name: Dreadnought -- Pull Stars Planet
CannonStormGCapturePlanet.Notes: The Pull Stars section from Dreadnought Galaxy.

DashFruit.Name: Dash Pepper
DashFruit.Notes: The red pepper that Yoshi can eat to obtain the Dash power-up.

TubeSliderGoalPlanet.Name: Tall Trunk -- Slide Goal Planet
TubeSliderGoalPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the end of the slide in Tall Trunk Galaxy.

MameMuimuiScorer.Name: Skate Challenge Controller [Freezy Flake]
MameMuimuiScorer.Notes: A controller used to control The Chimp's skating challenge in Freezy Flake Galaxy.

TogepinScorer.Name: Bowling Challenge Controller
TogepinScorer.Notes: A controller that sets up bowling challenges and controls the scoring.

ChildSkeletalFishBaby.Name: Swimming Gringill [Child]
ChildSkeletalFishBaby.Notes: A Swimming Gringill that is used for special ChildObj setups.

ChallengeBallRotateBridgeA.Name: Rolling Gizmo -- Rotating Bridge
ChallengeBallRotateBridgeA.Notes: The rotating bridge found in Rolling Gizmo Galaxy.

SliderGoalSlopeA.Name: Rolling Coaster -- Goal Ramp Planet
SliderGoalSlopeA.Notes: The long ramp leading to the goal platform; used in Rolling Coaster Galaxy.

DashYoshiTimerBridgePartsB.Name: Hightail Falls -- Large Stone Platform
DashYoshiTimerBridgePartsB.Notes: The falling large stone platforms used in the first mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

KoopaBattleSky.Name: Bowser Fight Sky
KoopaBattleSky.Notes: The sky model used during the fights against Bowser in Bowser's Lava Lair, Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet and Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

MagmaMonsterSmallPlanetStepBurn.Name: Melty Monster -- Magmaw Planet Small Burned Asteroid
MagmaMonsterSmallPlanetStepBurn.Notes: A burned version of the stone planet used at the end of the first mission of Melty Monster Galaxy.

DashYoshiTimerBridgePartsA.Name: Hightail Falls -- Small Stone Platform
DashYoshiTimerBridgePartsA.Notes: The falling small stone platforms used in the first mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

Yukkina.Name: Sorbetti
Yukkina.Notes: The rolling snow ball boss from Freezy Flake Galaxy.

GoroRockLanePartsHole.Name: Bowling Challenge -- Blue Platform with Gap
GoroRockLanePartsHole.Notes: A flat blue platform with a gap used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

LavaBreakRockA.Name: Melty Molten: Tipping Platform A (Lava Spire Planet)
LavaBreakRockA.Notes: A rock platform used on the lava spire planet in Melty Molten Galaxy. (This object requires an SW_A switch to function.)

VsOtaRockTankIcePlanet.Name: Shiverburn -- Prince Pikante Planet
VsOtaRockTankIcePlanet.Notes: The planet where Prince Pikante is fought in Shiverburn Galaxy.

SandUpDownKGBaseEffect.Name: Moving Tower Effect (Bullet Bill)
SandUpDownKGBaseEffect.Notes: A moving tower effect from Dusty Dunes Galaxy.

DustFlower.Name: Flowers Debris
DustFlower.Notes: A set of flowers used as space debris.

OldFortressUnderCover.Name: Throwback -- Bottom Fortress Cover
OldFortressUnderCover.Notes: The cover used at the bottom of Throwback Galaxy.

Pole2Way.Name: Wood Pole [Two-Sided Climbing]
Pole2Way.Notes: An alternate version of the wooden pole which can be climbed on two sides only.

SuperSpinDriverGreen.Name: Launch Star
SuperSpinDriverGreen.Notes: A large green star that launches the player from one planet to another.

HeavensDoorInsideCage.Name: Large Glass Cage
HeavensDoorInsideCage.Notes: A large glass cage, used most notoriously on Gateway Galaxy to hold the grand star, but is used elsewhere.

KoopaFinalBattlePos.Name: Bowser [Final Encounter]
KoopaFinalBattlePos.Notes: The final boss battle from Bowser's Galaxy Generator that takes place in the sky.

MagmaMonsterBigPlanet.Name: Melty Monster -- Large Lava Planet
MagmaMonsterBigPlanet.Notes: A large lava-covered planet used at the start of Melty Monster Galaxy.

TurtleBeamKameck.Name: Koopa Shell Magikoopa
TurtleBeamKameck.Notes: A Magikoopa that casts Koopa Shells.

DossunBig.Name: Massive Thwomp
DossunBig.Notes: A massive Thwomp used in Supermassive Galaxy that falls periodically.

NeedlePlantFly.Name: Flying Spiky Plant
NeedlePlantFly.Notes: A flying spiky plant that damages the player when touched.

SandUpDownTowerBreakableWallB.Name: Dusty Dune -- Destroyable Crate B
SandUpDownTowerBreakableWallB.Notes: A tall destroyable wood box from Dusty Dune Galaxy.

SandUpDownTowerBreakableWallA.Name: Dusty Dune -- Destroyable Crate A
SandUpDownTowerBreakableWallA.Notes: A tall destroyable wood box intended to be used in Dusty Dune Galaxy.

TeresaRoomGlaringLight.Name: Deep Dark -- Boo Box Light Beam
TeresaRoomGlaringLight.Notes: A decorative beam of light that is used in the Boo Box in Deep Dark Galaxy.

UnbabaSlim.Name: Magmaw
UnbabaSlim.Notes: A smaller version of a Magmaargh.

BrokenHolePlanet.Name: Lava Reactor -- Starting Planet
BrokenHolePlanet.Notes: The starting planet used in Bowser Jr.'s Lava Reactor.

ForestAppearStepA.Name: Honeyhive: Wooden Bridge
ForestAppearStepA.Notes: A wooden bridge used in the second mission of Honeyhive Galaxy.

BeyondSandNightSky.Name: Slipsand Nighttime Sky
BeyondSandNightSky.Notes: The nighttime sky model from Slipsand Galaxy that features several large towers.

FlagSurfing.Name: Penguin Flag
FlagSurfing.Notes: A flag with a penguin face on it. Seen in the background of Loopdeeloop Galaxy and Loopdeeswoop Galaxy.

PoleTreeB.Name: Pine Tree
PoleTreeB.Notes: A pine tree used in Fluffy Bluff Galaxy that can be climbed.

SandyFlowSandPlanet.Name: Slipsand -- Squizzard Planet
SandyFlowSandPlanet.Notes: The planet where Squizzard is fought in Slipsand Galaxy.

BloomCylinder.Name: Bloom Effect Area [Cylinder]
BloomCylinder.Notes: An area that enables bloom shading for compatible objects inside it.

FlowerBlueGroup.Name: Blue Flower Group
FlowerBlueGroup.Notes: A group of decorative blue flowers.

GoroRockDashPanel.Name: Decorative Rock Boost Ramp
GoroRockDashPanel.Notes: A decorative ramp used in sections where the Rock power-up's rolling speed is increased. The actual boost is done by ForceDashCube.

PoleTreeA.Name: Bubbly Tree
PoleTreeA.Notes: A round tree used in Throwback Galaxy that can be climbed.

BroadBeanMoveStepB.Name: Good Egg -- Long Moving Stone Step
BroadBeanMoveStepB.Notes: A long moving stone block used in Good Egg Galaxy.

BroadBeanMoveStepA.Name: Good Egg -- Large Moving Stone Step
BroadBeanMoveStepA.Notes: A large moving stone block used in Good Egg Galaxy.

Chorobon.Name: Fuzzy
Chorobon.Notes: A black spiky enemy that appears in both Honeybloom Galaxy and Flipsville Galaxy.

BindEndCube.Name: "BindEnd" Area [Cube, Useless]
BindEndCube.Notes: A useless area object that has no actual effect in-game.

FlameGun.Name: Fire Ball Pig
FlameGun.Notes: A pig statue that shoots invisible fire balls. It's very unfinished.

TreasureBoxCrackedKinokoLifeUp.Name: Cracked Treasure Chest with Life Mushroom
TreasureBoxCrackedKinokoLifeUp.Notes: A gray treasure chest that reveals a Life Mushroom when opened.

FlipTurnMoveStep.Name: Throwback -- Moving Wood Platform
FlipTurnMoveStep.Notes: A moving and rotating wood platform used near the top of Throwback Galaxy.

NeedlePlant.Name: Spiky Plant
NeedlePlant.Notes: A spiky plant that damages the player when touched.

IslandFleetDiscPlanet.Name: Sky Station -- Disk Planet
IslandFleetDiscPlanet.Notes: A disk planet used before the Peewee Piranha boss fight at the end of the first mission of Sky Station Galaxy.

MarioLauncherAttractor.Name: Player Cannon Gravity
MarioLauncherAttractor.Notes: A gravity area that attracts the player towards its center point while they are being launched from a cannon.

FollowerDrillInsidePlanet.Name: Spin-Dig -- Silver Star Planet Interior
FollowerDrillInsidePlanet.Notes: The interior section of the planet used at the end of the second mission of Spin-Dig Galaxy.

GiantTeresaCircleConveyor.Name: Haunty Halls -- Starting Planet Rotating Carpet
GiantTeresaCircleConveyor.Notes: A rotating circular-shaped carpet used on the starting planet of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

LavaBubble2DPlanet.Name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Lava Bubble Planet
LavaBubble2DPlanet.Notes: The planet where you dodge Lava Bubbles and Cheep Cheeps in Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

MorphItemCollectionHopper.Name: Decorative Spring Mushroom
MorphItemCollectionHopper.Notes: A Spring Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

RotateClimbRockTop.Name: Clockwork Ruins -- Top Rotating Wheel
RotateClimbRockTop.Notes: The top wheel of a pair of wheels used on the rolling wheels planet of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

CelestrialArea.Name: Limited Flying Range Area
CelestrialArea.Notes: An area that will keep the player in if they are using the Flying power-up.

PowerStarAppearPoint.Name: Power Star Spawn Point
PowerStarAppearPoint.Notes: A spawn point where a grouped Power Star can appear.

BlueChip.Name: Blue Chip
BlueChip.Notes: A collectable blue chip. Usually, five of them have to be collected.

DashYoshiObstaclePole.Name: Hightail Falls -- Pole
DashYoshiObstaclePole.Notes: A pole obstacle used in Hightail Falls Galaxy.

SpaceStickA.Name: Space Junk: Rock Stick A
SpaceStickA.Notes: A long rock stick from the pullstar section in Space Junk Galaxy.

PukupukuGambolPlanet.Name: Deep Dark: Cheep Cheep Planet
PukupukuGambolPlanet.Notes: A small planet with a pool used in the second mission of Deep Dark Galaxy.

OnimasuPlanetObstaclePartsA.Name: Beach Bowl: Wooden Triangle (Cyclone Stone Planet)
OnimasuPlanetObstaclePartsA.Notes: A triangular-shaped piece of wood used on the cyclone stone planet in Beach Bowl Galaxy.

TriangleTowerRailMoveStepSpring.Name: Chompworks -- Spring Tower Moving Platform
TriangleTowerRailMoveStepSpring.Notes: A gray moving platform used on the spring tower planet in Chompworks Galaxy.

AsteroidBlockRotateStepA.Name: Toy Time -- Yellow Rotating Platform
AsteroidBlockRotateStepA.Notes: A yellow rotating platform used on the 8-Bit Mario planet in Toy Time Galaxy.

BigBubble.Name: Big Bubble
BigBubble.Notes: An unused standalone version of the Big Bubble that does not render. Can be entered and controlled by Mario.

SpaceStickB.Name: Space Junk: Rock Stick B
SpaceStickB.Notes: Another long rock stick from the pullstar section in Space Junk Galaxy.

LavaRotateStepsRotatePartsD.Name: Melty Molten: Rotating Platforms (Yellow)
LavaRotateStepsRotatePartsD.Notes: A set of yellow rotating platforms used in Melty Molten Galaxy.

LavaRotateStepsRotatePartsC.Name: Melty Molten: Rotating Platforms (Green)
LavaRotateStepsRotatePartsC.Notes: A set of green rotating platforms used in Melty Molten Galaxy.

KoopaBattleMapStair.Name: Collapsible Bowser Stairs Platform
KoopaBattleMapStair.Notes:
The collapsible* green and white platform that makes up the stairs in Bowser's Star Reactor and Bowser's Galaxy Reactor.

* Collapses when hit by a meteor shot by Bowser/Bowser Jr. or other means.

LavaRotateStepsRotatePartsB.Name: Melty Molten: Rotating Platforms (Blue)
LavaRotateStepsRotatePartsB.Notes: A set of blue rotating platforms used in Melty Molten Galaxy.

SnowBlockA.Name: Snow Cap -- Snow Mushroom
SnowBlockA.Notes: A destroyable mushroom which is made of snow; from Snowcap Galaxy.

LavaRotateStepsRotatePartsA.Name: Melty Molten: Rotating Platforms (Red)
LavaRotateStepsRotatePartsA.Notes: A set of red rotating platforms used in Melty Molten Galaxy.

StrongBlock2D.Name: Used Block [2D]
StrongBlock2D.Notes: A small Used Block used during SMG2's prologue.

BigPunchBoxStep.Name: Supermassive -- Huge Brick Block
BigPunchBoxStep.Notes: A huge Brick Block platform used in Supermassive Galaxy.

ChildRoomSky.Name: Toy Time Sky
ChildRoomSky.Notes: The colorful sky model used in Toy Time Galaxy.

KillerGunnerDouble.Name: Bullet Bill Blaster (Double)
KillerGunnerDouble.Notes: A set of opposite-facing cannons that launch Bullet Bills.

TicoSeedGuidanceCube.Name: Hungry Luma Feeding Explanation Area [Cube]
TicoSeedGuidanceCube.Notes: An area which shows the player how to feed the Hungy Luma with Star Bits. This is useless in SMG2. The cube's origin is the base's center.

SpaceCocoon.Name: Sling Pod
SpaceCocoon.Notes:
A weird spiderweb-like object which Mario and certain NPCs (Toads) can attach to and then be launched in a straight line by pulling it with the star pointer holding A in the opposite direction of the desired launch and then releasing A. How far back you pull it also affects the speed and distance of the launch. There is no way to detach yourself or an NPC to it other than launching.

Extra Notes: If you are setting up a Tarantox battle, do not use this object, but it's special variant for Tarantox called SpiderAttachPoint.

AstroTorchLightRed.Name: Red Comet Observatory Torch Light
AstroTorchLightRed.Notes: The red torch light used in the Comet Observatory.

Torpedo.Name: Torpedo Ted Spawner
Torpedo.Notes: A spawner for torpedo-like enemies that may home onto the player if they get in its range.

GarigariCutPlanetPartsD.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Long Oblique Piece of Wood
GarigariCutPlanetPartsD.Notes: A long oblique piece of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

TamakoroMoveGuidanceCube.Name: Star Ball Moving Explanation Area [Cube]
TamakoroMoveGuidanceCube.Notes: An area which shows the player how to move with the Star Ball while inside it. The cube's origin is the base's center.

RestartObj.Name: Checkpoint Flag
RestartObj.Notes: A checkpoint flag used in several galaxies.

GarigariCutPlanetPartsA.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Wall Jump Shaft
GarigariCutPlanetPartsA.Notes: A wooden wall-jump shaft used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

DesertMovingLand.Name: Dusty Dune -- Large Moving Sand Disk
DesertMovingLand.Notes: A large sand disk from Dusty Dune Galaxy that can move.

GarigariCutPlanetPartsC.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Pink Wood Staircase
GarigariCutPlanetPartsC.Notes: A pink wood staircase used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

LavaProminenceWithoutShadow.Name: Fireball without Shadow
LavaProminenceWithoutShadow.Notes: A fireball with no shadow; used in Melty Molten Galaxy.

WaterfallL.Name: Large Beach Bowl Waterfall Effect
WaterfallL.Notes: A large and wide waterfall effect used in Beach Bowl Galaxy.

GarigariCutPlanetPartsB.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Blue Wood Staircase
GarigariCutPlanetPartsB.Notes: A blue wood staircase used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

UFOKinoko.Name: Starshroom
UFOKinoko.Notes: A spaceship in the shape of a Toad head.

BreakableFixation.Name: Breakable Anchor
BreakableFixation.Notes: The breakable anchor used in Buoy Base Galaxy.

PoleSquare.Name: Wood Pole
PoleSquare.Notes: A wooden square pole that can be climbed on four sides.

SeaBottomTriplePropellerStand.Name: Buoy Base: Propellers Fixation
SeaBottomTriplePropellerStand.Notes: A fixation for the three propellers in Buoy Base Galaxy.

WaterBazookaTowerMoveStepA.Name: Gold Leaf -- Grassy Tower Platforms
WaterBazookaTowerMoveStepA.Notes: A pair of moving grass platforms found on top of Gold Leaf Galaxy's tower.

WaterBazookaTowerMoveStepB.Name: Gold Leaf -- High Tower Stair
WaterBazookaTowerMoveStepB.Notes: A pair of high stair blocks from the Undergrunt Gunner arena at the top of Gold Leaf Galaxy's tower.

BigTreeLeafSplash.Name: Tall Trunk -- Leaf Effect
BigTreeLeafSplash.Notes: A leaf effect that makes leaves appear; used in the first mission of Tall Trunk Galaxy.

WaterBazookaTowerMoveStepC.Name: Gold Leaf -- Low Tower Stair
WaterBazookaTowerMoveStepC.Notes: A pair of low stair blocks from the Undergrunt Gunner arena at the top of Gold Leaf Galaxy's tower.

OnimasuPlanetPartsGoal.Name: Beach Bowl: Cyclone Stone Planet (Section B)
OnimasuPlanetPartsGoal.Notes: The second section of the planet used at the end of the third mission of Beach Bowl Galaxy.

LensFlareArea.Name: Lens Flare Area
LensFlareArea.Notes: An area that causes a lens flare on the camera when entered.

ShockWaveGenerator.Name: Shockwave Generator Prism
ShockWaveGenerator.Notes: A steep and tall pyramid-like prism that generates a circular shockwave out of itself when the player spins next to it. The shockwave stuns all nearby enemies, the player is not affected. Only seen in Gateway Galaxy.

KoopaJrSmallShipA.Name: Path-controlled Airship Platform
KoopaJrSmallShipA.Notes:
A small airship-styled platform that moves along an assigned path once activated by the player stepping on it.

Appears to use Path_args 1 and 2 for something.

NewOnimasuPlanet.Name: Stone Cyclone -- Starting Section
NewOnimasuPlanet.Notes: The first section of Stone Cyclone Galaxy.

GlassBottleTall.Name: Toy Time: Glass Bottle
GlassBottleTall.Notes: A large glass bottle used in the first mission of Toy Time Galaxy.

FlagTamakoro.Name: Star Ball Flag
FlagTamakoro.Notes: A flag that shows a stylized golf course. Usedi n Rolling Greens Galaxy, Rolling Gizmo Galaxy and Melty Molten Galaxy.

ScenarioStarter.Name: Galaxy Fly-In Controller
ScenarioStarter.Notes: Sets up the fly-in path an sequence for a Star mission.

CircleStrawberry.Name: Strawberries Circle
CircleStrawberry.Notes: A circle of strawberries that spawns Star Bits when the player shakes the Wii Remote nearby.

MessageAreaCylinder.Name: Display Message Area [Cylinder]
MessageAreaCylinder.Notes: This area forces to display the linked shouting messages when entered.

LavaBegomanCubePlanet.Name: Dreadnought: Cube Planet
LavaBegomanCubePlanet.Notes: The cube-shaped planet used in the third mission of Dreadnought Galaxy.

SurpTransformationExGalaxy.Name: Portal to Sand Spiral Galaxy
SurpTransformationExGalaxy.Notes: A green portal that opens Sand Spiral Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

DashYoshiTimerBridgePlanet.Name: Hightail Falls -- Stone Platforms Planet
DashYoshiTimerBridgePlanet.Notes: The third planet used in the first mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

ReverseGravity2DStartPlanetA.Name: Rightside Down -- Starting Section
ReverseGravity2DStartPlanetA.Notes: The first section of Rightside Down Galaxy.

ForbidTriangleJumpArea.Name: Prevent Angled Wall Jump Area
ForbidTriangleJumpArea.Notes: An area that prevents angled Wall Jumps inside of it.

CloudWind2DPlanet.Name: Cloudy Court -- 2D Castle Planet
CloudWind2DPlanet.Notes: The 2D planet used at the end of Cloudy Court Galaxy.

WaterfallS.Name: Small Beach Bowl Waterfall Effect
WaterfallS.Notes: A small waterfall effect used in Beach Bowl Galaxy.

CollisionBlocker.Name: Collision Blocker
CollisionBlocker.Notes: An invisible force that pushes the player away from it. Usually used in tight corners and sections that may lead to collision glitches.

JellyfishElectric.Name: Jellyfish
JellyfishElectric.Notes: A big blue jellyfish that causes electrical damage to the player if they touch it.

ExtraWallCheckArea.Name: Wall Shadow Cast Area
ExtraWallCheckArea.Notes: An area that when entered creates a blob like shadow to the wall perpendicular to the player. (NOTE: SMG1's AreaShape is BaseOriginCube.)

GliderHoleThroughWallA.Name: Fleet Glide -- Hole Tunnel Planet
GliderHoleThroughWallA.Notes: The tunnel with holes used near the start of Fleet Glide Galaxy.

Creeper.Name: Swingable Flower
Creeper.Notes: A long swingable flower used in many galaxies, including Honeyhive Galaxy and Honeybloom Galaxy.

BeyondDimensionAir.Name: Hungry Luma Atmosphere
BeyondDimensionAir.Notes: The pink atmosphere that surrounds the planets created after feeding a Hungry Luma.

AstroDecoratePartsGearA.Name: Comet Observatory -- Decorative Gears
AstroDecoratePartsGearA.Notes: The rotating gears found inside the glass of the Comet Observatory.

GarigariCutStepFlatB.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Long Red Piece of Wood
GarigariCutStepFlatB.Notes: A long red piece of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

GarigariCutStepFlatA.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Long Blue Piece of Wood
GarigariCutStepFlatA.Notes: A long blue piece of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

MysteryCandyPlanet.Name: Sweet Mystery -- Main Platforms [Wrapped]
MysteryCandyPlanet.Notes: The main platforms of Sweet Mystery Galaxy that are wrapped in packaging.

MiniSkullSharkGalaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Bonefin
MiniSkullSharkGalaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Bonefin Galaxy.

ZeroGravitySphere.Name: Zero Gravity [Sphere Range]
ZeroGravitySphere.Notes: A gravity area of zero gravity. This one has a spherical range.

GarigariCutStepFlatC.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Long Red Piece of Wood with Nail
GarigariCutStepFlatC.Notes: A long red piece of wood with a single nail; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

GravityLightRoad.Name: Gravity Light Beam
GravityLightRoad.Notes: A beam of light used in Bowser galaxies to transport the player between planets.

PoltaBattlePlanet.Name: Ghostly -- Bouldergeist Planet
PoltaBattlePlanet.Notes: The planet where Bouldergeist is fought in Ghostly Galaxy.

AstroDomeBlueStar.Name: Level Select Pull Star
AstroDomeBlueStar.Notes: A variation of the Pull Star that takes you to the galaxy select within Domes.

WorldMapSyncSky.Name: Starship Sky
WorldMapSyncSky.Notes: The sky controller used on Starship Mario that uses a different model depending on the currently selected world.

YoshiFruitBig.Name: Big Orange Fruit
YoshiFruitBig.Notes: A big orange fruit which can be eaten by Yoshi with a strong pull.

KoopaJrLv2LiftForGenerator.Name: Yellow Moving Platform for Generator
KoopaJrLv2LiftForGenerator.Notes: A dummy object that represents an individual platform generated by a KoopaJrLv2LiftGenerator.

ElectricBazookaPlanet.Name: Toy Time -- Undergrunt Gunner Planet
ElectricBazookaPlanet.Notes: The Undergrunt Gunner's planet used in Toy Time Galaxy.

CannonFortressPlanet.Name: Dreadnought -- Main Planet
CannonFortressPlanet.Notes: The titular main planet from Dreadnought Galaxy.

DrillWaterSpringPlanet.Name: Cosmic Cove -- Drill Water Planet
DrillWaterSpringPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the end of the second mission of Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

BasaBasaIce.Name: Ice Swooper
BasaBasaIce.Notes: An icy Swooper that can freeze the player upon contact. Can be defeated using the Ice power-up or the Invincibility power-up.

DarkSpaceStormSky.Name: Space Storm Sky
DarkSpaceStormSky.Notes: The sky model used in Space Storm Galaxy.

HipDropRock.Name: Ground Pound Rock
HipDropRock.Notes: A rock that can be Ground Pounded to drop items.

OnimasuPlanetRotatePartsA.Name: Stone Cyclone -- Large Rotating Platforms
OnimasuPlanetRotatePartsA.Notes: A pair of rotating stone platforms that is used in Beach Bowl Galaxy and Stone Cyclone Galaxy.

OnimasuPlanetRotatePartsB.Name: Stone Cyclone -- Small Rotating Platforms
OnimasuPlanetRotatePartsB.Notes: A set of three small rotating platforms that is used in Beach Bowl Galaxy and Stone Cyclone Galaxy.

GhostMazePlanet.Name: Boo Moon -- Maze Planet
GhostMazePlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Boo Moon Galaxy.

SpinLeverSwitch.Name: Lever Switch
SpinLeverSwitch.Notes: A small blue switch that activates a switch when flipped over.

OldFortressPlanet.Name: Throwback -- Main Planet
OldFortressPlanet.Notes: The main planet used in Throwback Galaxy.

MagmaMonsterSky.Name: Melty Monster Sky
MagmaMonsterSky.Notes: The sky model used in Melty Monster Galaxy.

MysteryCandyDecorateParts.Name: Sweet Mystery -- Decorative Donuts, Pancakes, etc.
MysteryCandyDecorateParts.Notes: A set of decorative donuts, pancakes and more used in the background of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

CubeBubbleExRotateWallL.Name: Bubble Blast -- Green Rotating Platform
CubeBubbleExRotateWallL.Notes: A green rotating metal platform that serves as an obstacle in the Bubble Blast Galaxy.

SignBoardTamakoro.Name: Signboard
SignBoardTamakoro.Notes: A special signboard that provides a tutorial about using Star Balls; used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

RosettaChair.Name: Rosalina's Chair
RosettaChair.Notes: The chair Rosalina sits on during a cutscene.

CubeBubbleExRotateWallS.Name: "CubeBubbleExRotateWallS" [Unfinished]
CubeBubbleExRotateWallS.Notes: An unfinished rotating wall, like the green metal one used in Bubble Blast Galaxy. It has a checkerboard texture.

MiniReverseKingdomGalaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Gold Leaf
MiniReverseKingdomGalaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Gold Leaf Galaxy.

LavaBeforeRepeatBlockFloater.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Large Sinking Platform
LavaBeforeRepeatBlockFloater.Notes: A large platform that sinks into the lava in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

BombHei.Name: Bob-omb
BombHei.Notes: A bomb enemy that explodes after a few seconds (once its fuse is lit).

TeresaRaceGoalPlanet.Name: Ghostly -- Spooky Sprint Goal Planet
TeresaRaceGoalPlanet.Notes: The gloomy planet with a crystal ring that serves as the goal planet of the Spooky Sprint against the Spooky Speedster on Ghostly Galaxy.

GliderCometMedalCage.Name: Comet Medal Cage
GliderCometMedalCage.Notes: A locked cage used to hold the Comet Medal in gliding levels.

SandBirdPartsBlock.Name: Sand Bird Center Block
SandBirdPartsBlock.Notes: A standard sand block used for the Sand Bird in Slipsand Galaxy.

GoroRockCoverCage.Name: Metal Capsule Cage
GoroRockCoverCage.Notes: A glass cage with a metal frame that can only be opened via a switch. Used in Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

MiniHellProminenceGalaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Melty Molten
MiniHellProminenceGalaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Melty Molten Galaxy.

CirclePurpleCoinGroup.Name: Purple Coin Circle
CirclePurpleCoinGroup.Notes: An object that spawns several Purple Coins in a circle.

LavaFluffFallPlanet.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Starting Planet
LavaFluffFallPlanet.Notes: The first planet of Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Foomin.Name: Flomp
Foomin.Notes: A gray flipping tile used in Bowser's Lava Lair and Grandmaster Galaxy.

KoopaJrLv2Lift.Name: Yellow Moving Platform
KoopaJrLv2Lift.Notes: A striped yellow moving platform used in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

CoinRoomBrickBrownPlanet.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Bonus Room
CoinRoomBrickBrownPlanet.Notes: A generic bonus room with several brick layers; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

GiantTeresaCirclePlanetParts.Name: Haunty Halls -- Starting Planet Stationary Carpet
GiantTeresaCirclePlanetParts.Notes: An extra carpet with holes used on the starting planet during the second mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

SandUpDownTowerTop.Name: Dusty Dune: Sand Tower
SandUpDownTowerTop.Notes: A sand tower from Dusty Dune Galaxy.

GliderStartWoodPlanet.Name: Wild Glide -- Starting Planet
GliderStartWoodPlanet.Notes: The wooden platform and the section used at the start of Wild Glide Galaxy.

CocoonStepA.Name: Sling Pod -- Starting Platform
CocoonStepA.Notes: A stone platform used at the start of Sling Pod Galaxy.

CocoonStepB.Name: Sling Pod -- Sling Pod Platform
CocoonStepB.Notes: A stone platform on which Sling Pods are placed, used in Sling Pod Galaxy.

BeeJumpBall.Name: Red Honeybloom Berry
BeeJumpBall.Notes: One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.

RollingOvalPlanetParts.Name: Battlerock: Cannon Planet
RollingOvalPlanetParts.Notes: The rotating parts of the cannon planet from Battlerock Galaxy.

FlagPeachCastleC.Name: Peach's Castle Flag C
FlagPeachCastleC.Notes: A flag used on Peach's Castle. Appears to be visually identical with FlagPeachCastleC.

FlagPeachCastleA.Name: Peach's Castle Flag A
FlagPeachCastleA.Notes: A flag used on Peach's Castle. This one has a star icon on it.

SamboHead.Name: Pokey Head
SamboHead.Notes: A green Pokey head used in desert-themed galaxies.

FlagPeachCastleB.Name: Peach's Castle Flag B
FlagPeachCastleB.Notes: A flag used on Peach's Castle.

DoughnutPlanet.Name: Gusty Garden -- Donut Planet
DoughnutPlanet.Notes: The large donut-shaped planet that is covered in spiny vines. It is located in the Gusty Garden Galaxy.

SupportFlushPoint.Name: Co-Star Mode Butterfly
SupportFlushPoint.Notes: A small orange butterfly that appears in Co-Star Mode only.

WanwanConveyPlanet.Name: Chompworks -- Starting Planet
WanwanConveyPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Chompworks Galaxy.

TeresaRaceStartPlanet.Name: Ghostly -- Spooky Sprint Starting Planet
TeresaRaceStartPlanet.Notes: The gloomy planet with dead trees where the Spooky Speedster challenges the player.

ArrowBoard.Name: Arrow Sign
ArrowBoard.Notes: A large arrow-shaped sign with a red outline.

KoopaJrLv2FloatPlanet.Name: Fearsome Fleet -- Asteroid Planet
KoopaJrLv2FloatPlanet.Notes: An asteroid-like planet seen in the background of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

HopperBeltConveyerRotatePartsA.Name: Toy Time: Conveyor Belt (Ring)
HopperBeltConveyerRotatePartsA.Notes: A ring-shaped conveyor belt used in Toy Time Galaxy.

BigObstructBubbleGenerator.Name: Immovable Big Bubble Generator
BigObstructBubbleGenerator.Notes: Creates Big Bubbles that can't be moved by the player.

RingBeamerRushPlanet.Name: Dreadnought Giant Blue Platform Planet
RingBeamerRushPlanet.Notes: A blue platform with white lines and circles on the floor, large enough to be considered a planet. Used on Dreadnought Galaxy.

TubeSliderCoinCreator.Name: Slider Coin Group
TubeSliderCoinCreator.Notes: A group of Coins that appear during slide sections.

ChoConveyorChocoA.Name: Toy Time -- White Chocolate Wall
ChoConveyorChocoA.Notes: A wall of white chocolate used in Toy Time Galaxy.

BellyDragon.Name: Gobblegut
BellyDragon.Notes: The dragon boss from Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flottila.

RedBlueTurnBlock.Name: Flip-Swap Platform
RedBlueTurnBlock.Notes: A red and blue flipping platform used mainly in Flip-Swap Galaxy.

CannonFortressBreakStepA.Name: Dreadnought -- Collapsing Tower Planet Platform
CannonFortressBreakStepA.Notes: The first platform that breaks off the tower planet in the Dreadnought Galaxy.

Dossun.Name: Thwomp
Dossun.Notes: A large stone block that falls periodically, trying to land on Mario.

LuigiOnMarioParts.Name: Mario Squared -- Yellow Tile
LuigiOnMarioParts.Notes: A yellow tile used on the Comet of Mario Squared Galaxy, instead of the Flipswitches.

MarioFaceAfterGrandStarTakeOffDemoObj.Name: Enter New World Cutscene Object Holder
MarioFaceAfterGrandStarTakeOffDemoObj.Notes: A holder that creates and registers several objects that are used in the cutscene where Starship Mario takes off to a new world after collecting a Grand Star.

HoneyBeeWallClimbPlanet.Name: Honeyhop -- Starting Planet
HoneyBeeWallClimbPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Honeyhop Galaxy.

UFOSandObstacleAEffect.Name: Dusty Dune -- Long Sand Brick Block Effect
UFOSandObstacleAEffect.Notes: Dust cloud particles that are used for a tall object sinking into or emerging from sand. Primarily meant for use with UFOSandObstacleA.

FallRedLeaf.Name: Falling Leaves (Red)
FallRedLeaf.Notes: A falling leaf effect with red leaves.

FireBarSpherical.Name: Curved Fire Bar
FireBarSpherical.Notes: A variant of the Fire Bar whose Fire Balls are slightly curved.

PeachCastleTownAfterAttack.Name: Peach's Castle: Houses (Destroyed)
PeachCastleTownAfterAttack.Notes: A set of destroyed houses used during Bowser's attack on Peach's Castle in SMG1.

BigEarthenPipeGround.Name: Supermassive -- Pipe Dirt
BigEarthenPipeGround.Notes: The dirt platform that is placed inside the large Pipes from Supermassive Galaxy.

MorphItemCollectionDrill.Name: Decorative Spin Drill
MorphItemCollectionDrill.Notes: A Spin Drill used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

TeresaMansionNoGatePlanet.Name: Ghostly -- Starting Planet Underside
TeresaMansionNoGatePlanet.Notes: A variant of TeresaMansionGatePlanet where the dead trees are on the underside and there are no stone structures.

KoopaVS2PartsRestStepB.Name: Dark Matter Plant: Stone Platform (Long+Round Edges)
KoopaVS2PartsRestStepB.Notes:
A long stone platform with round edges from Bowser's Dark Matter Plant.

This one in particular is not used in the game.

MiniIceVolcanoGalaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Freezeflame
MiniIceVolcanoGalaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Freezeflame Galaxy.

BossKameck2.Name: Ghost Ship Kamella
BossKameck2.Notes: A stronger version of Kamella that is fought in Deep Dark Galaxy.

GlobalPlaneGravityInBox.Name: Planar Gravity [Box Range]
GlobalPlaneGravityInBox.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects parallel to the plane. This one has a box range.

FlowerGroup.Name: Yellow Flower Group
FlowerGroup.Notes: A group of decorative yellow flowers.

NonSleepArea.Name: No Sleep Area
NonSleepArea.Notes: An area that prevents the player's sleeping animation and changes their idle animation.

TripodBossCoin.Name: Megaleg Coin
TripodBossCoin.Notes: A regular coin for some reason labelled for Megaleg, but doesn't seem have anything special about it other than broken model clipping.
