WaterFortressPlanet.Name: Space Storm -- Tower Planet
WaterFortressPlanet.Notes: The tower planet from Space Storm Galaxy's second mission.

BossJugem.Name: Giga-Lakitu
BossJugem.Notes: The boss fought at the end of the second mission of Yoshi Star Galaxy.

RollingWaterBreakArea.Name: Pop Rolling Water Bubble Area
RollingWaterBreakArea.Notes: An area that pops rolling water bubbles when they enter it.

BigBubbleCameraBox.Name: Big Bubble Camera Area [Cube]
BigBubbleCameraBox.Notes: An area that causes the camera to change when the player enters it while riding a Big Bubble. The cube's origin is the volume's center.

SignBoard.Name: Signboard
SignBoard.Notes: A generic brown signboard that acts as an NPC.

CometHopperArea.Name: Force Spring Power-Up Area
CometHopperArea.Notes: An area that, when entered, forces the player to use the Spring power-up.

LargeChain.Name: Large Chain
LargeChain.Notes: A large chain of configurable length.

TeresaChief.Name: Boo with Power Star
TeresaChief.Notes: A variant of a Boo that always spawns a Power Star.

ForbidJumpCube.Name: No Shell Jumps Area [Cube]
ForbidJumpCube.Notes: An area that prevents "dolphin" jumps while riding a Koopa Shell. The cube's origin is the base's center.

GCaptureTarget.Name: Pull Star
GCaptureTarget.Notes: A small blue Pull Star that can pull the player towards it.

TimerGravityChangeDrillRoom.Name: Flipsville -- Gravity-Changing Planet
TimerGravityChangeDrillRoom.Notes: The gravity-changing planet used in the second mission of Flipsville Galaxy.

DashYoshiTimerBridgeCometPartsB.Name: Hightail Falls -- Destroyed Large Stone Platform
DashYoshiTimerBridgeCometPartsB.Notes: The falling large stone platforms used in the Comet mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

QuakeEffectAreaCube.Name: Earthquake Area [Cube]
QuakeEffectAreaCube.Notes: An area that periodically shakes the camera and plays a quaking sound effect while the player is inside it.

TransformFaceTicoBabyDemoObj.Name: Starship Mario Transformation Cutscene Object Holder
TransformFaceTicoBabyDemoObj.Notes: A holder that creates and registers some of the objects used for the cutscene where the Starship Mario is created.

PetitPorterWarpPoint.Name: Bonus Planet Teleporter Warp Point
PetitPorterWarpPoint.Notes: A spawn point that is used to define the location where the bonus planet teleporter will teleport the player to.

DrillHoleHiddenArea.Name: Hide Drill Holes Area
DrillHoleHiddenArea.Notes: An area that prevents Spin Drill holes from appearing.

DashYoshiTimerBridgeCometPartsA.Name: Hightail Falls -- Destroyed Small Stone Platform
DashYoshiTimerBridgeCometPartsA.Notes: The falling small stone platforms used in the Comet mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

YoshiFruit.Name: Pink Fruit
YoshiFruit.Notes: A pink fruit which can be eaten by Yoshi.

GliderCliffCreekPlanet.Name: Wild Glide -- Canyon Cliffs Planet
GliderCliffCreekPlanet.Notes: The canyon cliffs section used near the start of Wild Glide Galaxy.

CrystalCageMoving.Name: Trapped Luma Crystal
CrystalCageMoving.Notes: The large moving crystal from Battlerock Galaxy that has Luma trapped inside it.

VsBegomanSpikePlanet.Name: Dreadnought -- Trapped Luma Planet
VsBegomanSpikePlanet.Notes: A planet from Dreadnought Galaxy with lots of colored patches and small towers.

ClipAreaBoxCenter.Name: Box-shaped Matter Splatter Hole [Volume Centered]
ClipAreaBoxCenter.Notes: A box-shaped Matter Splatter hole. The origin is in the center of the box.

BattleKabokuriPlanet.Name: Battle Belt -- Jack O'Goomba Planet
BattleKabokuriPlanet.Notes: The pumpkin planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Jack O'Goombas.

CocoSambo.Name: Spiky Pokey
CocoSambo.Notes: A yellow cactus enemy with spikes on its body that appears in Good Egg Galaxy and Dusty Dune Galaxy.

InfernoMario.Name: "Manekuri" [Broken]
InfernoMario.Notes: Although the class is used for the Cosmic Clones, this object will crash as it tries to load the nonexistent Manekuri model.

TwinFallLakePlanet.Name: Beach Bowl -- Twin Falls Planet
TwinFallLakePlanet.Notes: A pair of two planets with big lakes that are connected by a series of waterfalls and grass platforms. The upper planet features some snowy islands surrounded by an icy mountain range.

PoleNoModel.Name: Invisible Climbable Pole
PoleNoModel.Notes: An invisible version of a pole.

BigSignBoard.Name: Large Signboard
BigSignBoard.Notes: A huge signboard that displays text; used in Supermassive Galaxy.

GhostShipBrokenHead.Name: Sand Spiral: Wrecked Airship
GhostShipBrokenHead.Notes: The wrecked airship that serves as the starting planet in the Sand Spiral Galaxy.

AstroRoomLibrary.Name: Comet Observatory -- Library Interior
AstroRoomLibrary.Notes: The interior of the Comet Observatory's Library.

TogepinAttackMan.Name: The Chimp [Bowling Challenge]
TogepinAttackMan.Notes: The Chimp used for the bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

MiniFactoryGalaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Toy Time
MiniFactoryGalaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Toy Time Galaxy.

SunLightArea.Name: Sunlight Area
SunLightArea.Notes: An unused variant of GlaringLightArea that was meant to be used in Haunty Halls Galaxy, along with TeresaRoomGlaringLight.

YellowChipGroup.Name: Star Chip Group
YellowChipGroup.Notes: Controls a collection of Star Chips and activates something once all are collected.

WaterFortressDoor.Name: Space Storm -- Large Metal Gate
WaterFortressDoor.Notes: A large metal gate from Space Storm Galaxy.

MagmaMonsterSmallPlanetStepBig.Name: Melty Monster -- Magmaw Planet Long Asteroid
MagmaMonsterSmallPlanetStepBig.Notes: A long stone planet used at the end of the first mission of Melty Monster Galaxy.

RosettaReading.Name: Rosalina (Reading)
RosettaReading.Notes:
Rosalina in a sitting pose while holding her storybook*.

* The storybook is actually included within this object's model and is not the separate RosettaPictureBook object.

ClipAreaBoxCenterHighModel.Name: Box-shaped Matter Splatter Hole [Volume Centered, "HighModel"]
ClipAreaBoxCenterHighModel.Notes: A box-shaped Matter Splatter hole. The origin is in the center of the box.

BallOpenerSlider.Name: Rolling Coaster -- Star Ball Opener
BallOpenerSlider.Notes: The round planet from Rolling Coaster Galaxy that features a hole to crack open the Star Ball.

GravityArrow.Name: Gravity Direction Arrow
GravityArrow.Notes: An arrow used to display the direction of Mario's gravity.

BigBubbleGoalAreaCylinder.Name: Pop Big Bubble Area [Cylinder]
BigBubbleGoalAreaCylinder.Notes: An area that pops any Big Bubble inside it. This may also activate a switch.

StrongBlock.Name: Used Block
StrongBlock.Notes: A brown Used Block that serves as a platform in several galaxies.

ExterminationSwitch.Name: Destroy Objects Switch
ExterminationSwitch.Notes: A controller that activates a switch if all objects are destroyed.

EyeBeamer.Name: Eye Beamer
EyeBeamer.Notes: A platform with a large eye that creates a beam that shocks the player upon contact.

DeathSandEnvironmentPyramid.Name: Dusty Dune -- Background Pyramids
DeathSandEnvironmentPyramid.Notes: A set of pyramids used in the background of Dusty Dune Galaxy.

SwingRope.Name: Swinging Vine
SwingRope.Notes: A hanging vine which the player can hold onto and swing around. Used on Beach Bowl Galaxy.

ForbidSupportTicoArea.Name: No Co-Star Pointer Area
ForbidSupportTicoArea.Notes: An area where the function of the Co-Star pointer are disabled.

GravityLightA.Name: Galaxy Reactor: Gravity Spotlight
GravityLightA.Notes: A spotlight that indicates a gravity change. The actual gravity change is done by the gravity controllers.

CloudClimbMountainPlanet.Name: Fluffy Bluff -- Large Tree & Mountains Planet
CloudClimbMountainPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the end of Fluffy Bluff Galaxy.

SpaceDustWoodB.Name: Wood Debris B
SpaceDustWoodB.Notes: Wooden debris that can be found in the Honeyhive and Gold Leaf galaxies.

BattleMerameraPlanet.Name: Battle Belt -- Li'l Cinder Planet
BattleMerameraPlanet.Notes: The lava planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Li'l Cinders.

SpaceDustWoodA.Name: Wood Debris A
SpaceDustWoodA.Notes: Debris of a destroyed ship as seen in Sand Spiral Galaxy.

HipDropSetCylinder.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Starting Planet Ground Pound Block
HipDropSetCylinder.Notes: A square-shaped Ground Pound block used on the first planet of Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

MiniFloaterOtaKingGalaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Lava Reactor
MiniFloaterOtaKingGalaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Bowser Jr.'s Lava Reactor.

WhiteSnowTree.Name: Freezy Flake -- Dead Snow Tree
WhiteSnowTree.Notes: A decorative dead snow tree from Freezy Flake Galaxy.

SnowBall.Name: Snowball
SnowBall.Notes: A snowball that can be made bigger by rolling it through snow. Can be used to destroy several objects as well.

WoodWallDownFall.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Thick Falling Wood Piece
WoodWallDownFall.Notes: A thick piece of wood which falls on a set path; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

KoopaBattleSunPlanet.Name: Star Reactor Sun Planet
KoopaBattleSunPlanet.Notes: The large sun planet that appears at the final location of Bowser's Star Reactor.

SurpSurfingLv2Galaxy.Name: Portal to Loopdeswoop Galaxy
SurpSurfingLv2Galaxy.Notes: A green portal that opens Loopdeeswoop Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

YoshiClimbMountainPlanet.Name: Yoshi Star -- Stepped Mountain Planet
YoshiClimbMountainPlanet.Notes: A tall stepped mountain planet. A similar version of this can be found in Good Egg Galaxy from SMG1.

BeyondTitleSky.Name: Rightside Down Sky
BeyondTitleSky.Notes: The cloudy sky model from Rightside Down Galaxy and the game's Title Screen.

DinoPackunBattlePlanet.Name: Good Egg -- Dino Piranha Planet
DinoPackunBattlePlanet.Notes: The planet where Dino Piranha is fought in the Good Egg and Boss Blitz Galaxies.

PhantomTorch.Name: Blue Flame
PhantomTorch.Notes: A small blue fire used on a torch.

PeachCastleMeteor.Name: Smoking Meteor
PeachCastleMeteor.Notes: A decorative meteor that creates smoke effects; used in the prologue at Peach's Castle.

GhostMazePlanetMask.Name: Boo Moon -- Maze Darkness Mask
GhostMazePlanetMask.Notes: The darkness effect mask used on the maze planet of Boo Moon Galaxy.

TamakoroGarigariFallStepE.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Grinder Platform with Small Ledge
TamakoroGarigariFallStepE.Notes: A wooden platform with a small ledge that is used in the Grinder section in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

TamakoroGarigariFallStepD.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Grinder Platform with Large Ledge
TamakoroGarigariFallStepD.Notes: A wooden platform with a large ledge that is used in the Grinder section in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

TamakoroGarigariFallStepC.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Grinder Staircase Platform
TamakoroGarigariFallStepC.Notes: The second section of the Grinder platforms used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

TamakoroGarigariFallStepB.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Circular Grinder Platform
TamakoroGarigariFallStepB.Notes: The wooden platform where the Comet Medal is located in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

WarpCube.Name: Warp Area [Cube]
WarpCube.Notes: An area that draws a green sphere at its position. It warps the player to a grouped WarpCube if entered. The cube's origin is the base's center.

TamakoroGarigariFallStepA.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Grinder Platform with Holes
TamakoroGarigariFallStepA.Notes: The first section of the Grinder platforms used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

MysteryMountainPlanet.Name: Sweet Mystery -- Wrapped Cake Planet
MysteryMountainPlanet.Notes: The wrapped cake planet that "transforms" into the hidden cake parts from Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

PullTargetDrawer.Name: Wooden Yoshi Pull Block
PullTargetDrawer.Notes: A large wooden block that can be pulled out of a wall using Yoshi's tongue.

MiniHeavenlyBeachGalaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Beach Bowl
MiniHeavenlyBeachGalaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Beach Bowl Galaxy.

TicoRail.Name: Moving Luma
TicoRail.Notes: A decorative Luma that moves on a path.

BrightGalaxySky.Name: Cosmic Cove Sky
BrightGalaxySky.Notes: The sky model used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy, Boulder Bowl Galaxy and Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

ChangeRoom.Name: Starship Mario Character Changer
ChangeRoom.Notes: A room used on Starship Mario that allows the player to switch between Mario and Luigi.

Tongari.Name: Spiny Hermit
Tongari.Notes: A white-shelled enemy with spikes on its back.

BirthdayCakePlanet.Name: Toy Time -- Cake Planet
BirthdayCakePlanet.Notes: The cake planet used in the third mission of Toy Time Galaxy.

OceanSphere.Name: Water Sphere
OceanSphere.Notes: A sphere of water used in various galaxies.

GhostClipPlanetLiftA.Name: Haunty Halls -- Boo Corridor Platform
GhostClipPlanetLiftA.Notes: A moving platform used on the second planet of the second mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

JointBallsPlanetA.Name: Battlerock: Molecule Planet
JointBallsPlanetA.Notes: The multi-colored molecule-shaped planet used in the second mission of Battlerock Galaxy.

LavaMiniSunPlanet.Name: Mini Lava Planet
LavaMiniSunPlanet.Notes: A miniature planet of lava used in the background of lava-themed galaxies.

WanwanRedBluePanelPlanet.Name: Chompworks -- Flip-Swap Planet
WanwanRedBluePanelPlanet.Notes: The planet featuring Flip-Swap panels in the first mission of Chompworks Galaxy.

Snakehead.Name: Large Gringill
Snakehead.Notes: A large eel that comes out of caves.

TimerPieceBlock.Name: Timed Star Bits ? Block
TimerPieceBlock.Notes: A ? Block that gives one Star Bit every time it is hit. Disappears after some hits and seconds.

RotateCrossStep.Name: Twisty Trials -- Moving Wood Gear
RotateCrossStep.Notes: A rotating and moving wood gear used in Twisty Trials Galaxy.

OnimasuCube.Name: "Onimasu" Area [Cube, Useless]
OnimasuCube.Notes: A useless area object that has no actual effect in-game.

AssemblyBlockPartsIceB.Name: Small Icy Space Junk Block
AssemblyBlockPartsIceB.Notes: A small square-shaped icy version of a Space Junk Block.

SoundSyncBlockA.Name: Green Beat Block
SoundSyncBlockA.Notes: A green Beat Block from Beat Block Galaxy.

AssemblyBlockPartsIceC.Name: Very Talll Icy Space Junk Block
AssemblyBlockPartsIceC.Notes: A very tall square-shaped icy version of a Space Junk Block.

SoundSyncBlockB.Name: Yellow Beat Block
SoundSyncBlockB.Notes: A yellow Beat Block from Beat Block Galaxy.

AssemblyBlockPartsIceD.Name: Tall Icy Space Junk Block
AssemblyBlockPartsIceD.Notes: A tall square-shaped icy version of a Space Junk Block.

LavaFluffFallRotateStep.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Starting Planet Rotating Platform
LavaFluffFallRotateStep.Notes: The rotating platform used on the first planet of Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

AssemblyBlockPartsIceE.Name: Narrow Icy Space Junk Block
AssemblyBlockPartsIceE.Notes: A narrow square-shaped icy version of a Space Junk Block.

BattleAsteroidStartPlanet.Name: Battle Belt -- Mini Goomba Planet
BattleAsteroidStartPlanet.Notes: The starting planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features a single Mini Goomba.

DandelionHillPlanet.Name: Gusty Garden -- Major Burrows Planet
DandelionHillPlanet.Notes: The planet where Major Burrows is fought; used in both Gusty Garden Galaxy and Boss Blitz Galaxy.

GlobalSegmentGravity.Name: Cylindrical Gravity
GlobalSegmentGravity.Notes: A gravity area that pulls objects towards the lateral surface of the cylinder.

YoshiCapture.Name: Yoshi Grapple
YoshiCapture.Notes: A flower which Yoshi can grapple with his tongue to swing himself in its direction.

Cactus.Name: Damaging Cactus
Cactus.Notes: A cactus that can damage the player or other objects upon contact.

MarioFaceShipPlanet.Name: Starship Mario -- Main Planet
MarioFaceShipPlanet.Notes: The main planet that makes up the Starship Mario.

SkyIslandStepPartsB.Name: Cloudy Court -- Square Platform with Wood Planks
SkyIslandStepPartsB.Notes: A grassy platform with wood planks; used in Cloudy Court Galaxy.

SkyIslandStepPartsC.Name: Cloudy Court -- Square Platform with Flowers
SkyIslandStepPartsC.Notes: A grassy platform with several flowers; used in Cloudy Court Galaxy.

InvisibleWallBattleShipA.Name: Battlerock Invisible Wall
InvisibleWallBattleShipA.Notes: An invisible wall labeled as a Battlerock Galaxy object, unused.

SearchBeamer.Name: Sentry Beam
SearchBeamer.Notes: A robot enemy that fires a laser at Mario.

SkyIslandStepPartsA.Name: Cloudy Court -- Square Platform with Single Flower
SkyIslandStepPartsA.Notes: A grassy platform with a single flower; used in Cloudy Court Galaxy and Grandmaster Galaxy.

HeadLight.Name: Spotlight
HeadLight.Notes: The spotlight effect used on the starting planet of Boo Moon Galaxy. GhostMazePlanetMask provides the actual darkness.

SunkenShip.Name: Deep Dark -- Sunken Ship
SunkenShip.Notes: A sunken ghost ship that appears on Deep Dark Galaxy's seafloor.

BasaBasa.Name: Swooper
BasaBasa.Notes: A bat enemy that is mostly found in cave sections.

MysteryGravityRoomBridgeA.Name: Gravity Changer Ramp
MysteryGravityRoomBridgeA.Notes:
A small wooden ramp that changes the direction of the player's gravity when walked on. Used in some cubic bonus rooms in SMG1.

Note: Meant for use outside of any gravity area, otherwise may provide unexpected results.

BattleGrapyonPlanetParts.Name: Battle Belt -- Swaphopper Planet Blockade
BattleGrapyonPlanetParts.Notes: A small blockade that covers the exit from Battle Belt Galaxy's Swaphopper planet.

TeresaMansionLightA.Name: Ghostly -- Large Swinging Light
TeresaMansionLightA.Notes: A large swinging ceiling light which projects a focused light beam.

ZeroGravityCylinder.Name: Zero Gravity [Cylinder Range]
ZeroGravityCylinder.Notes: A gravity area of zero gravity. This one has a cylindrical range.

TeresaMansionLightB.Name: Ghostly -- Small Swinging Light
TeresaMansionLightB.Notes: A small swinging ceiling light which projects a focused light beam.

BattanKing.Name: Whomp King
BattanKing.Notes: The large stone block boss from Throwback Galaxy.

MorphItemNeoHopper.Name: Spring Mushroom
MorphItemNeoHopper.Notes: A Spring Mushroom that transforms the player into a Spring character.

MonteStatue.Name: Starshine Beach -- Pianta Statue
MonteStatue.Notes: The large Pianta statue used in Starshine Beach Galaxy.

WanwanRolling.Name: Chomp
WanwanRolling.Notes: A rolling Chomp that moves along a set path.

SnowBlockTicoSearchPlanet.Name: Freezy Flake -- Snow Blocks Planet
SnowBlockTicoSearchPlanet.Notes: The planet with snow blocks and Li'l Brrs used in the first mission of Freezy Flake Galaxy.

OtaRockTank.Name: Prince Pikante
OtaRockTank.Notes: The green octopus boss driving in a wheeled barrel that is fought in Shiverburn Galaxy.

YellowChip.Name: Star Chip
YellowChip.Notes: A collectable yellow chip. Usually, five of them have to be collected.

DinoPackunBabyBattlePlanetAir.Name: Sky Station -- Egg Shell Shards
DinoPackunBabyBattlePlanetAir.Notes: A set of egg shell shards used around Peewee Piranha's planet in Sky Station Galaxy.

SoundEmitterSphere.Name: Sound Emitter Area [Sphere]
SoundEmitterSphere.Notes: An area that starts playing a sound effect when entered. This always has a spherical range.

MirrorArea.Name: Mirror Reflection Area
MirrorArea.Notes: An object that mirrors some compatible objects onto a compatible surface. This is effectively useless in SMG2 since no objects can reflect mirror models.

BenefitItemLifeUp.Name: Life Mushroom
BenefitItemLifeUp.Notes: A collectable mushroom that increases the player's health to 6.

TreasureBoxCoin.Name: Treasure Chest with Coin
TreasureBoxCoin.Notes: A brown treasure chest that reveals a Coin when opened.

RedBlueExStepE.Name: Flip-Swap -- Small Platform
RedBlueExStepE.Notes: A pair of two blocks that serve as a platform; used in Flip-Swap Galaxy.

RedBlueExStepD.Name: Flip-Swap -- Cosmic Guide Platform
RedBlueExStepD.Notes: The platform where the Cosmic Guide appears in Flip-Swap Galaxy.

RedBlueExStepC.Name: Flip-Swap -- Checkpoint Platform
RedBlueExStepC.Notes: The staircase platform where the checkpoint is located in Flip-Swap Galaxy.

RockCreator.Name: Large Boulder Spawner
RockCreator.Notes: A spawner for large rolling boulders.

SwitchingMoveStairsAreaBlockRed.Name: Flip-Out -- Stairs Section Red Walls
SwitchingMoveStairsAreaBlockRed.Notes: A set of red walls used in the first section of Flip-Out Galaxy's main planet.

RedBlueExStepB.Name: Flip-Swap -- Goomba Platform
RedBlueExStepB.Notes: A rectangular platform where Goombas are located in Flip-Swap Galaxy.

TicoShop.Name: Lumalee Shop [Mushrooms]
TicoShop.Notes: A large blue Luma that can transform on the spot into either a Life Mushroom or a 1-Up Mushroom after being paid some Star Bits.

ButlerMap.Name: Polari
ButlerMap.Notes: A dark-brown Luma that displays the map when talked to.

RedBlueExStepF.Name: Flip-Swap -- Power Star Platform
RedBlueExStepF.Notes: The platform where the Power Star is located in Flip-Swap Galaxy.

DashYoshiWallClimbPlanet.Name: Hightail Falls -- Tall Wall Climb Planet
DashYoshiWallClimbPlanet.Notes: The second planet used in the first mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

KoopaJrRobot.Name: Megahammer
KoopaJrRobot.Notes: The boss fought at the end of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

DustCloud.Name: Clouds Debris
DustCloud.Notes: A set of clouds used as space debris.

IceMerameraKing.Name: Baron Brrr
IceMerameraKing.Notes: The boss at the top of the main route of the snow mountain from Freezeflame Galaxy. Behaves and looks very similar to regular Lil' Brrrs (IceMeramera).

RedBlueExStepA.Name: Flip-Swap -- Starting Platforms
RedBlueExStepA.Notes: A set of platforms used as the starting planet of Flip-Swap Galaxy.

AstroOverlookObj.Name: Show Comet Observatory Labels Controller
AstroOverlookObj.Notes: A controller that will show the name labels for the different parts of the Comet Observatory if the player stands inside an AstroOverlookAreaCylinder.

SwitchSphere.Name: Switch Area [Sphere]
SwitchSphere.Notes: An area that activates a switch once the player enters it.

TamakoroGoalRelayStep.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Silver Chomp Planet Ruler
TamakoroGoalRelayStep.Notes: A large ruler platform used on the Silver Chomp planet in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

JumpHoleTamakoroB.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Disk Planet Star Ball Launcher
JumpHoleTamakoroB.Notes: The Star Ball launcher used on the third planet of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

GravityFollowLift.Name: Upside Dizzy -- Platform with Gravity Panel
GravityFollowLift.Notes: A platform with a gravity display panel.

JumpHoleTamakoroA.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Paintbrush Planet Star Ball Launcher
JumpHoleTamakoroA.Notes: The Star Ball launcher used on the second planet of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

CircleCoinGroup.Name: Coin Circle
CircleCoinGroup.Notes: An object that spawns several Coins in a circle.

CloudValleyTowerPlanet.Name: Fluffy Bluff -- Cloud Tower Planet
CloudValleyTowerPlanet.Notes: The cloud tower planet used for the secret Star mission of Fluffy Bluff Galaxy.

Kuribo.Name: Goomba
Kuribo.Notes: The infamous Goomba enemy that appeared in most Mario games since 1985.

FountainBig.Name: Large Water Fountain
FountainBig.Notes: A large water fountain from Gold Leaf Galaxy, Fluffy Bluff Galaxy and other stages.

WorldMapSyncSoundEmitterCube.Name: World Sound Emitter Area [Cube]
WorldMapSyncSoundEmitterCube.Notes: An area that plays a sound effect if the currently selected world matches the specified world. The cube's origin is the base's center.

IceMagmaSkatePlanet.Name: Shiverburn -- Skating Planet
IceMagmaSkatePlanet.Notes: The third planet in the first mission of Shiverburn Galaxy.

BigCloudStepMountainTop.Name: Fluffy Bluff -- Ring Cloud Platform
BigCloudStepMountainTop.Notes: A ring-shaped cloud platform that can be stood on using the Bee and Cloud power-ups.

ExterminateMerameraPlanet.Name: "ExterminateMerameraPlanet" [Unused]
ExterminateMerameraPlanet.Notes: An unfinished planet that consists of three joined lava planets.

MarinePlant.Name: Underwater Plant
MarinePlant.Notes: A decorative plant for underwater sections.

Pole.Name: Climbable Pole
Pole.Notes: A standard climbable pole that can be climbed from all directions.

BarrelGravityAir.Name: Space Storm Foggy Atmosphere
BarrelGravityAir.Notes: The gray foggy air that surrounds the cylindrical planets in Space Storm Galaxy.

BattleKaninaPlanet.Name: Battle Belt -- Crabber Planet
BattleKaninaPlanet.Notes: The sand planet from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Crabbers.

FireBarCoverA.Name: Large Fire Bar Barrel
FireBarCoverA.Notes: A large barrel that is used to hide the Used Block of a Fire Bar. Used in Bowser's Lava Lair.

PostOutlineArea.Name: Post Outline Area
PostOutlineArea.Notes: An area that renders a thick outline on the screen when entered.

CareTakerHunter.Name: Gearmo Enemy Hunter
CareTakerHunter.Notes: A Gold or Silver Gearmo. Used in Boulder Bowl Galaxy and Space Storm Galaxy.

DarkHopperPlanetD.Name: Matter Splatter --Invisible Corridor Planet
DarkHopperPlanetD.Notes: The invisible planet used at the end of Matter Splatter Galaxy.

BothSideDrillTowerPlanet.Name: Flipsville -- Dirt Columns Planet
BothSideDrillTowerPlanet.Notes: The dirt-covered planet used in the second mission of Flipsville Galaxy.

DarkHopperPlanetB.Name: Matter Splatter -- Invisible Wall-Jumping Planet
DarkHopperPlanetB.Notes: The second planet with the Magikoopas used in the Matter Splatter Galaxy.

DarkHopperPlanetC.Name: Matter Splatter -- Invisible Spring Planet
DarkHopperPlanetC.Notes: The invisible planet with the Spring mushroom used in Matter Splatter Galaxy.

RailPlacementPoleObstacle.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Paintbrush Line
RailPlacementPoleObstacle.Notes: An object used to create a line of paintbrushes; used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

KameckShipLv1.Name: Space Junk: Kamella's Airship
KameckShipLv1.Notes: The purple airship where Kamella is fought in Space Junk Galaxy.

ItemRoomItemBase.Name: Starship Mario -- Power-Up Display Case
ItemRoomItemBase.Notes: A display case for the power-up display room used on Starship Mario.

NokonokoLandBig.Name: Big Koopa Troopa
NokonokoLandBig.Notes: A large turtle that can be defeated with the Spin Drill.

InvisibleWallJump10x10.Name: Invisible Wall for Jumping (Size: 10 x 10)
InvisibleWallJump10x10.Notes: An invisible wall for jumping of size 10 x 10.

BakubakuCircleConveyor.Name: Haunty Halls -- Small Rotating Carpet Platform

TeresaRoomPlanet.Name: Deep Dark -- Boo Box Planet
TeresaRoomPlanet.Notes: A large, gilded purple box planet from Deep Dark Galaxy.

CollapsePlane.Name: Shrinking Tile
CollapsePlane.Notes: A green tile that slowly disappears once the player touches it.

SwitchArea.Name: Switch Area
SwitchArea.Notes: An area that activates a switch once the player enters it.

MiniMechaKoopaPartsFan.Name: Toy Time: Factory Fan
MiniMechaKoopaPartsFan.Notes: A rotating fan from the factory planet from Toy Time Galaxy.

WindMillPropeller.Name: Rolling Green -- Windmill Propeller
WindMillPropeller.Notes: The big windmill propeller found at the end of Rolling Green Galaxy.

MysteryFlipPanelBrightPlanet.Name: Sweet Mystery -- Invisible Flipswitch Platforms
MysteryFlipPanelBrightPlanet.Notes: A set of hidden platforms used in the Flipswitch section of Sweet Mystery Galaxy that become visible when using Bulb Yoshi.

ChildKuribo.Name: Goomba [Child]
ChildKuribo.Notes: A Goomba that is used for special ChildObj setups.

HammerHeadPackunSpike.Name: Spiny Piranha Plant
HammerHeadPackunSpike.Notes: A big black Piranha Plant with spikes on its head and body. It can only defeated with another object, such as a Stretch Plant or a Rainbow Star.

KoopaJrSmallShipAGuidePoint.Name: Airship Platform Path Marker
KoopaJrSmallShipAGuidePoint.Notes:
A straight line of orange-ish dots that serve as a visual marker of the path the airship platform* takes on Bowser Jr.'s Airship Armada.

Extra notes:
1) This is entirely decoration, the airship platform* can still function perfectly fine without this object.
2) This object not dynamic, meaning you can change the real path taken by the airship platform*, by adding turns for example, and this object will still be a straight line, therefore entirely useless if you change anything on the real path, unless you remodel this object yourself.

* Reference to the KoopaJrSmallShipA object.

YoshiHeadPlanet.Name: Space Junk -- Yoshi Head Planet
YoshiHeadPlanet.Notes: The wooden Yoshi head planet from Space Junk Galaxy.

GlobalWireGravity.Name: Wire Gravity
GlobalWireGravity.Notes: A gravity area that uses a path to define several points of gravity.

SurpCubeBubbleExLv2Galaxy.Name: Portal to Bubble Blast Galaxy
SurpCubeBubbleExLv2Galaxy.Notes: A green portal that opens Bubble Blast Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

GarigariCutStepFlatThick.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Thick Piece of Wood
GarigariCutStepFlatThick.Notes: A thick piece of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

DorayakiFortressPlanet.Name: Good Egg -- Chomp Saucer Planet
DorayakiFortressPlanet.Notes: The large grass-covered planet with various stone obstacles that is located in Good Egg Galaxy.

HighSpeedLiftRock.Name: Clockwork Ruins -- Stone Elevator Platform
HighSpeedLiftRock.Notes: A stone elevator platform used near the end of the first mission of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

GarigariCutStepFlatThreeCenter.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Triplet Set of Wood Center Piece
GarigariCutStepFlatThreeCenter.Notes: The center piece of a set of three pieces of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

LightCtrlCube.Name: Light Area [Cube]
LightCtrlCube.Notes: An area that changes lighting when entered. The cube's origin is the base's center.

RotateFireBar2DRotateStep.Name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Large Rotating Wheel
RotateFireBar2DRotateStep.Notes: A large rotating wheel used near the end of Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

ChildIceMeramera.Name: Li'l Brr [Child]
ChildIceMeramera.Notes: A Li'l Brr that is used for special ChildObj setups.

HoneyQueenPlanet.Name: Queen Bee Planet
HoneyQueenPlanet.Notes: The planet where the Queen Bee is found. Although this object exists in both games, they have entirely different models in each game.

DarkHopperPlanetA.Name: Matter Splatter -- Invisible Starting Planet
DarkHopperPlanetA.Notes: The first invisible planet used at the start of Matter Splatter Galaxy.

MorphItemCollectionBee.Name: Decorative Bee Mushroom
MorphItemCollectionBee.Notes: A Bee Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

KoopaJrCastleCloudStep.Name: Boom Bunker -- Dark Cloud Platform
KoopaJrCastleCloudStep.Notes: A dark cloud platform used in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker as well as Cloudy Court Galaxy.

RotateStepAthleticPlanet.Name: Twisty Trials -- Wood Platforms
RotateStepAthleticPlanet.Notes: The three solid wood platforms used in Twisty Trials Galaxy.

SandBirdPartsCorner.Name: Sand Bird Corner Block
SandBirdPartsCorner.Notes: A corner piece used for the Sand Bird in Slipsand Galaxy.

AstroDomeDemoStarter.Name: Level Select Fly-Out Cutscene
AstroDomeDemoStarter.Notes: Sets up the cutscene for when the player flies to a galaxy in a Dome.

Drill2DReflectMazeRoom.Name: Spin-Dig -- 2D Maze Planet
Drill2DReflectMazeRoom.Notes: The interior of the cylindrical-shaped planet used in the second mission of Spin-Dig Galaxy.

BeeWallShortDistAreaCube.Name: Faster Bee Flight Area [Cube]
BeeWallShortDistAreaCube.Notes: Allows the Bee power-up to fly a longer distance than usual if the player is inside this area. The cube's origin is the base's center.

ClipCutRoadE.Name: Haunty Halls -- Moving Comet Medal Platform
ClipCutRoadE.Notes: A green moving platform used in the first mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

ClipCutRoadD.Name: Haunty Halls -- Red Horizontal Moving Stone Platform
ClipCutRoadD.Notes: A red moving platform used in the first mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

ClipCutRoadC.Name: Haunty Halls -- Green Horizontal Moving Stone Platform
ClipCutRoadC.Notes: A green moving platform used in the first mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

ClipCutRoadB.Name: Haunty Halls -- Red Diagonal Moving Stone Platform
ClipCutRoadB.Notes: A red moving platform used in the first mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

GarigariCutStepOblique.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Long Oblique Piece of Wood with Holes
GarigariCutStepOblique.Notes: A long oblique piece of wood with several holes; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

GarigariCutStepFlatThinRight.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Right Thin Piece of Wood
GarigariCutStepFlatThinRight.Notes: A right-sided thin piece of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

YoshiEatGuidanceArea.Name: Yoshi Tongue Explanation Area
YoshiEatGuidanceArea.Notes: An area which shows the player how to use Yoshi's tongue.

KoteBug.Name: Flipbug
KoteBug.Notes: A small bug-like enemy that attacks the player in Bee form and runs away from the player under normal conditions.

ClipCutRoadA.Name: Haunty Halls -- Green Vertical Moving Stone Platform
ClipCutRoadA.Notes: A green moving platform used in the first mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

HoleDeathSandMoveStepA.Name: Dusty Dune: Moving Platform (Red)
HoleDeathSandMoveStepA.Notes: A red moving platform used in Dusty Dune Galaxy.

BigRelayPlanetA.Name: Generic Large Asteroid
BigRelayPlanetA.Notes: A floating asteroid that appears in Good Egg Galaxy and Boss Blitz Galaxy.

BigRelayPlanetB.Name: "Temporary High Model" [BigRelayPlanetB]
BigRelayPlanetB.Notes: An unfinished placeholder model that displays a white cube with the text  "Temporary High Model, Please wait..." written on it.

LavaSparksS.Name: Small Lava Sparks
LavaSparksS.Notes: A small lava sparks particle effect.

ZeroGravityRoomPlanet.Name: Slipsand -- 2D Underground Room
ZeroGravityRoomPlanet.Notes: The 2D underground section from Slipsand Galaxy.

TreasureBoxGoldEmpty.Name: Empty Golden Treasure Chest
TreasureBoxGoldEmpty.Notes: A gold treasure chest that reveals nothing when opened.

StarPieceFlow.Name: Moving Star Bit Group
StarPieceFlow.Notes: Creates a group of Star Bits that move on a set path.

CymbalsStep.Name: Cloudy Court -- Cymbals Platform
CymbalsStep.Notes: The cymbals used in Cloudy Court Galaxy.

PhantomFirewood.Name: Campfire Logs
PhantomFirewood.Notes: A set of logs used for a campfire site.

SmokeEffectColorArea.Name: Running Dust Color Area
SmokeEffectColorArea.Notes: An area that can be used to change the running dust particles color.

DrumBegomanHolePlanet.Name: Space Storm -- Long Topman Planet
DrumBegomanHolePlanet.Notes: The tower planet used in the second mission of Space Storm Galaxy.

CumulativeTimerSwitchArea.Name: Timer Switch Area
CumulativeTimerSwitchArea.Notes: Activates a switch after a defined number of frames have passed while the player stays inside this area.

LavaSnowBallConveyPlanet.Name: Freezy Flake -- Lava Planet
LavaSnowBallConveyPlanet.Notes: The lava planet used at the end of the first mission of Freezy Flake Galaxy.

PlayerSideRetainOffArea.Name: Disable Movement Direction Retention Area
PlayerSideRetainOffArea.Notes: This area adjusts the player's movement direction to the current camera angle instead of keeping the direction the joystick was held in before moving.

AstroBaseCenterA.Name: Comet Observatory -- Big Slope
AstroBaseCenterA.Notes: The big slope found below the Engine Room in the Comet Observatory.

VsKoopaLv3Sky.Name: Galaxy Generator Sky
VsKoopaLv3Sky.Notes: The sky model used in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

AstroBaseCenterB.Name: Comet Observatory -- Beacon Holder
AstroBaseCenterB.Notes: The two cones that hold the Beacon in place in the Comet Observatory.

AstroDomeAsteroid.Name: Level Select Asteroids
AstroDomeAsteroid.Notes: A group of many rotating asteroids that are found in the galaxy select of the Domes.

TubeSliderCrystal.Name: "TubeSliderCrystal" [Broken]
TubeSliderCrystal.Notes: Model files have been removed. Therefore, the object is useless.

WaterStream.Name: Water Current
WaterStream.Notes: A water current that pushes the player away.

GoroRockLanePartsFlatA.Name: Bowling Challenge -- Flat Blue Platform
GoroRockLanePartsFlatA.Notes: A flat blue platform used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

TeresaPicture.Name: Boo Picture
TeresaPicture.Notes:
A picture of a Boo or Bomb Boo. The TexChange frame IDs for the different pictures are:
0 Boo
1 Empty
2 Bomb Boo

TripodPlanet.Name: Robot Reactor -- Megaleg Planet
TripodPlanet.Notes: The planet where Megaleg is fought in Bowser Jr.'s Robot Reactor.

BombHeiLauncher.Name: Bob-omb Dispenser
BombHeiLauncher.Notes: An enemy dispenser that releases Bob-ombs.

CannonRelayPlanet.Name: Boom Bunker -- Checkpoint Planet
CannonRelayPlanet.Notes: The multi-colored planet used in the middle of Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

Popo.Name: Smeech
Popo.Notes: A pink enemy that tries to suck on Yoshi, but runs away from the player under normal circumstances.

TamakoroJumpGuidanceArea.Name: Star Ball Jumping Explanation Area
TamakoroJumpGuidanceArea.Notes: An area which shows the player how to jump with the Star Ball while inside it.

BgmChangeArea.Name: Music Change Area
BgmChangeArea.Notes: Changes the stage's background music in various different ways if entered.

KoopaVS2PartsDarkMatterE.Name: Dark Matter (Very Long Rectangle)
KoopaVS2PartsDarkMatterE.Notes:
A very long rectangular chunk of dark matter.

This one in particular is not used in the game.

WaterArea.Name: Water Area
WaterArea.Notes: An area that consists of an invisible body of water.

TrickRabbitFreeRunCollect.Name: Star Bunny Free Run Controller
TrickRabbitFreeRunCollect.Notes: A controller for detecting the player catching freely running Star Bunnies.

CloudTunnel.Name: Cloud Tunnel
CloudTunnel.Notes: A cloud tunnel used during the fly-in sequence of some galaxies.

DashYoshiMoveClimbCometPartsA.Name: Hightail Falls -- Destroyed Moving Wood Platform
DashYoshiMoveClimbCometPartsA.Notes: A moving platform used in the Comet mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

ItemBubble.Name: Item Bubble
ItemBubble.Notes: A floaty bubble that can contain a bunch of collectible items. The item and amount can be defined.

StarCreekGalaxySpringHint.Name: Cosmic Cove -- Water Splash Effect
StarCreekGalaxySpringHint.Notes: A splashing water effect that appears during the second mission of Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

RisePictureBookPlanet.Name: Boo Moon -- Picture Book Planet
RisePictureBookPlanet.Notes: The folding planet used at the end of the first mission of Boo Moon Galaxy.

DangerSignBoard.Name: Danger Sign
DangerSignBoard.Notes: A signboard with a skull and red cross, indicating danger.

KoopaShipD.Name: Bowser Jr.'s Airship
KoopaShipD.Notes: The airship where Mario/Luigi fights Bowser Jr. from in Bowser Jr.'s Airship Armada.

KoopaShipA.Name: Generic Airship
KoopaShipA.Notes: A generic airship that is used in Space Junk Galaxy, Bowser's Airship Armada and Fleet Glide Galaxy.

TeresaMansionDoorB.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Backdoor
TeresaMansionDoorB.Notes: A double door of dark wood with a small gilded lock in the middle.

TeresaMansionDoorA.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Door
TeresaMansionDoorA.Notes: A double door of dark wood with a big gilded lock in the middle.

AstroDomeDemoAstroGalaxy.Name: Level Select Miniature Comet Observatory
AstroDomeDemoAstroGalaxy.Notes: A small version of the Comet Observatory that can be seen when the player flies to a galaxy in a Dome.

CrystalCageL.Name: Large Destroyable Crystal
CrystalCageL.Notes: A large destroyable crystal that requires two spins to destroy.

BattleGrapyonPlanet.Name: Battle Belt -- Swaphopper Planet
BattleGrapyonPlanet.Notes: The interior section from Battle Belt Galaxy that features several Swaphoppers.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Name: Starship Mario NPC Register
MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Notes: Sets up a short event cutscene for Starship Mario in which Lubba explains a newly appeared object on the Starship, such as items or NPCs.

SmokeEffectColorAreaCube.Name: Running Dust Color Area [Cube]
SmokeEffectColorAreaCube.Notes: An area that can be used to change the running dust particles color. The cube's origin is the base's center.

GhostShipCavePlanet.Name: Deep Dark: Main Planet
GhostShipCavePlanet.Notes: The main planet from Deep Dark Galaxy.

RotatePrismStepB.Name: Twisty Trials -- Small Rotating Log
RotatePrismStepB.Notes: A smaller rotating wooden log used in Twisty Trials Galaxy.

SpinningBox.Name: Spinning Block
SpinningBox.Notes:
A colorful flat block (resembles Mario Kart item boxes) that slides around on the ground. Only seen on a single planet in Gold Leaf Galaxy.

Extra notes: They also have an Ice model used for an unused SMG1 Ice Flower ability, where if Ice Mario spins near an Octogoomba (possibly other enemies, untested) the enemy will be "frozen" into a fully functional SpinningBox using it's Ice model. This unused Ice Flower ability is extremely buggy and unpredictable, do not try to use it in your galaxies.

FloaterLandPlanet.Name: Buoy Base: Fortress Planet
FloaterLandPlanet.Notes: The large fortress planet used in Buoy Base Galaxy.

HiTowerGoalPlanet.Name: "Temporary High Model" Planet
HiTowerGoalPlanet.Notes:
Yet another "Temporary High Model" object.
See: https://tcrf.net/Super_Mario_Galaxy/Unused_Models#Placeholder_Planets

Bussun.Name: Pupdozer
Bussun.Notes: A dinosaur-like enemy used in Flipsville Galaxy.

CoinFlower.Name: Coin Flower
CoinFlower.Notes: A decorative flower that spawns one Coin when hit by a Star Bit.

VRSandwichSun.Name: Melty Molten Sky
VRSandwichSun.Notes: The sky model used in Melty Molten Galaxy.

EarthenPipe.Name: Warp Pipe
EarthenPipe.Notes: The iconic pipe used to warp the player from one place to another.

WanwanGoal.Notes: The hole used as the goal for Chain Chomps in Chompworks Galaxy.

SandRelayPlanetC.Notes: A small sand planet used in Dusty Dune Galaxy.

SandRelayPlanetA.Notes: A small sand planet used in Dusty Dune Galaxy.

TrickRabbit.Name: Escaping Star Bunny
TrickRabbit.Notes: The bunny from the minigames where the player has to catch it.

AstroCore.Notes: The glowing Beacon that serves as the engine of the Comet Observatory.

FoominLavaCrossPlanet.Name: Lava Lair -- Flomp Planet
FoominLavaCrossPlanet.Notes: The planet where the Flomps and Toad Brigade appear in Bowser's Lava Lair.

KoopaVS2Sky.Notes: The sky model used in Bowser's Dark Matter Plant.

TamakoroKuriboLift.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Flipswitch Planet Elevator

DeathPromenadeRotateCircleL.Notes: A large rotating bone used in Boo's Boneyard Galaxy.

SpaceSeparatorB.Notes: A L-shaped rock from the pullstar section in Space Junk Galaxy.

ReverseClipConveyorA.Name: Haunty Halls -- Moving Carpet A

ReverseClipConveyorC.Notes: A segment of a carpet platform used in Haunty Halls Galaxy.

DeathPromenadeRotateCircleS.Name: Boo's Boneyard -- Small Rotating Bone
DeathPromenadeRotateCircleS.Notes: A small rotating bone used in Boo's Boneyard Galaxy.

IceLavaIslandLavaMovableStepA.Notes: Uses point_arg0 and point_arg5. Also uses path_arg0.

AstroTorchLightBlue.Notes: A blue torch light that was meant to be used in the Comet Observatory.

ScreenBlurSphere.Notes: An area that blurs the screen when moving the camera around.

InvisibleWallJump10x20.Name: Invisible Wall for Jumping (Size: 10 x 20)
InvisibleWallJump10x20.Notes: An invisible wall for jumping of size 10 x 20.

ZigZagCrushBlockA.Notes: The left half of a crushing wall from Cloudy Court Galaxy. The model has no back side.

ScoreAttackMan.Notes: The Chimp used for the scoring challenges, like in Slimy Spring Galaxy.

GarigariCutStepFlatHoleA.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Green Piece of Wood with Holes
GarigariCutStepFlatHoleA.Notes: A green piece of wood with holes used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

RailMoveMiniPlanetObjA.Name: Yoshi Star -- Moving Dirt Planet
RailMoveMiniPlanetObjA.Notes: A small moving dirt planet from Yoshi Star Galaxy.

MagmaMonsterStarCaptureStep.Name: Melty Monster -- Starting Planet
MagmaMonsterStarCaptureStep.Notes: The planet used at the start of Melty Monster Galaxy.

JetTurtle.Name: Koopa Shell

ZigZagCrushBlockB.Name: Cloudy Court -- Right Crushing Wall
ZigZagCrushBlockB.Notes: The right half of a crushing wall from Cloudy Court Galaxy. The model has no back side.

GravityFollowLiftB.Notes: A platform with a darker gravity display panel.

BattleShipMovePartsB.Notes: A rotating wheel with a gap from the 2D area of Battlerock Galaxy.

BattleShipMovePartsA.Notes: A rotating wheel from the 2D area of Battlerock Galaxy.

SkyBeachFlowers.Name: Starshine Beach -- Decorative Flowers
SkyBeachFlowers.Notes: A set of decorative flowers used in Starshine Beach Galaxy.

DemoPlayerForbidUpdateArea.Notes: An area which prevents various player components from updating during a cutscene.

QuestionFlowerGardenPlanet.Name: Gusty Garden: Question Planet
QuestionFlowerGardenPlanet.Notes: The planet shaped like a question mark used in Gusty Garden Galaxy.

SweetsDecoratePartsFork.Name: Decorative Fork
SweetsDecoratePartsFork.Notes: A huge fork from Toy Time Galaxy and Sweet Sweet Galaxy.

LavaFloatingStepA.Name: Tiny Purple/Medium Green Sinking Platform
LavaFloatingStepA.Notes: A sinking platform for lava sections. In SMG1 this is a tiny purple platform, in SMG2 it is a medium green platform.

RollingWater.Name: Rolling Water Bubble
RollingWater.Notes: A rolling bubble of water; used in both Cosmic Cove Galaxy and Honeyhop Galaxy.

MorphItemRock.Name: Rock Mushroom
MorphItemRock.Notes: A Rock Mushroom that transforms the player into a Rock character.

KoopaLv3.Name: Bowser [Galaxy Generator]
KoopaLv3.Notes: The boss fought at the end of Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

ShadowColorArea.Name: Shadow Color Area

KoopaLv2.Name: Bowser [Gravity Gauntlet]
KoopaLv2.Notes: The boss fought at the end of Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

WorldMapAccessPanel.Notes: Pressing on the switch will open the world screen.

Pyudon.Notes: A blue bird-like enemy that smacks onto the player if they walk under it.

GravityFollowPanelJumpStandPlanet.Name: Upside Dizzy -- Moving Gravity Panels Section
GravityFollowPanelJumpStandPlanet.Notes: The second section of the first planet used in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

SandUpDownTowerBottom.Name: Dusty Dune: Glass Tower
SandUpDownTowerBottom.Notes: The glass tower from Dusty Dune Galaxy.

BellyDragonLv1Planet.Name: Fiery Flotilla -- Gobblegut Planet
BellyDragonLv1Planet.Notes: The planet from Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla where Gobblegut is fought.

DeathSandEnvironmentSapotenB.Name: Dusty Dune -- Background Cacti B
DeathSandEnvironmentSapotenB.Notes: A set of cacti used in the background of Dusty Dune Galaxy.

DeathSandEnvironmentSapotenA.Name: Dusty Dune -- Background Cacti A
DeathSandEnvironmentSapotenA.Notes: A set of cacti used in the background of Dusty Dune Galaxy.

AbekobeIntroducePlanet.Name: Rightside Down -- Intro Planet
AbekobeIntroducePlanet.Notes: The decorative building blocks planet that can be seen at the beginning of Rightside Down Galaxy.

Fluff.Name: Fluff Flower
Fluff.Notes: A large Fluff Flower used to glide through wind streams.

WaterRoadCaveStepB.Name: Sand Spiral -- Blue Metal Platform
WaterRoadCaveStepB.Notes: A metal mesh platform with a blue frame used in Sand Spiral Galaxy.

HipDropMoveCylinderBig.Notes: A long dual-sided ground pound block used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

BarrelColonyInnerPlanet.Notes: The interior parts of the large cylindrical planet from Sky Station Galaxy's second Star.

BendSwanpPlanet.Notes: The folding swamp planet from Boo Moon Galaxy.

GlassyTwinsPlanetA.Notes: An unused planet that was supposed to appear in Good Egg Galaxy. It can be seen in the E3 2006 demo.

CoinInsidePearPlanet.Notes: The interior of the pear planet used in the first mission of Spin-Dig Galaxy.

BattleShipWarpHole.Notes: A decorative wormhole that can be seen in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

A decorative meteor that drops a circular shadow under itself.

Not intended to be used within player reach due to weird collision.

BigNokonokoLandPlanet.Notes: The circular dirt planet used in Supermassive Galaxy.

TriangleTowerRotateStep.Notes: A rotating wood gear used on the cloud tower planet in Fluffy Bluff Galaxy.

MiniMechaKoopaPartsGear.Notes: A rotating gear from the factory planet from Toy Time Galaxy.

LavaYoshiActionFloaterA.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Dash Pepper Planet Sinking Platform
LavaYoshiActionFloaterA.Notes: A circular sinking platform used on the Dash Pepper planet in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

YoshiHomeLift.Notes: A moving wood platform from Yoshi Star Galaxy.

VsOtaRockTankIcePlanetLava.Notes: The lava layer used on the Prince Pikante planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

MysteryMoveStepCoverB.Notes: An invisible yellow cake platform used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy; can appear when Bulb Yoshi is nearby.

CapsuleLavaLiftB.Notes: A set of rotating and moving platforms used in Bowser's Lava Lair.

MysteryMoveStepCoverC.Notes: An invisible brown cake platform used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy; can appear when Bulb Yoshi is nearby.

CapsuleLavaLiftA.Notes: A set of rotating platforms used in Bowser's Lava Lair.

GravityTimerChangeWall.Name: Upside Dizzy -- Gravity-Changing Section Display Wall

MiniMechaKoopaPartsCage.Notes: A cage from the factory planet from Toy Time Galaxy.

ForestPoihanaFenceB.Name: Gold Leaf: Fences (Version B)
ForestPoihanaFenceB.Notes: A set of fences used in Gold Leaf Galaxy.

MemoryRoadTowerField.Name: Flash Black -- Mansion Planet
MemoryRoadTowerField.Notes: The large mansion planet used at the start of Flash Black Galaxy.

AstroBaseB.Name: Comet Observatory -- Library Region
AstroBaseB.Notes: The section of the Comet Observatory where the Kitchen and the Bedroom are located.

ForestPoihanaFenceA.Name: Gold Leaf: Fences (Version A)
ForestPoihanaFenceA.Notes: A set of fences used in Gold Leaf Galaxy.

UniverseAir.Name: Starry Atmosphere

AstroBaseC.Notes: The section of the Comet Observatory where the Engine Room and the Garden are located.

GoroRockSwanpAcrossPlanet.Name: Boulder Bowl -- Mud Planet
GoroRockSwanpAcrossPlanet.Notes: The mud planet with boulders used in Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

TeresaMansionEntranceDoor.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Entrance Door
TeresaMansionEntranceDoor.Notes: A big double door of dark wood that closes instead of opening.

SpinDriver.Name: Sling Star

PukupukuWaterSurface.Name: Water Surface Cheep Cheep
PukupukuWaterSurface.Notes: A fish enemy that is intended to swim on the water's surface.

MemoryRoadTicoCollectField.Name: Flash Black -- Silver Star Platforms
MemoryRoadTicoCollectField.Notes: The planet where the Silver Stars are located in the first mission of Flash Black Galaxy.

PictureJoinPlanet.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Mandibug Puzzle Center Piece

UnderGroundDangeonPlanetA.Name: Slimy Spring -- Snoodle Section
UnderGroundDangeonPlanetA.Notes: The first half of Slimy Spring Galaxy that consists of the starting cave and the underwater tunnels with Snoodles.

UnderGroundDangeonPlanetB.Notes: The second half of Slimy Spring Galaxy that features a lot of Underwater Boos and the goal section.

TimerGravityChangeDrillRoomWall.Name: Flipsville -- Gravity-Changing Planet Panel
TimerGravityChangeDrillRoomWall.Notes: The back wall of the gravity-changing planet used in the second mission of Flipsville Galaxy.

SnakeheadSmall.Notes: A small eel that comes out of caves.

MiniSurfingLv1Galaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Loopdeeloop Galaxy.

PetitPorterPlanetB.Name: Dirt Bonus Planet
PetitPorterPlanetB.Notes: The dirt planet used in several bonus sections.

PackunFlowerBig.Name: Big Piranha Plant
PackunFlowerBig.Notes: A huge version of a Piranha Plant that appears in the Supermassive Galaxy.

CubeBubbleExStartStep.Name: Bubble Blast -- Green Metal Platform
CubeBubbleExStartStep.Notes: The green metal platform that serves as the start of each section in Bubble Blast Galaxy.

ChoConveyorMoveChocoA.Name: Toy Time -- Moving Chocolate Wall
ChoConveyorMoveChocoA.Notes: A wall of chocolate used on a conveyor belt in Toy Time Galaxy.

LongCylinderFlowSandStep.Name: Slipsand -- Stone Arrow Plattforms
LongCylinderFlowSandStep.Notes: A set of stone arrow platforms used in the second mission of Slipsand Galaxy.

BombTimeAttackPlanet.Name: Gearmo Challenge Planet
BombTimeAttackPlanet.Notes: The planet used for the trash minigame in Battlerock Galaxy and the crate-burning minigames in Super Mario Galaxy 2.

SurfingRaceMainGate.Name: Goal Gate
SurfingRaceMainGate.Notes: The large yellow gate used as the goal on the surfing and gliding levels.

HomePlanet.Name: E3 2006 Starting Planet
HomePlanet.Notes: This is a planet that was used for the presentation of the game at the E3 of 2006, it can be placed on a level and it will work correctly.

GarigariCutStepFlatThreeRight.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Triplet Set of Wood Right Piece
GarigariCutStepFlatThreeRight.Notes: The right piece of a set of three pieces of wood used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

MysteryGravityRoomPlanet.Name: Gravity Bonus Room
MysteryGravityRoomPlanet.Notes: A bonus room used in SMG1; used with the gravity room bridge to allow Mario/Luigi to walk across all walls.

TrialBubbleRotateWallA.Name: Rotating Wooden Wall
TrialBubbleRotateWallA.Notes: A large wooden wall from Bubble Breeze Galaxy which can rotate around itself.

UFONormalD.Name: Battlerock -- Breakable UFO Platform
UFONormalD.Notes: A variant of UFOStrongA that can be destroyed by an explosion.

UFONormalB.Name: Dreadnought -- Bullet UFO
UFONormalB.Notes: A metallic bullet-shaped platform which can be broken by an explosion.

StarPieceMother.Name: Rainbow Star Bit
StarPieceMother.Notes: A large rainbow-colored Star Bit which creates a trail of smaller Star Bits while it moves.

BeeWallClimbPlanetB.Name: Honeyclimb -- Meteor Planet
BeeWallClimbPlanetB.Notes: The planet with falling meteors from Honeyclimb Galaxy.

ShutterDoorC.Name: Freezeflame: Volcano Shutter Door
ShutterDoorC.Notes: A shutter door from Freezeflame Galaxy. Requires a SW_A switch. Although not required, it can have a path.

BeeWallClimbPlanetA.Name: Honeyclimb -- Starting Planet
BeeWallClimbPlanetA.Notes: The starting planet of Honeyclimb Galaxy.

FirePressureRadiate.Name: Flame Shooter
FirePressureRadiate.Notes: A red nozzle that shoots flames.

ShutterDoorD.Name: Freezeflame: Treasure Shutter Door
ShutterDoorD.Notes: A shutter door from Freezeflame Galaxy's volcanic zone. Requires a SW_A switch. Although not required, it can have a path.

ShutterDoorE.Name: Deep Dark: Shutter Door
ShutterDoorE.Notes: A shutter door from Deep Dark Galaxy. Requires a SW_A switch. Although not required, it can have a path.

YoshiCaptureGuidanceArea.Name: Yoshi Grapple Explanation Area
YoshiCaptureGuidanceArea.Notes: An area which shows the player how to use Yoshi Grapples.

BeeWallClimbPlanetC.Name: Honeyclimb -- Mandibug Planet
BeeWallClimbPlanetC.Notes: The planet with Mandibugs from Honeyclimb Galaxy.

SuperDreamer.Name: Cosmic Spirit
SuperDreamer.Notes: The dark blue Cosmic Spirit that aids the player if they die several consecutive times in a specific section of a galaxy.

ShutterDoorB.Name: Battlerock: Shutter Door
ShutterDoorB.Notes: A shutter door from Battlerock Galaxy. Requires a SW_A switch. Although not required, it can have a path.

MagmaBoatIcePlanet.Name: Shiverburn -- Starting Planet [Frozen]
MagmaBoatIcePlanet.Notes: A frozen version of the planet used at the start of Shiverburn Galaxy.

KameckShip.Name: Deep Dark: Kamella's Ghost Ship
KameckShip.Notes: The ghost ship inside the cave of Deep Dark Galaxy. Mainly used as the arena for Kamella's bossfights.

RockReflector.Name: Rock Mushroom Bounce Fence
RockReflector.Notes: A yellow fence that causes the player to bounce off from it if they roll into it with the Rock power-up.

BroadBeanPlanetB.Name: Good Egg -- Bean Planet
BroadBeanPlanetB.Notes: A bean-shaped planet with a single stone block used in Good Egg Galaxy and Gusty Garden Galaxy.

BroadBeanPlanetC.Name: Good Egg -- Stone Blocks Bean Planet
BroadBeanPlanetC.Notes: A bean-shaped planet with a stone structure on top; used in Good Egg Galaxy.

DashYoshiMoveClimbCometPlanet.Name: Hightail Falls -- Destroyed Wide Wall Climb Planet
DashYoshiMoveClimbCometPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the end of the Comet mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

BroadBeanPlanetD.Name: Gusty Garden -- Grassy Bean Planet
BroadBeanPlanetD.Notes: A grassy bean-shaped planet used in Gusty Garden Galaxy.

PoltaBattlePlanetPartsA.Name: Ghostly -- Bouldergeist Planet Platforms
PoltaBattlePlanetPartsA.Notes: The stone platforms that lead to Bouldergeist's planet in Ghostly Galaxy.

BroadBeanPlanetA.Name: "BroadBeanPlanetA" [Unused]
BroadBeanPlanetA.Notes: An unused bean-shaped planet that could be seen in the E3 2006 demo.

FlagRaceA.Name: Pull Star Flag
FlagRaceA.Notes: A flag with a Pull Star icon on it. Used in Boo's Boneyard Galaxy.

GorogoroCylinderRockB.Name: Clockwork Ruins -- Thin Rolling Wheel
GorogoroCylinderRockB.Notes: A thin rolling wheel used on the ending planet of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

GorogoroCylinderRockA.Name: Clockwork Ruins -- Thick Rolling Wheel
GorogoroCylinderRockA.Notes: A thick rolling wheel used on the ending planet of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

GliderDossunRoadPlanet.Name: Fleet Glide -- Thwomp Tunnel Planet
GliderDossunRoadPlanet.Notes: The long tunnel where Thwomps are found in Fleet Glide Galaxy.

SkyIslandDecorateParts.Name: Cloudy Court -- Decorative Flower Petals
SkyIslandDecorateParts.Notes: A set of decorative flower petals used in Cloudy Court Galaxy.

TrickRabbitGhost.Name: Invisible Escaping Star Bunny
TrickRabbitGhost.Notes: An unused variant of the escaping Star Bunny that turns invisible while it moves around. Requires a proper ObjNameTable entry in order to be used.

ReverseFlowSandMoveStep.Name: Slipsand -- Metal Block
ReverseFlowSandMoveStep.Notes: A metal block platform used in the first mission of Slipsand Galaxy.

Mogu.Name: Monty
Mogu.Notes: A mole that resides in a metal hatch and throws wrenches at the player.

TrampleStar.Name: Pink Bouncy Ball Planet
TrampleStar.Notes: A small checkered red and pink planet which the player bounces on when stepped. It's primary apparition is in Ghostly Galaxy.

NigeroPlanet.Name: Hightail Falls -- Kleptoad Planet
NigeroPlanet.Notes: The Hungry Luma planet of Hightail Falls Galaxy, where the player can find Kleptoads.

WaterRoad.Name: Water Stream
WaterRoad.Notes: A massive stream of water the player can ride to be transported. Used in Sea Slide Galaxy.

ExterminationKuriboKeySwitch.Name: Key Switch Spawner [Goombas]
ExterminationKuriboKeySwitch.Notes: A controller that spawns a Key Switch if all assigned ChildKuribo objects have been killed.

MorphItemNeoIce.Name: Ice Flower
MorphItemNeoIce.Notes: An Ice Flower that transforms the player into an Ice character.

RaceRail.Name: Race Path
RaceRail.Notes: An object that is used to set up the route for several racing minigames such as Ray Surfing and Glide Races.

JrRobotStepBreakableA.Name: Fearsome Fleet -- Megahammer Planet Platform
JrRobotStepBreakableA.Notes: A long yellow platform that can be destroyed if it is hit by Megahammer.

LavaSeparateWaterfall.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Crushing Lava Walls
LavaSeparateWaterfall.Notes: A set of two lava walls that move to crush Mario. Used in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

HeavenlyBeachTopRock.Name: Beach Bowl: Rock Cap (Top)
HeavenlyBeachTopRock.Notes: A rock that can be destroyed when activated through SW_A; used in Beach Bowl Galaxy.

PusherWallDisappear.Name: Clockwork Ruins -- Pusher Wall [Disappearing]
PusherWallDisappear.Notes: A purple wall that pushes objects and is destroyed after using the gravity-arrow switch on the gravity planet in Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

TeresaMansionCandlestand.Name: Ghostly Candlestick
TeresaMansionCandlestand.Notes: A lit candlestick used in Ghostly Galaxy.

HeavensDoorFlowerA.Name: Gateway Flowers
HeavensDoorFlowerA.Notes: A unique cluster of flowers seen on the starting planet of Gateway Galaxy.

BigSandBirdStartStep.Name: Slipsand -- Sand Bird Planet Starting Platform
BigSandBirdStartStep.Notes: The starting platform of the Sand Bird planet from Slipsand Galaxy.

OceanJShapePlanet.Name: Melty Molten: J-Shaped Water Planet (Unused)
OceanJShapePlanet.Notes: A near-perfect copy of the planet from Melty Molten Galaxy, but with water instead of lava and different textures.

SunakazeKun.Name: Tweester
SunakazeKun.Notes: A small tornado enemy with googly eyes and a small attraction range. Can defend itself with two spiky rocks as well.

GliderPoleWoodPlanet.Name: Wild Glide -- Rainbow Forest Planet
GliderPoleWoodPlanet.Notes: The section with trees and a rainbow used in Wild Glide Galaxy.

SpinDriverEarthenPipePlanet.Name: Supermassive -- Large Pipe Planet
SpinDriverEarthenPipePlanet.Notes: The large green pipe planet used in Supermassive Galaxy.

MessageArea.Name: Display Message Area
MessageArea.Notes: This area forces to display the linked shouting messages when entered.

PoleObstaclePartsD.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Yellow Paintbrush
PoleObstaclePartsD.Notes: A large yellow paintbrush used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

LavaBegomanUFOPlanet.Name: Dreadnought: UFO Planet
LavaBegomanUFOPlanet.Notes: The UFO planet used at the start of the third mission of Dreadnought Galaxy.

PoleObstaclePartsC.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Blue Paintbrush
PoleObstaclePartsC.Notes: A large blue paintbrush used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

StarCreekPlanet.Name: Cosmic Cove -- Main Planet
StarCreekPlanet.Notes: The main planet used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

PoleObstaclePartsB.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Red Paintbrush
PoleObstaclePartsB.Notes: A large red paintbrush used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

PoleObstaclePartsA.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Green Paintbrush
PoleObstaclePartsA.Notes: A large green paintbrush used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

TogepinAttackFoulArea.Name: Bowling Challenge Foul Area
TogepinAttackFoulArea.Notes: An area that, when entered, results in a foul during The Chimp's bowling challenge.

StarDustRollingStepA.Name: Space Junk: Rolling Crystal Planet
StarDustRollingStepA.Notes: The big rotating crystal planet from Space Junk Galaxy.

TalkSyati.Name: Guppy NPC
TalkSyati.Notes: A shark NPC that appears in Sea Slide Galaxy and Deep Dark Galaxy.

Jugem.Name: Lakitu
Jugem.Notes: A Koopa that sits on a cloud and throws Spinys at the player.

FallDownBridge.Name: Rolling Gizmo -- Collapsing Bridge
FallDownBridge.Notes: The big collapsing bridge used in Rolling Gizmo Galaxy.

YukkinaRellayPlanet.Name: Freezy Flake -- Sorbetti-shaped Planet
YukkinaRellayPlanet.Notes: A planet with the shape of the Sorbetti boss.

CapsuleLavaPlanetB.Name: Lava Lair -- Brown Lava Capsule Planet
CapsuleLavaPlanetB.Notes: The second of two capsule planets used at the start of Bowser's Lava Lair.

KoopaJrCastleWindUp.Name: Boomsday Machine Fan
KoopaJrCastleWindUp.Notes: A large metal fan used during the Boomsday Machine battle in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

CapsuleLavaPlanetA.Name: Lava Lair -- Gray Lava Capsule Planet
CapsuleLavaPlanetA.Notes: The first of two capsule planets used at the start of Bowser's Lava Lair.

ShellfishYellowChip.Name: Clampy with Star Chip
ShellfishYellowChip.Notes: An underwater clam that opens its mouth periodically; contains a Star Chip inside.

RingBeamer.Name: Ring Beamer
RingBeamer.Notes: A yellow enemy with spikes on its head that periodically emits rings of electricity.

TeresaWater.Name: Underwater Boo
TeresaWater.Notes: An underwater variant of a Boo.

BigTreePlanet.Name: Tall Trunk -- Large Tree Planet
BigTreePlanet.Notes: The large tree planet that makes up the starting section from Tall Trunk Galaxy.

PositiveDice.Name: Positive Chance Cube
PositiveDice.Notes: A dice block that can reward either a Star Bit or a 1-Up Mushroom.

KoopaJrLv2LiftGenerator.Name: Yellow Moving Platform Generator
KoopaJrLv2LiftGenerator.Notes: An object that generates the yellow platforms used in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

WormEatenPlanet.Name: Gusty Garden -- Apple Planets
WormEatenPlanet.Notes: A group of giant apples that house a giant caterpillar from Gusty Garden Galaxy.

ElectricPressure.Name: Electric Ball Shooter
ElectricPressure.Notes: A yellow nozzle that shoots balls of electricity.

CometRainbowArea.Name: Force Rainbow Power-Up Area
CometRainbowArea.Notes: An area that, when entered, forces the player to wear the Rainbow Star power-up.

KoopaBattleMapStairBig.Name: Collapsible Bowser Stairs Big Platform
KoopaBattleMapStairBig.Notes:
A bigger version of the collapsible* green and white platform that makes up the stairs in Bowser's Star Reactor and Bowser's Galaxy Reactor.

* Collapses when hit by a meteor shot by Bowser/Bowser Jr. or other means.

BumpAppearPlanet.Name: Gold Leaf -- Bunny Chase Planet
BumpAppearPlanet.Notes: A wooden planet used in Gold Leaf Galaxy on which the player hunts a Star Bunny.

SandBirdPartsTailLeft.Name: Sand Bird Left Striped Tail
SandBirdPartsTailLeft.Notes: The left piece of the tail of the Sand Bird used in Slipsand Galaxy.

MiniSandClockGalaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Dusty Dune
MiniSandClockGalaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Dusty Dune Galaxy.

UFOStrongA.Name: Battlerock -- Generic UFO Platform
UFOStrongA.Notes: A metallic UFO platform that is used in Battlerock Galaxy.

SplashCoinBlock.Name: Splashing Coins ? Block
SplashCoinBlock.Notes: A ? Block that drops some Coins when hit.

MemoryRoadDoor.Name: Flash Black -- Mansion Door
MemoryRoadDoor.Notes: The door of the mansion used at the start of Flash-Black Galaxy.

MysteryMountainPlanetCover.Name: Sweet Mystery -- Wrapped Cake Planet [Candles]
MysteryMountainPlanetCover.Notes: The candles from the wrapped cake planet of Sweet Mystery Galaxy that become visible when using Bulb Yoshi.

WaterDropTop.Name: Small Water Droplets Effect
WaterDropTop.Notes: A dripping water effect from Deep Dark Galaxy's Boo Box planet that shows many small droplets.

TriangleTowerSpringPlanet.Name: Chompworks -- Spring Tower Planet
TriangleTowerSpringPlanet.Notes: The spring tower planet used in the second mission of Chompworks Galaxy.

BellyDragonLv2Planet.Name: Battle Belt -- Fiery Gobblegut Planet
BellyDragonLv2Planet.Notes: The rocky planet from Battle Belt Galaxy where Fiery Gobblegut is fought.

ClipCutLiftC.Name: Haunty Halls -- Purple Platform
ClipCutLiftC.Notes: A purple-colored platform used in the second mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

ClipCutLiftB.Name: Haunty Halls -- Green Platform
ClipCutLiftB.Notes: A green-colored platform used in the second mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

ClipCutLiftA.Name: Haunty Halls -- Red Platform
ClipCutLiftA.Notes: A red-colored platform used in the second mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

ExterminationCheckerKuribo.Name: Power Star Spawner [Goombas]
ExterminationCheckerKuribo.Notes: A controller that spawns a Power Star if all assigned ChildKuribo objects have been killed.

TubeSlider.Name: Slider Controller
TubeSlider.Notes: Sets up the tubular slide sections along a set path. It also creates several special "TubeSlider"-related objects that are connected to it.

StarPieceGroup.Name: Star Bit Group
StarPieceGroup.Notes: Creates a group of Star Bits that are placed in a circle or along a set path.

CannonStormSpaceShipPlanet.Name: Dreadnought -- Colossal Cannons Planet
CannonStormSpaceShipPlanet.Notes: The large section featuring the cannonball shooters found in the second mission of Dreadnought Galaxy.

MiniCubeBubbleExLv1Galaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Bubble Breeze
MiniCubeBubbleExLv1Galaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Bubble Breeze Galaxy.

CannonFortressCollapsePlanet.Name: Dreadnought -- Collapsing Tower Planet
CannonFortressCollapsePlanet.Notes: The tower that has various collapsing platforms in Dreadnought Galaxy.

KoopaJrLv2StartPlanetB.Name: Fearsome Fleet -- Checkpoint Platform
KoopaJrLv2StartPlanetB.Notes: A single platform used near the checkpoint of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

Syati.Name: Guppy
Syati.Notes: A shark who races the player through several underwater rings and awards them a Power Star if beaten. Seen in Sea Slide Galaxy and Deep Dark Galaxy.

WoodDrumRailLiftA.Name: Tall Trunk -- Moving Log Platforms
WoodDrumRailLiftA.Notes: A set of moving logs from the cylindrical tree planet from Tall Trunk Galaxy.

FoominLavaCrossPlanetProminence.Name: Lava Lair -- Flomp Planet Rotating Fire Balls
FoominLavaCrossPlanetProminence.Notes: A set of three decorative fire balls used in the background of Bowser's Lava Lair.

LongCylinderFlowSandRotateStepA.Name: Slipsand -- Metal Arrow Platform
LongCylinderFlowSandRotateStepA.Notes: A rotating metal platform shaped like an arrow; used in the second mission of Slipsand Galaxy.

PeachCastleTownBeforeAttack.Name: Peach's Castle: Houses
PeachCastleTownBeforeAttack.Notes: A set of houses used at Peach's Castle in SMG1.

GoroRockStartPlanet.Name: Boulder Bowl -- Starting Planet
GoroRockStartPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

TrialBubbleAPlanet.Name: Bubble Breeze Second Section
TrialBubbleAPlanet.Notes:
The second section of Bubble Breeze Galaxy to which the player goes after taking the Launch Star on the first section.

Note: Not quite a functional planet on it's own, since it has no floor.

DriftWood.Name: Icy Obstacle
DriftWood.Notes: An iicy obstacle that can destroy the ice platforms created by the player.

JumpHole.Name: Star Ball Launcher
JumpHole.Notes: A hole that launches a Star Ball along a path.

GhostShipCaveMoveGroundA.Name: Deep Dark: Moving Piston A
GhostShipCaveMoveGroundA.Notes: A yellow moving piston that appears in the Deep Dark Galaxy.

BigBubbleGenerator.Name: Big Bubble Generator
BigBubbleGenerator.Notes: A generator that creates Big Bubbles, which can be entered and controlled by the player.

GhostShipCaveMoveGroundB.Name: Deep Dark: Moving Piston B
GhostShipCaveMoveGroundB.Notes: A yellow moving piston that appears in the Deep Dark Galaxy.

LuigiEvent.Name: Luigi (Power Star Giver)
LuigiEvent.Notes: A special Luigi NPC which gives you a Power Star when you talk to him after finding him on specific galaxies such as Good Egg and Honeyhive.

HammerHeadPackun.Name: Prickly Piranha Plant
HammerHeadPackun.Notes: A big purple Piranha Plant with spikes on its base. It can be defeated by jumping on its head.

PichanRacer.Name: Jibberjay Racer
PichanRacer.Notes: A bird NPC that triggers the race in gliding galaxies.

ForestHomePartsTree.Name: Honeyhive: Trees
ForestHomePartsTree.Notes: A set of trees used in Honeyhive Galaxy.

Poihana.Name: Cataquack
Poihana.Notes: A blue duck-like enemy that can toss the player high into the air.

WhirlPool.Name: Decorative Whirlpool
WhirlPool.Notes: A decorative whirlpool that is meant to connect the water surface to an actual WhirlPoolAccelerator.

ChallengeBallGearA.Name: Rolling Gizmo -- Orange Gear
ChallengeBallGearA.Notes: A rotating orange gear used in Rolling Gizmo Galaxy.

GraviryTimerChange2DActionPlanet.Name: Upside Dizzy -- Gravity-Changing Section
GraviryTimerChange2DActionPlanet.Notes: The planet used at the end of Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

Peach.Name: Princess Peach
Peach.Notes: The character in a pink dress that always gets kidnapped by Bowser.

TakoHeiRelayPlanet.Name: "TakoHeiRelayPlanet" [Unused]
TakoHeiRelayPlanet.Notes: An unused spherical planet that features several locked metal hatches.

EffectCylinder.Name: Flower Petals Effect Area [Cylinder]
EffectCylinder.Notes: An area that changes the dust cloud effects into flower petals when the player is running or stomping.

GoroRockLaneBaseB.Name: Bowling Challenge -- Starting Platform
GoroRockLaneBaseB.Notes: The starting platform used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

GoroRockLaneBaseA.Name: Bowling Challenge -- Pair of Platforms
GoroRockLaneBaseA.Notes: A pair of platforms used in The Chimp's bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

Plant.Name: Vine Sproutle
Plant.Notes: A vine that you spin to grab hold of, and shake the Wii Remote to move on it.

PullBackCylinder.Name: Rescue from Falling Area [Cylinder]
PullBackCylinder.Notes: An area that, when entered, returns the player to the last safe position they stood on before falling off.

BeamGoRoundPlanet.Name: Dreadnought -- Beam Planet
BeamGoRoundPlanet.Notes: A set of two rotating cone-shaped planets with electric beams that can be found in the first Star in Dreadnought Galaxy.

CandlestandIceVolcano.Name: Red Flame Torch
CandlestandIceVolcano.Notes: A torch with a red flame. May also appear as unlit.

DharmaSambo.Name: Red Pokey
DharmaSambo.Notes: A red cactus enemy with several segments that is used in Dusty Dune Galaxy.

PatakuriBig.Name: Big Paragoomba
PatakuriBig.Notes: A huge version of a Paragoomba that appears in Supermassive Galaxy.

SwitchSynchronizerReverse.Name: Reverse Switch Controller
SwitchSynchronizerReverse.Notes: Keeps a switch activated while another switch is not activated. Effectively, this implements NOT gate logic.

Bomb.Name: Bomb
Bomb.Notes: A bomb that can be picked-up (to light its fuse) and thrown.

GlobalDiskGravity.Name: Disk Gravity
GlobalDiskGravity.Notes: A gravity area for a disk-shaped planet.

MagmaBoatRockA.Name: Shiverburn -- Stone Rock A
MagmaBoatRockA.Notes: A large stone rock used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

Moc.Name: Whittle
Moc.Notes: A wood NPC who appears in Puzzle Plank Galaxy and Tall Trunk Galaxy.

AstroRotateStepA.Name: Comet Observatory -- Green Rotating Platforms
AstroRotateStepA.Notes: A set of green rotating platforms found on the lower level of the Comet Observatory.

ForestHomePlanet.Name: Honeyhive: Starting Planet
ForestHomePlanet.Notes: The planet used at the start of Hoenyhive Galaxy.

MagmaBoatRockC.Name: Shiverburn -- Stone Rock C
MagmaBoatRockC.Notes: A large stone rock used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

MagmaBoatRockB.Name: Shiverburn -- Stone Rock B
MagmaBoatRockB.Notes: A large stone rock used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

StarManFort.Name: Starman Fortress Planet
StarManFort.Notes: A large fortress planet that has been scrapped during development.

AstroRotateStepB.Name: Comet Observatory -- Yellow Rotating Platforms
AstroRotateStepB.Notes: A set of yellow rotating platforms found on the upper level of the Comet Observatory.

InstantInferno.Name: Cosmic Clone Spawner
InstantInferno.Notes: A spawner that creates Cosmic Clones.

MagmaBoatRockD.Name: Shiverburn -- Stone Rock D
MagmaBoatRockD.Notes: A large stone rock used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

ReverseGravityTowerInside.Name: Good Egg: Tower Planet (Inside)
ReverseGravityTowerInside.Notes: The inside section of the huge cylindrical tower planet from Good Egg Galaxy.

SoundPlayArea.Name: Sound Emitter Area
SoundPlayArea.Notes: An area that starts playing a sound effect when entered.

DesertLandUpSwitch.Name: Ground Pound Up-Switch
DesertLandUpSwitch.Notes: A red Ground Pound switch that has an arrow pointing upwards.

DinoPackunBaby.Name: Peewee Piranha
DinoPackunBaby.Notes: The boss fought at the end of the first mission of Sky Station Galaxy.

BoomerangBros.Name: Boomerang Bro
BoomerangBros.Notes: A blue Koopa that throws boomerangs.

MechanicKoopaMini.Name: Mecha-Koopa
MechanicKoopaMini.Notes: A small robotic version of a Koopa that can be defeated by Ground Pounding it.

TeresaMansionHoleCover.Name: Ghostly -- Broken Ceiling Part
TeresaMansionHoleCover.Notes: A circular broken part of the haunted mansion's inner room ceiling that can be destroyed with a Ground Pound.

ClipCutRoadPlanet.Name: Haunty Halls -- Moving Stone Platforms Planet
ClipCutRoadPlanet.Notes: The stationary house platforms used on the second planet of the first mission of Haunty Halls Galaxy.

BeyondBlueAir.Name: Flipsville Blue Cloudy Atmosphere
BeyondBlueAir.Notes: The large cloudy air that surrounds the Starshroom and Glamdozer planet.

GalaxySky.Name: Generic Galaxy Sky
GalaxySky.Notes: A generic sky model used in several galaxies, including Buoy Base Galaxy and Flip-Swap Galaxy.

PhantomTowerMoveStepA.Name: Ghostly: Moving Stone Platform
PhantomTowerMoveStepA.Notes: A moving stone platform used in the third mission of Ghostly Galaxy.

SphereAir.Name: Bright Spherical Atmosphere
SphereAir.Notes: A bright spherical atmosphere that surrounds planets in Gateway Galaxy and Drip Drop Galaxy.

CylinderRotateLift.Name: Sky Station -- Rotating Train Platforms
CylinderRotateLift.Notes: A set of rotating platforms used on the cylinder planet of Sky Station Galaxy.

TamakoroVsSearchWanwanPlanet.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Silver Chomp Planet
TamakoroVsSearchWanwanPlanet.Notes: The planet where the Silver Chomp is found in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

KoopaJrLv3Sky.Name: Boom Bunker Sky
KoopaJrLv3Sky.Notes: The sky model used in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

MagmaSeaWavePlanet.Name: Melty Monster -- Volcano Planet
MagmaSeaWavePlanet.Notes: The large volcano planet used in the first mission of Melty Monster Galaxy.

RepeatBlockLavaBoxPlanet.Name: Lava Lair -- Snake Block Planet
RepeatBlockLavaBoxPlanet.Notes: The planet where Snake Blocks appear in Bowser's Lava Lair.

WaterCylinder.Name: Water Area [Cylinder]
WaterCylinder.Notes: An area that consists of an invisible body of water.

WaterAcrossSpherePlanet.Name: Fluffy Bluff -- Spherical Pond Planet
WaterAcrossSpherePlanet.Notes: A small pond planet used in the first mission of Fluffy Bluff Galaxy.

TicoBig.Name: Big Luma
TicoBig.Notes: A huge version of a Luma that appears in Supermassive Galaxy.

BigRotateCoinWall.Name: Supermassive -- Huge Rotating Coin
BigRotateCoinWall.Notes: A huge rotating Coin used in Supermassive Galaxy.

TubedRelayPlanet.Name: Honeyhive -- Tree Trunk Tube Planet
TubedRelayPlanet.Notes: A planet with a cut hollow tree trunk going through the middle.

TwisterSan.Name: Galactic Tornado
TwisterSan.Notes: A large tornado enemy with a wide attraction range.

DarknessRoomPlanetPartsA.Name: Ghostly -- Solid Matter Splatter Planet Platforms
DarknessRoomPlanetPartsA.Notes: The solid platforms of the Matter Splatter mansion from Ghostly Galaxy's secret Star.

DemoTitlePlanet.Name: Title Screen Planets
DemoTitlePlanet.Notes: The decorative planets seen on the title screen. They have no collision. This standalone version of the object is unused.

TamakoroRailToSearchWanwan.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Grinder Section Ruler
TamakoroRailToSearchWanwan.Notes: A large ruler platform used in the Grinder platforms section in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

VROrbit.Name: Good Egg Sky
VROrbit.Notes: The iconic sky model from Super Mario Galaxy.

LuckyRoomPlanet.Name: Starship Mario -- Luma Shop Room
LuckyRoomPlanet.Notes: The room with two Luma Shops offering Chance Cubes, used on Starship Mario.

KeySwitch.Name: Key
KeySwitch.Notes: A key that activates a switch when collected.

AsteroidBlockPlanet.Name: 8-Bit Mario/Luigi Planet Parts
AsteroidBlockPlanet.Notes: The lava, swamp platforms and large brick platform that serve as the basis of the 8-Bit Mario/Luigi planet from Toy Time Galaxy and Mario Squared Galaxy.

ReverseKingdomPlanet.Name: Gold Leaf Main Planet
ReverseKingdomPlanet.Notes: The main planet of Gold Leaf Galaxy.

GliBirdNpc.Name: Fluzzard NPC
GliBirdNpc.Notes: The NPC version of the colorful bird used in Wild Glide Galaxy and Fleet Glide Galaxy.

MagmaMonsterPlanet.Name: Melty Monster -- Small Lava Planet
MagmaMonsterPlanet.Notes: A small lava-covered planet used in Melty Monster Galaxy.

TreasureBoxEmpty.Name: Empty Treasure Chest
TreasureBoxEmpty.Notes: A brown treasure chest that reveals nothing when opened.

BombHeiLeadingInnerPlanet.Name: Space Storm -- Bob-omb Planet Interior
BombHeiLeadingInnerPlanet.Notes: The interior of the cylindrical glass planet from Space Storm Galaxy.

BiriBiriBegomanSpikePlanet.Name: Battlerock -- Caged Luma Planet
BiriBiriBegomanSpikePlanet.Notes: The metal bowl planet with a trapped Luma in Battlerock Galaxy.

GliderBazooka.Name: Cannonballs Undergrunt Gunner [Duplicate]
GliderBazooka.Notes: An unused duplicate of GliderShooter, which is an Undergrunt Gunner that shoots cannonballs.

TamakoroSearchWanwanAppearStep.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Silver Chomp Elevator
