TamakoroSearchWanwanAppearStep.Notes: The platform that the Silver Chomp appears on that is used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

ForestWaterfallS.Name: Small Waterfall Splash Effect
ForestWaterfallS.Notes: An alternate version of a small waterfall effect.

KoopaLv2LavaLift.Name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Moving Wood Platform
KoopaLv2LavaLift.Notes: A moving wood platform used near the start of Bowser's Gravity Gauntet.

Metbo.Name: Goombeetle
Metbo.Notes: A Goomba with a metal helmet on its head.

SpaceShipStep.Name: Destroyable Yellow Moving Platform
SpaceShipStep.Notes: A thick yellow moving platform from Dreadnought Galaxy and Shiverburn Galaxy. It can break apart after being hit by an enemy's explosion.

VRDarkSpace.Name: Boss Blitz Sky
VRDarkSpace.Notes: The sky model used in Sling Pod Galaxy, Bowser Jr.'s Lava Reactor and Boss Blitz Galaxy.

Banekiti.Name: Banekiti
Banekiti.Notes: A mechanical spring enemy that bounces off Boo Mario upon contact. It is used in Boo's Boneyard Galaxy.

ForestWaterfallL.Name: Large Waterfall Splash Effect
ForestWaterfallL.Notes: A large waterfall splash effect. Used in Honeyhive Galaxy, Gold Leaf Galaxy and Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

BigCake.Name: Ending Credits -- Cake
BigCake.Notes: The big cake that can be seen during the game's ending credits.

AudioEffectCylinder.Name: Audio Effect Area [Cylinder]
AudioEffectCylinder.Notes: Enables a different audio effect once entered.

MagmaMonsterSmallPlanetStep.Name: Melty Monster -- Magmaw Planet Small Asteroid
MagmaMonsterSmallPlanetStep.Notes: A small rock planet used at the end of the first mission of Melty Monster Galaxy.

MagmaBoatMagmaPlanet.Name: Shiverburn -- Starting Planet [Flaming]
MagmaBoatMagmaPlanet.Notes: A fire version of the planet used at the start of Shiverburn Galaxy.

BrightObj.Name: Bright Light Effect
BrightObj.Notes: A bright light that creates a lens flare effect when looked at.

KoopaJrStatue.Name: Bowser Jr. Statue
KoopaJrStatue.Notes: A destroyable statue of Bowser Jr.

CrossRingTransparentPlanet.Name: Toy Time -- Transparent Flipswitch Chain
CrossRingTransparentPlanet.Notes: The transparent part of the Flipswitch chain planet located in the Toy Time Galaxy.

CubeCameraBox.Name: Camera Area [Cube]
CubeCameraBox.Notes: An area that causes the camera to change when the player enters it. The cube's origin is the volume's center.

MessageAreaCube.Name: Display Message Area [Cube]
MessageAreaCube.Notes: This area forces to display the linked shouting messages when entered. The cube's origin is the base's center.

BlackHoleCube.Name: Black Hole [Cubic Attraction]
BlackHoleCube.Notes: A Black Hole that sucks in the player or defeats some enemies in its range. This one has a box-shaped attraction range.

Caretaker.Name: Gearmo
Caretaker.Notes: A robotic NPC from Toy Time Galaxy and Chompworks Galaxy.

SpinSwitchArea.Name: Spin Switch Area
SpinSwitchArea.Notes: An area that toggles a switch when the player uses the Spin Attack inside this area.

FireRing.Name: Fire Ball Ring
FireRing.Notes: A ring of rotating fire balls.

FallGreenLeaf.Name: Falling Leaves (Green)
FallGreenLeaf.Notes: A falling leaf effect with green leaves.

SurpTeresaMario2DGalaxy.Name: Portal to Boo's Boneyard Galaxy
SurpTeresaMario2DGalaxy.Notes: A green portal that opens Boo's Boneyard Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

ClipAreaBoxBottom.Name: Box-shaped Matter Splatter Hole [Base Centered]
ClipAreaBoxBottom.Notes: A box-shaped Matter Splatter hole. The origin is the center of the lower base.

RollingOvalPlanet.Name: Battlerock: Cannon Planet Base
RollingOvalPlanet.Notes: The yellow base for the cannon planet in Battlerock Galaxy. It features a hole for a cannon.

LavaFallDownColumnA.Name: Melty Molten: Rock Columns A (Lava Spire Planet)
LavaFallDownColumnA.Notes: A set of columns used on the lava spire planet in Melty Molten Galaxy. (This object requires an SW_A switch to function.)

LavaFallDownColumnB.Name: Melty Molten: Rock Columns B (Lava Spire Planet)
LavaFallDownColumnB.Notes: A set of columns used on the lava spire planet in Melty Molten Galaxy. (This object requires an SW_A switch to function.)

BombTeresa.Name: Bomb Boo
BombTeresa.Notes: A black boo that explodes when it hits something; used in Ghostly Galaxy.

DemoSubGroup.Name: Cutscene Cast
DemoSubGroup.Notes: An object used to connect a cutscene across multiple zones.

LavaBubble.Name: Lava Bubble
LavaBubble.Notes: A small bubble of lava that jumps out and back into lava.

ShootingStarArea.Name: Shooting Star Effect
ShootingStarArea.Notes: A particle effect that randomly depicts shooting stars.

TakoHei.Name: Octoguy
TakoHei.Notes: A pink version of an Octoomba that moves away from the player to spit rocks at them from a distance.

PostFogArea.Name: Post Fog Area
PostFogArea.Notes: An area that renders a fog post effect on the screen when entered.

SnowDiskPlanet.Name: Freezy Flake -- Starting Planet
SnowDiskPlanet.Notes: The planet with the small hut used at the start of Freezy Flake Galaxy.

DesertMovingLandSmall.Name: Dusty Dune -- Small Moving Sand Disk
DesertMovingLandSmall.Notes: A small sand disk from Dusty Dune Galaxy that can move.

PoisonSwanpSeesawMovePlanet.Name: Boom Bunker -- Dark Matter Planet
PoisonSwanpSeesawMovePlanet.Notes: The planet filled with Dark Matter used in the Comet mission of Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

WanwanConveySeesaw.Name: Chompworks -- Green Seesaw Platform
WanwanConveySeesaw.Notes: The green seesaw-like platform used on the Flip-Swap planet in Chompworks Galaxy.

MiniBreakDownPlanetGalaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Hurry-Scurry
MiniBreakDownPlanetGalaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Hurry-Scurry Galaxy.

KoopaBattleMapStairTurn.Name: Collapsible Bowser Stairs Turn Platform
KoopaBattleMapStairTurn.Notes:
A turning version of the collapsible* green and white platform that makes up the stairs in Bowser's Star Reactor.

* Collapses when hit by a meteor shot by Bowser/Bowser Jr. or other means.

ClockworkHandle.Name: Toy Time -- Turn-Key
ClockworkHandle.Notes: A decorative turn-key used in Toy Time Galaxy.

BegomanLauncher.Name: Spring Topman Spawner
BegomanLauncher.Notes: A black hole that spawns Spring Topman. Defeated Spring Topman will respawn after some time.

SnowFloor.Name: Snow Floor Overlay
SnowFloor.Notes: The snow overlay on the floor of Snow Cap Galaxy which reacts to the star pointer over it.

BattanRoadPlanet.Name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Whomp Section Parts
BattanRoadPlanet.Notes: Parts of the Whomp section and the last 2D interior section from Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

MiniBattleShipGalaxy.Name: Dome Warp: Battlerock
MiniBattleShipGalaxy.Notes: A dome warp to Battlerock Galaxy.

WanwanLiftUpStepA.Name: Chompworks -- Uplift Platform
WanwanLiftUpStepA.Notes: A blue platform that follows the assigned path once a switch has been activated. If the switch is deactivated again, it will move backwards.

MysteryCandyBrightPlanetCover.Name: Sweet Mystery -- Main Platforms [Visible Candy]
MysteryCandyBrightPlanetCover.Notes: The candy from the major portion of Sweet Mystery Galaxy that becomes visible when using Bulb Yoshi.

SandStreamHighTowerMoveStepA.Name: Dusty Dune: Red Moving Block
SandStreamHighTowerMoveStepA.Notes: A red moving block from the huge tower planet in Dusty Dune Galaxy.

StaffRollDecorateComet.Name: Ending Credits -- Decorative Comet
StaffRollDecorateComet.Notes: A comet that appears near the end of the game's ending credits.

Birikyu.Name: Amp
Birikyu.Notes: A small electrical enemy that moves on a path or in a circular motion.

SwitchingMoveStartAreaBlockBlue.Name: Flip-Out -- Starting Planet Blue Walls
SwitchingMoveStartAreaBlockBlue.Notes: A set of blue walls used on the starting planet of Flip-Out Galaxy.

FlowerMimic.Name: Flower Trap
FlowerMimic.Notes: A large flower that tries to eat the player if they step onto it.

CoinBlock2D.Name: Coin ? Block [2D]
CoinBlock2D.Notes: A ? Block used in SMG2's intro level. It drops exactly one Coin when hit.

GroupSwitchWatcher.Name: Multi Switch Controller
GroupSwitchWatcher.Notes: A controller that activates something if a series of switches are activated.

GoroRockTakoHeiPlanet.Name: Boulder Bowl -- Octoomba Planet
GoroRockTakoHeiPlanet.Notes: The planet where several Octoombas are fought; used in Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

PaipoCrystalBreakPlanet.Name: Yoshi Star -- Spiny Cages Planet
PaipoCrystalBreakPlanet.Notes: The second planet used in the second mission of Yoshi Star Galaxy.

DeathPromenade2DPlanet.Name: Boo's Boneyard -- Main Planet
DeathPromenade2DPlanet.Notes: The main maze planet from Boo's Boneyard Galaxy.

WaterTransparentPlanet.Name: "Temporary High Model" [WaterTransparentPlanet]
WaterTransparentPlanet.Notes: An unfinished placeholder model that displays a white cube with the text  "Temporary High Model, Please wait..." written on it.

DemoEndingNormalSky.Name: Peach's Castle Credits Sky Model
DemoEndingNormalSky.Notes: The sky model used during the end credits at Peach's Castle.

AstroDomeSkyA.Name: Bigmouth Sky
AstroDomeSkyA.Notes: The starry ocean sky model from Bigmouth Galaxy.

Garigari.Name: Large Grinder
Garigari.Notes: A buzz-saw that moves forward when activated, cutting through objects in its path.

MorphItemCollectionTeresa.Name: Decorative Boo Mushroom
MorphItemCollectionTeresa.Notes: A Boo Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

MiniMechaKoopaPlanet.Name: Toy Time: Factory Planet
MiniMechaKoopaPlanet.Notes: A blocky, factory-like planet from Toy Time Galaxy.

UFOShapePlanetWanwanRoute.Name: Sky Station -- Starting Planet Chomp Trails
UFOShapePlanetWanwanRoute.Notes: The Chain Chomps trails used on the starting planet of Sky Station Galaxy.

TubeColorsB.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Decorative Paint Tubes B
TubeColorsB.Notes: A set of paint tubes used in the background of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

TubeColorsA.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Decorative Paint Tubes A
TubeColorsA.Notes: A set of paint tubes used in the background of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

StatusFloor.Name: Continue Skating Collision
StatusFloor.Notes: Mario will continue skating, even if he would normally fall down.

BloomFlower.Name: "BloomFlower" [Broken]
BloomFlower.Notes: Model files have been removed. Therefore, the object is useless.

Obj_arg0.Description: If greater than 1, the rock will emit a purple quake wave once it lands.
Obj_arg0.Name: Bowser Encounter Number

AttackRock.Notes: Usually not visible but they get activated by Bowser's attacks. Once it appears, it falls down onto ground. Then, it becomes a yellow orb that can be smashed into Bowser. Depending on the encounter number, it can also emit shockwaves.

SW_B.Description: Opens the cage if activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Activated after the cage has disappeared.

Camera.Description: Used when the cage gets opened.

AncientCage.Notes: Stationary object that will disappear once its SW_B gets triggered. Plays the "Open" animation and destroys itself after that. Plays a short cutscene using a special camera.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how long it takes for the tile to disappear after being stepped on. Default is 140 frames.
Obj_arg0.Name: Shrinking Time

CollapsePlane.Notes: A framed platform that will shrink down and disappear after the player stepped on it. The shrinking can be paused using the second player's pointer.

SW_A.Description: The event to trigger when Mario enters the area.

Obj_arg1.Description: If set, turns off SW_A instead of turning it on.
Obj_arg1.Name: Invert Output

Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, SW_A will be disabled after leaving the area.
Obj_arg0.Name: Deactivate when area is left?

Obj_arg2.Description: If set, Mario must be on the ground inside the area to activate SW_A.
Obj_arg2.Name: Ground Use Only?

Obj_arg5.Description: If set, requires the player be using a Spin Drill. (This arg is unused in the vanilla game)
Obj_arg5.Name: Spin Drill Use Only?

SwitchArea.Notes: An area that activates a switch once the player enters it.

SW_B.Description: The object cannot move unless SW_B is activated.

SW_A.Description: Needs research

Point_arg2.Description: How this value acts is based on Point_arg7. -1 = The constant speed the object will rotate at. 1 = The amount of time it takes to complete the rotation (in frames).
Point_arg2.Name: Rotate Speed/Time

Point_arg1.Description: How this value acts is based on Point_arg7. -1 = The constant acceleration speed until the move speed is reached. 1 = Unknown behaviour
Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Speed/Time

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Point_arg0.Description: How this value acts is based on Point_arg7. -1 = The constant speed the object will use until the next point. 1 = The amount of time it takes to reach the next path point (in frames).
Point_arg0.Name: Move Speed/Time

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Point_arg6.Description: The type of rotation to use at this point.

Values.Notes: Finish rotation at the current point
Rotate between the current and next points

Point_arg6.Name: Rotation Type

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

Point_arg5.Description: Stop at the current path point and wait the desired time (in frames).
Point_arg5.Name: Wait Time

Point_arg4.Description: The axis of rotation to use
Point_arg4.Name: Rotation Axis

Point_arg3.Description: How much to rotate the object. Relative to the object's current rotation (eg. two path points are set to 180, the outcome is a full 360)
Point_arg3.Name: Rotation Angle

Point_arg7.Description: The type of calculations to perform on Point_arg0, 1, and 2.
Point_arg7.Name: Speed Calculation Type

Rail.Description: If not set, the game will crash when the platform tries to move.

Path_arg2.Description: If set, orange balls will be displayed along the path the object moves along.
Path_arg2.Name: Enable Orange Balls

RailRotateMoveObj.Notes:
An object class that uses paths to move and rotate.

It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

BeeWallShortDistArea.Notes: If the player is using the Bee power-up and is inside this area, it will make them fly a longer distance than usual.

SW_A.Description: If activated, the clouds turn to gray. If deactivated again, the clouds will disappear.

BossJugemPlanetCloud.Notes: A set of clouds. If SW_A is triggered, they will turn gray. In this state, they will deal electric damage to the player and compatible enemies. Once the switch is deactivated again, the clouds will disappear.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, use the position of the controller for the Silverstar Completion cutscene.
Obj_arg0.Name: Use Controller Position

CollectTico.Notes: A controller that keeps track of Silver Stars the player has collected. See StrayTico for individual Silver Stars.

MorphItemCollection.Notes: Displays a model of a power-up that cannot be collected. These objects only serve a decorative purpose. Natively, only the Spring, Bee, Boo, Fire, Cloud, Rock and Drill power-ups are supported. Can be registered to Starship Mario events via MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

SimpleMapObjWithEffect.Notes:
A variant of SimpleMapObj. This is a generic map object with a model, collision and looping particle effect. The UniqueName effect types that can be specified are EffectEmitStart and EffectEmitStart. If the object is called PeachCastleMeteor, it will ignore clipping checks.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

Obj_arg1.Description: Priority of the audio effect (unrelated to areas).
Obj_arg1.Name: Priority

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies which effect configuration to use.
Obj_arg0.Name: Effect Type

AudioEffectArea.Notes: Sets the audio effect once entered by the player. For example, this can enable echoes.

Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the movement speed.
Obj_arg0.Name: Speed

AreaMoveSphere.Notes: Moves compatible objects inside this area if they are bound to a floor triangle with the collision type AreaMove. Compatible objects are the player itself, BombBird and its bombs, Kuribo, Karon and CocoNut.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after displaying the tutorial once.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, this will explain how to shoot projectiles with Yoshi instead.
Obj_arg0.Name: Projectile Tutorial?

YoshiEatGuidanceArea.Notes: If the player is riding Yoshi when inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to eat items with Yoshi. If Obj_arg0 is set, it will explain how to shoot projectiles with Yoshi instead, provided that he is carrying a projectile in his mouth.

Camera.Description: Used when the player stands on the rock.

AttackRockTutorial.Notes: A rock that emits from the ground and breaks into a yellow orb. It can be smashed into KoopaSeals.

SW_A.Description: Activated whenever the player does not get launched.

Rail.Description: Specifies the movement path.

Obj_arg1.Description: Starts the "White" color animation if enabled.
Obj_arg1.Name: Enable white color

Obj_arg0.Description: Enables the two spiky rock obstacles.
Obj_arg0.Name: Enable rock obstacles

Sandstorm.Notes: Moves on a path. Launches the player into the air once they get in its range. SunakazeKun objects may use two spiky rock obstacles to defend  themselves.

StrayTico.Notes: A Silver Star that is trapped in a bubble. The player usually has to collect five of them to make a Power Star appear.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after Ground Pounding the top.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

CymbalsStep.Notes: A set of cymbal platforms with separate collision meshes. The top one can be moved like a seesaw platform. A SW_A can be activated by Ground Pounding the top. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after the required amount of time inside this area has passed.

Obj_arg0.Description: The required number of time frames to spend inside this area.
Obj_arg0.Name: Counter

CumulativeTimerSwitchArea.Notes: An area that activates its SW_A switch if the player has spent the total requested number of time frames inside this area.

PlayerSideRetainOffArea.Notes: An area that adjusts the player's movement direction all the time. Usually, when a camera change occurs, the player will keep walking into the direction the stick was held before the camera changed. This prevents exactly that.

CrescentSeesawPlanet.Notes: An object that tilts towards the side that the player stands on.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only dispense objects while this switch is activated.

Obj_arg2.Description: Unknown
Obj_arg2.Name: Unknown

BombHeiLauncher.Notes: A dispenser that releases bombs or Bob-ombs. If the object is named BombLauncher, it creates bombs whereas it creates Bob-ombs when it's called BombHeiLauncher. There can only be one bomb or Bob-omb at once.

SW_B.Description: Disappears if activated, reappears if deactivated.

SW_A.Description: Plays "Change" animation if activated.

DemoCast.Description: Appears if  action gets triggered.

Obj_arg1.Description: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.
Obj_arg1.Name: Hide during Intro?

Obj_arg0.Description: Active distance from player's position.
Obj_arg0.Name: Range

Obj_arg2.Description: Always active if enabled.
Obj_arg2.Name: Always Active?

AirFar100m.Notes: Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section. Unlike other Air objects, this has a far clipping range of 100 meters.

SW_B.Description: Invalidates this area if this switch gets activated. However, this only works in "TwisterTowerGalaxy".

Obj_arg1.Description: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 0. ChangeBgmState index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 2. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 1.
Obj_arg1.Name: Argument 1

Obj_arg0.Description: The music change type.
Obj_arg0.Name: Change Type

Obj_arg3.Description: Sets how music changes are handled during Comet missions.

Values.Notes: Music change is ignored during Comet
Music change is enforced during Comet

Obj_arg3.Name: Comet Music Type

Obj_arg2.Description: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 1. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 2.
Obj_arg2.Name: Argument 2

BgmChangeArea.Notes: Changes the background music using the stage's music information in StageBgmInfo. Supports several different changing modes.

SW_B.Description: If used, it will not rotate or move on its path while this switch is activated.

DemoCast.Description: Appears if the action is activated.

Rail.Description: Used for MapPartsRailMover movement.

BlueStarCupsulePlanet.Notes: Planet-like objects that feature a large Pull Star inside them. The player can use the pointer on the Pull Star to make it attract them. UFOBlueStarCupsule is hardcoded to use a lower target radius.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: The player's movement speed, multiplied by 100. Default is 100.
Obj_arg1.Name: Speed

Obj_arg0.Description: Defines the wind gust's length. Default is 4000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Wind Length

BigFan.Notes: A fan object that creates a gust of wind that can push Blimp Yoshi and the player if they use the Boo power-up. If this is placed in TeresaMario2DGalaxy, it will use a slightly different sound effect.

YoshiBlock.Notes: A somewhat glitchy object that requires a custom file to be used. It loads the texture from YoshiBlock.arc/YoshiBlock/YoshiBlockTex.bti and it is a simple block that has no specific use. For some reason, it can't be seen in first-person view or during intro camera cutscenes.

Obj_arg0.Description: Defines how the player enters the scene.
Obj_arg0.Name: Entrance Type

Camera.Description: The starting camera to be used when spawning at this point.

MarioActor.Notes: A controller that sets the spawn point for the player at the start of a mission and at Checkpoints. May also be used for other things such as the warp areas on the Comet Observatory. If placed in a generic object placement file, this will create a glitchy clone of the player.

Group.Description: If any of the group members gets frozen by Player 2, all of them will stop moving.

Rail.Description: Defines the movement path.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies the side direction.
Obj_arg1.Name: Side Type

Point_arg0.Description: Defines the time in frames before the object will move again.
Point_arg0.Name: Waiting Time

Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the movement speed.
Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies the gravity calculation type.

Values.Notes: Negated gravity is up. Always calculate gravity
Negated gravity is up. Calculate gravity once

Obj_arg3.Name: Gravity Type

Obj_arg2.Description: Sets the shadow type.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Type

BirikyuWithFace.Notes: A small electric ball enemy that causes electrical damage. It can only be defeated using the Invincibility power-up. They will move on a path or in a circular motion if no path was assigned. When it attacks something, for example the player, it will pause for a short amount of time.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Bussun.Notes: A dinosaur enemy that moves around on a path. It can be defeated by stomping on its belly. It damages the player upon contact. The Orange Luma can freeze its movement.

Obj_arg7.Description: The animation frame to use as the pipe's color.
Obj_arg7.Name: Color Frame

SW_B.Description: This switch activates when Mario exits the pipe.

Obj_arg6.Description: If enabled, the rotation of the pipe will not be affected by gravity.
Obj_arg6.Name: Ignore Gravity?

SW_A.Description: If set, the pipe will not be enterable until the switch is activated. EarthenPipeInWater won't show it's water vortex until this switch is activated.

Obj_arg1.Description: The force to push the player upwards when exiting the pipe. Default 25.
Obj_arg1.Name: Exit Force (Upwards)

Obj_arg0.Description: The force to push the player forwards when exiting the pipe. Default 5.
Obj_arg0.Name: Exit Force (Forwards)

Obj_arg3.Description: Set two pipes to have the same number to link them together.
Obj_arg3.Name: Connection ID

Obj_arg2.Description: The pipe's behavior after being entered.
Obj_arg2.Name: Mode

Obj_arg5.Description: The state of the music that plays after exiting the pipe.
Obj_arg5.Name: Music State

Obj_arg4.Description: Index of the music to change to once the pipe is left.
Obj_arg4.Name: Music Change

EarthenPipe.Notes: A Warp Pipe that can transport the player to another Warp Pipe instance. However, it also supports various other modes and functions unrelated to transportation. Warp Pipes that are placed in WhiteSnowGalaxy have a hardcoded clipping range of 1000.

SlopeRunningCancelArea.Notes: The player's running movement will be immediately stopped if they touch a steep surface inside this area.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will be defeated immediately.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after killing this enemy.

Obj_arg0.Description: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.
Obj_arg0.Name: Enable Returning

Camera.Description: Used when player gets bounced off.

BegomanSpring.Notes: A rotating robot enemy that features a spring head which the player can bounce off. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. If the object is called BegomanSpringHide, it will remain in the ground until the player gets in its range. This variant will also spawn a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack. There can only be one Topmini at a time.

Balloonfish.Notes: A blowfish enemy that inflates once the player gets in its range. It will then home onto the player and explode after a certain amount of time. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

SW_A.Description: Makes it Ground Poundable once activated.

Rail.Description: Specifies the points that she will look at move to randomly.

BossBussun.Notes:
A dinosaur-like boss that sleeps until the player Ground Pounds the weak spot on her belly. Excluding the first time, the player has to damage her three times. Starting the second phase, she will shoot fire balls that can temporarily cover manhole grates in lava. During the last phase, she will turn red and move faster. She is supposed to be placed on a disk-like planet as she can freely walk around such planets and change sides.
She uses two GeneralPos.  is used as her position after the battle.  is used to position the player after the battle. She always spawns a Power Star which needs to be set up in the galaxy's Scenario file.

CometFireDanceArea.Notes: An area that, when entered, forces the player to run in a straight line. The player will jump as high as the third jump of a Triple Jump.

SW_DEAD.Description: Activated when popped.

AirBubble.Notes: A stationary bubble that replenishes air when collected underwater. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

BrightSun.Notes: Draws a bright sun-like sphere in the background that moves with the camera's position. If the player is inside a LensFlareArea, the lens flare effect will be rendered around the sun.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

CloudSea.Notes: A simple object with a model and collision. Very limited in its functionality compared to other simple map object classes.

SW_B.Description: If used, the fan will not rotate if the switch is not actived.

BigFanCloud.Notes: A generic, rotating fan. It does not create a wind gust unlike BigFan.

Obj_arg1.Description: Overrides the LOD system by forcing the objects to use this specified LOD mode instead.
Obj_arg1.Name: LOD Mode

Obj_arg0.Description: The ViewGroup of objects that should be rendered.
Obj_arg0.Name: View Group ID

ViewGroupCtrlArea.Notes: When entered by the player, all compatible objects in its ViewGroup will be forced to render.

CometNoSpinArea.Notes: An area that, when entered, prevents the player from using the Spin Attack. The player won't be able to get rid of it until they leave the area again.

Obj_arg3.Description: Color of the Star Bits.
Obj_arg3.Name: Color

Obj_arg1.Description: Brightness filter level. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 255.
Obj_arg1.Name: Threshold

Obj_arg0.Description: Strength of the bloom effect. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 128.
Obj_arg0.Name: Intensity

Obj_arg3.Description: Secondary intensity argument.
Obj_arg3.Name: Intensity 2

Obj_arg2.Description: Primary intensity argument.
Obj_arg2.Name: Intensity 1

BloomArea.Notes: An area that applies bloom effects to compatible objects inside it. For this, the object needs a Bloom.arc model file. However, not all objects support this natively.

DemoCast.Description: Will be used during the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: Enables or disables collision binding.
Obj_arg1.Name: Binder Type

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after it is destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how the item appears after SW_APPEAR gets activated.
Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance Type

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies if the item is stored in a bubble or not.
Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble?

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the power-up falls down after appearing or not.

Values.Notes: Stays in position where it appeared

Obj_arg2.Name: Landing Type

Obj_arg5.Description: Specifies what appearance event cameras are to be used.
Obj_arg5.Name: Appearance Camera Type

Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the shadow and clipping properties.

Values.Notes: Calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once
Calculate shadow drop and direction from gravity once
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow & Clipping Type

Rail.Description: Specifies the path that it moves on.

MorphItemRock.Notes: A collectable item that turns the player into a Rock character. This power-up state allows them to turn into a rolling rock.

SW_B.Description: Disappears if activated, reappears if deactivated.

SW_A.Description: Plays "Change" animation if activated.

DemoCast.Description: Appears if  action gets triggered.

Obj_arg1.Description: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.
Obj_arg1.Name: Hide during Intro?

Obj_arg0.Description: Active distance from player's position.
Obj_arg0.Name: Range

Obj_arg2.Description: Always active if enabled.
Obj_arg2.Name: Always Active?

Air.Notes: Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section.

Obj_arg1.Description: The music's volume multiplied by 100.
Obj_arg1.Name: Volume

Obj_arg0.Description: The music's fade time in frames. Default is 90.
Obj_arg0.Name: Fade Time

BgmVolumeFadeArea.Notes: When the player enters this area, the music's volume will be changed. The volume resets if the player leaves the area again.

BindEndArea.Notes: A useless area that has no actual effect in-game.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will enter the second folding state.

SW_A.Description: If activated, it will enter the first folding state.

BendSwanpPlanet.Notes: A special planet that can fold two times. Each state also has a separate collision mesh that gets loaded in. Usually, the planet will be in its unfolded state. SW_A and SW_B are used to fold it.

SW_A.Description: Activated after a Star Ball gets cracked open.

BallOpener.Notes: If the player touches this object's center while riding a Star Ball, it will pull the Star Ball towards its center and the Star Ball will be cracked open.

CelestrialArea.Notes: If the player attempts to exit this area while using the Flying power-up, they will be restricted to move inside the area only. The flying effect will be cancelled when the player reaches the edge of this area.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how the item appears after appearing.
Obj_arg1.Name: Appearance Type

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after being collected.

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies the clipping type.
Obj_arg3.Name: Clipping Type

Rail.Description: Used for movement after the item appears. Broken in SMG2.

BenefitItemOneUp.Notes: An item that grants the player an extra life when collected. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

Obj_arg0.Description: The number of required hits on the object for it to spawn a coin.
Obj_arg0.Name: Hits Needed For Coin

YukkinaGroundSnow.Notes: A destroyable snow spike object used by the Yukkina boss.

DemoCast.Description: Will be used during the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: Enables or disables collision binding.
Obj_arg1.Name: Binder Type

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after it is destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how the item appears after SW_APPEAR gets activated.
Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance Type

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies if the item is stored in a bubble or not.
Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble?

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the power-up falls down after appearing or not.

Values.Notes: Stays in position where it appeared

Obj_arg2.Name: Landing Type

Obj_arg5.Description: Specifies what appearance event cameras are to be used.
Obj_arg5.Name: Appearance Camera Type

Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the shadow and clipping properties.

Values.Notes: Calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once
Calculate shadow drop and direction from gravity once
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow & Clipping Type

Rail.Description: Specifies the path that it moves on.

MorphItemBee.Notes: A collectable item that turns the player into a Bee character. This power-up state allows them to fly around like a bee.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

AutoMakeMapObj.Notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

Obj_arg1.Description: The number of debris to be generated. Stops generation after the requested amount has appeared. If set to -1, it will keep spawning more debris.
Obj_arg1.Name: Debris Count

Obj_arg0.Description: Time between spawns in frames.
Obj_arg0.Name: Delay

CaveInCube.Notes: Periodically spawns collapsing debris that can damage the player upon contact. The individual debris can be frozen by the Orange Luma. For each spawn, a random debris model gets loaded. These models are called CaveInPartsBig, CaveInPartsMiddle and CaveInPartsSmall.

TicoSeedGuidanceCube.Notes: If the player stands inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to feed a Hungry Luma with Star Bits. Does not work in SMG2.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies what camera setup to use after entering this area.
Obj_arg0.Name: Camera ID

Obj_arg3.Description: Bitfield of contexts that are affected by camera changes through this area. In SMG2, these values can be combined by adding the values together. If set to 0, the game will set this value to 1. In SMG1, this setting is much more complicated: The lower four bits can be used to specify a single category (0 = Normal, 1 = Underwater, ...). These bits will be ignored if bit 4 or higher is set. These upper bits then correspond to be bitmask values (16 = Normal, 32 = Underwater, ...).
Obj_arg3.Name: Affected Contexts

Obj_arg2.Description: The camera area with the highest priority and requested categories will take effect.
Obj_arg2.Name: Priority

CubeCameraArea.Notes: An area that changes the current camera once the player enters this area. The actual camera parameters are specified in the zone's CameraParam.bcam. The corresponding camera ID label is generated using the printf format string c:%04x. For example, if your camera area has an Obj_arg0 of 15, the corresponding ID label would be c:000f. This can also be restricted to take effect only under different circumstances (Obj_arg3).

Rail.Description: Specifies the movement path. Used by MapPartsRailMover and MapPartsRailPosture.

Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the rotation's speed.
Obj_arg0.Name: Rotation Speed

BeeFlowerHover.Notes: A rotating platform that can be stood on using the Bee power-up. If the player does not have any of these two power-ups and touches the platform, it will temporarily disappear.

Obj_arg0.Description: The Start ID of the zone to respawn the player at.
Obj_arg0.Name: Spawn Point ID

RestartObj.Notes: A checkpoint flag used in several galaxies.

SW_DEAD.Description: Activated when killed.

Obj_arg0.Description: Initial nerve state.
Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance

Obj_arg2.Description: Keeps respawning after killing if enabled.
Obj_arg2.Name: Respawn

Meramera.Notes: An enemy that can damage the player upon contact. Can be stunned with a Spin Attack which reveals its core. The core can be destroyed by most of Mario's actions.

ScenarioStarter.Notes: The galaxy fly-in controller that sets up the fly-in path an sequence for a Star mission.

Obj_arg1.Description: The game reads this value but never uses it. This is only read if Obj_arg0 is set.
Obj_arg1.Name: Useless

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after destroying it.

Obj_arg0.Description: Plays an animation called Move if enabled. No actual object of this class has such animations, so it's never used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Play "Move" Animation

Obj_arg3.Description: The number of Star Bits to spawn after destroying it. Obj_arg2 has to be set to -1. Default is 5.
Obj_arg3.Name: Number of Star Bits

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies what kind of item to spawn after destroying it.
Obj_arg2.Name: Item Type

Obj_arg4.Description: If set, the remaining broken pieces will be hidden.
Obj_arg4.Name: Hide Broken Pieces?

CrystalCageOpa.Notes: An opaque crystal that can be destroyed with a Spin Attack, Yoshi's projectiles, the Spin Drill, a Koopa Shell or the Orange Luma as well as any enemy attack. It may reward the player with some items. Loads a separate model for the breaking animation.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

Rail.Description: Defines the path that it moves on passively.

Obj_arg1.Description: The range in which it will fall down onto the ground after detecting the player.
Obj_arg1.Name: Attacking Range

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated once defeated.

Obj_arg0.Description: Defines the movement speed, multiplied by 1000. Default is 600.
Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed

Obj_arg2.Description: If enabled, it won't spawn any Star Bits after being defeated.
Obj_arg2.Name: Spawn no Star Bits?

Battan.Notes: A stone block enemy that moves on a fixed path. Once it sees the player, it will move towards them to fall down on them. Once it lies on the ground, the weak point on its back can be Ground Pounded. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma. It will spawn 7 Star Bits if defeated.

ForbidTriangleJumpArea.Notes: An area that prevents any angled Wall Jumps. Instead, the jumping direction will be directly opposite of the Wall Jumped collision triangle.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after killing this enemy.

Obj_arg0.Description: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.
Obj_arg0.Name: Enable Returning

BegomanBaby.Notes: A small robot enemy that will make the player spin around if touched. However, it can be defeated using Spin Attacks. If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It can be defeated by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

YoshiSendOffArea.Notes: If Yoshi is inside this area after the player dismounts him, he will play a special animation where he waves the player goodbye.

Obj_arg0.Description: Valid range until the shadow fades out.
Obj_arg0.Name: Range

ExtraWallCheckArea.Notes: An area which, when entered, casts a soft circular shadow onto the surface perpendicular to the player.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

CollapseRailMoveObj.Notes: A platform that moves on a set path and disappears after reaching the end. Once it disappears, it will reappear at the start after a few seconds.

Obj_arg1.Description: Does not spawn a Star Bit when touched.
Obj_arg1.Name: Disable Star Bits?

Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the BRK color frame.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color

Butterfly.Notes: A decorative butterfly. It can spawn a Star Bit when touched with the pointer. If the player is sleeping near a butterfly, it will eventually land on their nose.

Obj_arg0.Description: Delay until the rock appears for the first time.
Obj_arg0.Name: First Appearance Delay

AttackRockFinal.Notes: These are usually not visible until Bowser activates them during the final fight. These fly to their actual position and will remain there. The orb can be smashed into Bowser.

SW_A.Description: If used, the fruit can only be eaten when this switch is active.

BalloonFruit.Notes: A fruit that, when eaten, transforms Yoshi into Blimp Yoshi. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma to make it swing. Can be temporarily destroyed using Koopa Shells or Ground Pounds.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated or deactivated whether the specified condition is fulfilled or not.

Obj_arg0.Description: The required power-up state condition to activate the switch.
Obj_arg0.Name: Condition

MorphSwitchArea.Notes: If the player stays inside this area and fulfills the specified conditions (Obj_arg0), it will activate its SW_A switch. If the player leaves the area again or the condition is not met anymore, the switch will be deactivated again. If Obj_arg0 is set to 1, it will check if the player is "in rush". This refers to the state where the player is bound to another object, for example Fluzzard, Rock Mushroom's rolling rock, the Star Ball and more.

Obj_arg1.Description: Life duration of a single bubble in frames.
Obj_arg1.Name: Duration

Obj_arg0.Description: Time between bubble spawns in frames.
Obj_arg0.Name: Delay

AirBubbleGenerator.Notes: A nozzle that periodically generates several air bubbles that replenish the player's air when underwater.

SW_A.Description: If used, the flame won't appear until Mario shoots a Fire Ball at it. Then, this switch will be activated.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it will be connected to the collision below. This makes it move along moving objects, for example.
Obj_arg1.Name: Attach to Collision?

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the item to be spawned after putting out the fire.
Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type

Candlestand.Notes: A torch with a flame that can burn the player upon contact. Usually, the flame can be put out using a Spin Attack to make an item appear, however, the flame of CandlestandIceVolcano cannot be put out. Said variant may also appear without a flame if it uses a SW_A. Instead, the player can use Fire Balls to lit the fire and activate the switch.

YoshiCaptureGuidanceArea.Notes: If the player is riding Yoshi when inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to use Yoshi Grapples.

BeeEater.Notes: A stretchy plant with spikes that will lunge onto the player to damage them. Cannot be defeated, however, they can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit at them.

LavaFloater.Notes: A platform that sinks when the player steps on it.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will fly away from Mario.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Rail.Description: The path that it flies on.

Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, it will fly far above the actual path. Also disables clipping.
Obj_arg0.Name: Flies Higher?

BombBird.Notes: A bird enemy that flies on a path. If the player gets near it, it will drop a bomb that explodes after some seconds. It can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit on it. Can be defeated using most of the player's attacks. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

DemoCast.Description: Will be used during the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: Enables or disables collision binding.
Obj_arg1.Name: Binder Type

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after it is destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how the item appears after SW_APPEAR gets activated.
Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance Type

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies if the item is stored in a bubble or not.
Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble?

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the power-up falls down after appearing or not.

Values.Notes: Stays in position where it appeared

Obj_arg2.Name: Landing Type

Obj_arg5.Description: Specifies what appearance event cameras are to be used.
Obj_arg5.Name: Appearance Camera Type

Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the shadow and clipping properties.

Values.Notes: Calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once
Calculate shadow drop and direction from gravity once
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow & Clipping Type

Rail.Description: Specifies the path that it moves on.

MorphItemHopper.Notes: A collectable item that turns the player into a Spring character. This power-up state allows them to bounce around in a spring.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

SimpleMapObj.Notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

SW_B.Description: Causes all Coins to disappear immediately once this switch gets activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after collecting all connected Coins.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies the timer during which the Coins will be visible. Coins will appear indefinitely if set to -1. Default is -1.
Obj_arg1.Name: Timer

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated if not all Coins have been collected in time.

CoinLinkGroup.Notes: Creates a set of Coins that will appear once this object's SW_APPEAR gets triggered. These Coins will only be collectable for the specified period of time or indefinitely (Obj_arg0). If the player collects all linked Coins in time, they will be rewarded with a 1-Up. The actual Coin objects need to be linked to this object by setting their GeneratorId's to this object's l_id. Compatible Coin objects are CircleCoinGroup and RailCoin.

SW_A.Description: If not activated, it won't pursue Mario and will walk around passively. It will still be able to fuse when touched, though.

Obj_arg1.Description: The explosion's radius. Default 500.0f
Obj_arg1.Name: Explosion Range

SW_DEAD.Description: Activated after it explodes.

Obj_arg0.Description: The time until the bomb explodes. Default 600.
Obj_arg0.Name: Countdown

BombHei.Notes: A bomb or bomb-like enemy, depending on the object's name. Bomb creates a simple bomb that can be picked up and thrown whereas BombHei creates the actual enemy that will walk around and fuse if it sees the player. It can be stunned and picked up after using a Spin Attack.

Obj_arg0.Description: If checked, no Yoshi Egg is spawned, only the nest.
Obj_arg0.Name: No Yoshi Egg

YoshiEgg.Notes: Handles spawning and respawning of Yoshi eggs.

Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Coins to be spawned. Default is 8.
Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Coins

CoinAppearSpot.Notes: A point in space where the requested number of Coins will be spawned after activating its SW_APPEAR switch.

SW_A.Description: Applies frame 1 of the TexChange.btk animation.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

SimpleTextureSwitchChangeObj.Notes:
A variant of SimpleMapObj that starts the TexChange.btk animation and freezes its frame at 1 once its SW_A gets activated. Like SimpleMapObj, this is a generic map object with a model and collision.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

SimpleEnvironmentObj.Notes: Decorative objects that are meant to be placed in the background of a galaxy, such as asteroids.

SW_A.Description: Activated after the request is fulfilled.

BringEnemy.Notes: This registers and controls the enemies requested by a CareTakerHunter. This object is usually linked to a CareTakerHunter using GeneratorId. Otherwise, it's useless on its own. The requested enemies can be attached to this object by setting their GeneratorId to this object's l_id. Supported enemies are Kuribo, TogeBegomanLauncher, BegomanLauncher and BegomanBabyLauncher. If a requested enemy is in this object's sensor range, it will notify the linked CareTakerHunter.

BeeJumpBall.Notes: A bouncy berry that can be bounced off with the Bee power-up. If touched by the player while they don't have the Bee power-up, it will pop and reappear after about three seconds.

TogepinAttackFoulArea.Notes: If the player enters this area, any TogepinScorer will detect this as a foul. If this happens, the player needs to get out of the area to make the minigame resume. This area has no effect if the player is rolling around using the Rock power-up.

Obj_arg7.Description: The ID of the Power Star this crate will spawn. (The scenario needs to have it's PowerStarAppearObj set!)
Obj_arg7.Name: Power Star ID

Obj_arg1.Description: If enabled, the leftover broken pieces will be hidden.
Obj_arg1.Name: Hide Broken Pieces

Obj_arg0.Description: The number of coins to spawn when broken. Default 1.
Obj_arg0.Name: Coin Count

Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, will play a jingle when broken.
Obj_arg3.Name: Play 'Secret Found' Sound

Obj_arg2.Description: The number of coins to spawn when broken. Default 0.
Obj_arg2.Name: Starbit Count

Obj_arg4.Description: If enabled, spawns a 1-UP mushroom when broken.
Obj_arg4.Name: Spawn 1-UP

WoodBox.Notes: A wooden box that can be destroyed through most attacks. It can spawn various different items.

MarioNoCapArea.Notes: An area that hides Mario's cap when entered.

PlaneCollisionArea.Notes: An area that extends the player's sensor range to detect items. This allows the player to collect an item while they stand closely behind or in front of it. This depends on the camera's view direction.

Obj_arg1.Description: Time until the rings disappear.
Obj_arg1.Name: Delay

Obj_arg0.Description: The speed at which the radius increases.
Obj_arg0.Name: Speed

Obj_arg2.Description: Color of the rings.
Obj_arg2.Name: Electricity Color

CometRainbowArea.Notes: An area that, when entered, forces the player to use the Invincibility power-up. The player won't be able to get rid of it until they leave the area again.

SW_B.Description: Makes the object stop while the switch is not active.

SW_A.Description: Makes the object move while the switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Rail.Description: The path that the platform moves on. Used by MapPartsRailMover.

BigRepeatWarpLift.Notes: A platform that moves on a path and teleports back to the beginning after it has reached the end.

DemoCast.Description: Special cutscene used before the actual boss fight begins.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after being defeated.

Camera.Description: Used during the intro, midway cutscene and ending.

BellyDragon.Notes: A long dragon boss. It features six weak spots that have to be popped using the player's attacks. It always spawns a Power Star. It uses a GeneralPos with the name  to position the player during the intro. If it's part of a cutscene, it also creates cutscene objects for KoopaJr and KoopaJrPod. See BellyDragonLv1Zone for a better look inside the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: Radius of the Star Bit circle, only used if a path has not been assigned.
Obj_arg1.Name: Circle radius

Obj_arg0.Description: Amount of Star Bits to be distrbuted along the path or circle.
Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Star Bits

Obj_arg3.Description: The color the Star Bits will be.
Obj_arg3.Name: Star Bit Color

Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector and matrix register cameras.
Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

Rail.Description: Its main movement path that it flies and walks on.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after it's defeated.

Camera.Description: Used when falling onto the ground.

BossStinkBug.Notes: A large bug-like boss that can be damaged by Ground Pounding the weak spot on its back. It needs to be damaged three times. During the first phase, it moves slowly on the ground. After taking the first hit, it starts flying. And in the last phase, its skin turns red and it will make aggressive turns while it flies. While it flies, it will periodically drop explosive bombs that can hurt the player. After it is defeated, it will spawn a Power Star, which also requires changes to the galaxy's Scenario file.

Obj_arg7.Description: If true, the Coin will be placed inside an Air Bubble.
Obj_arg7.Name: Inside Bubble?

SW_B.Description: Kills the Coin if this switch gets activated.

Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the shadow will be calculated at all times and the game takes the shadow range into account when clipping.
Obj_arg3.Name: Shadow Calculation

Obj_arg4.Description: Defines how to to position and rotate the Coin. May also connect the Coin to the collision below in SMG2.

Values.Notes: Rotation & shadow direction affected by gravity
Rotation ignores gravity & shadow direction affected by gravity
Attach to Collision below & shadow direction not affected by gravity (SMG2 only)

Obj_arg4.Name: Pose Type

Coin.Notes: One of the game's main collectibles. There are two variants: Coins (Coin) and Purple Coins (PurpleCoin). Normal Coins can restore one health point if collected by the player. Purple Coins do not restore health, though. Purple Coins can only be used in Purple Comet scenarios or appropriately configured Scenario files. Normal Coins won't appear during Daredevil (Dark) Comets. Both variants can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2. If they are stored inside a bubble, they will also restore the player's air when underwater. Coins will spin slower when placed underwater.

DemoCast.Description: The cutscene that it belongs to. Expected to be called .

CompleteEndingDemoObj.Notes: Creates and registers several objects that appear during the ending cutscene in the Comet Observatory's library. The cutscene that it tries to register to has to be called . The individual objects with their model name and object name are RosettaReading (), RosettaChair (), TicoBaby () and MarioCap or LuigiCap (). It has a special nerve action for cutscenes which makes all objects appear when triggered. The GeneralPos  marks the reference point for the objects.

Obj_arg7.Description: If enabled, the block will be activated for a set amount of time only.
Obj_arg7.Name: Is Timed?

Obj_arg1.Description: If Obj_arg7 is set, this specifies the timer until the block disappears again.
Obj_arg1.Name: Activation Time

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the activation range to the player's position. If set to -1, the model's diameter is used instead.
Obj_arg0.Name: Activation Range

AssemblyBlock.Notes: Remains at a resting position that can be defined by linking a GeneralPos with the name  to it. Once the player gets in its range, it will move to its actual position. This class supports ShapeModelNo models. The timed activation requires additional effect data under the UniqueName "Blur".

RotateMoveObjClipParts.Notes: Your typical RotateMoveObjParts, but with additional support for Clipping

Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register cameras.
Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

Rail.Description: The path it moves on when throwing Spinys.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after it's defeated.

BossJugem.Notes:
A large variant of a Lakitu who wears glasses and rides on a purple cloud. He throws Spinies at the player and may also use thunderbolts to attack them. When he throws Spinies, he will be moving on a path whereas he moves between two separate points when using the thunderbolt attack. He can be damaged by thrown Shells or Yoshi projectiles. After dealing three hits, he will spawn a Power Star. This requires an edit to the galaxy's Scenario file.
This object also uses several GeneralPos.  and  are used as the right and left points that it moves between when using the thunderbolt attack.  is used as the orientation point that the camera will look at most of the time.  defines the position of the intro cutscene.  defines the position of the defeated cutscene.

Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it enables DemoSimpleCast functionality.
Obj_arg0.Name: Use DemoSimpleCast?

CoconutTreeLeafGroup.Notes: Creates a group of animated palm tree leaves with collision. If the player Ground Pounds one of the leaves, it will swing at a faster rate.

CometHopperArea.Notes: An area that, when entered, forces the player to use the Spring power-up. The player won't be able to get rid of it until they leave the area again.

Obj_arg2.Description: The type of reflection to use
Obj_arg2.Name: Reflect Type

ItemDrill.Notes: A drill power-up that allows the player to dig through certain dirt upon spinning.

SW_B.Description: Disappears if activated, reappears if deactivated.

SW_A.Description: Plays "Change" animation if activated.

DemoCast.Description: Appears if  action gets triggered.

Obj_arg1.Description: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.
Obj_arg1.Name: Hide during Intro?

Obj_arg0.Description: Active distance from player's position.
Obj_arg0.Name: Range

Obj_arg2.Description: Always active if enabled.
Obj_arg2.Name: Always Active?

AfterMapObjDrawAir.Notes: Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section. Unlike other Air objects, this gets executed and rendered after most other objects.

RotateMoveObj.Notes:
An object that will rotate along it's axis.

It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

Obj_arg7.Description: A delay until this bullet can collide with terrain. Default 35.
Obj_arg7.Name: Binder Activation delay

Obj_arg6.Description: The lifespan that bullets will live for before being automatically killed. Default 600.
Obj_arg6.Name: Bullet Lifetime

Obj_arg1.Description: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.
Obj_arg1.Name: Turn Speed Multiplier

Obj_arg0.Description: The range the player has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Homing Activation Range

Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, Gravity will be ignored.
Obj_arg3.Name: Ignore Gravity?

Obj_arg2.Description: If enabled, the bullets won't home in on Mario.
Obj_arg2.Name: Disable Homing)

Obj_arg4.Description: The amount of bullets that can exist at once. Default 1.
Obj_arg4.Name: Bullet Count

HomingKillerLauncher.Notes: A point that launches bullet-like enemies. "HomingKiller" generates Bullet Bills, "Torpedo" generates Torpedo Teds and "MagnumKiller" generates Banzai Bills. The enemies will be generated periodically.

YoshiFruit.Notes: An object which can be eatean by Yoshi and releases a Star Bit. If Yoshi eats ten of these, the player will be granted a 1-Up.

Obj_arg0.Description: The ID of the light to use.
Obj_arg0.Name: Light ID

LightArea.Notes: An area that changes lighting when entered.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Obj_arg0.Description: Defines its movement speed. Default is 3.
Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed

Buzz.Notes: An enemy that moves on a set path. If no path is specified, it will remain in place.

Obj_arg0.Description: The speed to launch the player in Rock form at. Default 50.
Obj_arg0.Name: Speed

ForceDashCube.Notes:
An area that gives the player a speed boost when entered using the Rock Mushroom.
Requires a valid KCL floor code of 39 (ForceDash).
The direction of the Dash is determined by the rotation of the area. (Boost is on the Z axis)

SW_A.Description: Activated when all linked Star Chips are collected.

Obj_arg0.Description: The ID of this group for Star Chips to link to.
Obj_arg0.Name: Group ID

Obj_arg3.Description: If checked, re-activates SW_A upon a soft reload (ex: after a death) if already activated before.
Obj_arg3.Name: Re-activate When Previously Activated

Obj_arg2.Description: The distance the player has to be within of this object for the Star Chip Counter to be displayed.
Obj_arg2.Name: Star Chip Counter Display Range

YellowChipGroup.Notes:
A controller which activates SW_A when all Star Chip (YellowChip) objects linked to it by the obj_arg0 value are collected. It is recommended to have groups of 5 Star Chips.

This controller is also responsible for displaying the Star Chip Counter layout at the top of the screen.

SW_A.Description: Remains stationary if the switch is not activated.

Rail.Description: The path points to jump between.

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how items should be spawned.
Obj_arg1.Name: Item Type

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after it dies.

Obj_arg0.Description: The delay until it starts jumping around.
Obj_arg0.Name: Starting Delay

Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, it will be attached to the collision below.
Obj_arg3.Name: Connect to MapObj?

BoomerangBros.Notes: A Koopa Troopa that throws boomerangs to attack the player. These boomerangs can be destroyed by the player's attacks or eaten by Yoshi to throw them at other objects. Ground Pounding it will defeat it immediately. Other attacks usually stun it first which gives the player an advantage to attack it. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma as well.

Obj_arg7.Description: The Model displayed inside the Crystal.

Values.Notes: Star Bits (Spawns 6 Star Bits in SMG2)

Obj_arg7.Name: Dummy Model

Obj_arg6.Description: The Color of the Luma or Toad inside of the Crystal.
Obj_arg6.Name: Luma/Toad Color

SW_A.Description: Forces the Crystal to be destroyed when a switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Activates a switch when the Crystal is destroyed.

Obj_arg4.Description: Determines if the Crystal falls when it spawns via SW_APPEAR.
Obj_arg4.Name: Is Falling

Obj_arg7.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default 2000.
Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Length

Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how the item appears after appearing.
Obj_arg1.Name: Appearance Type

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after being collected.

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies the clipping type.
Obj_arg3.Name: Clipping Type

Rail.Description: Used for movement after the item appears. Broken in SMG2.

BenefitItemInvincible.Notes: An item that grants the player the Invincibility power-up when collected.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

GlaringLight.Notes: A variant of SimpleMapObj that gets rendered after most other objects. This is a generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

SW_A.Description: Activated when hit, deactivated when hit again.

Obj_arg1.Description: If enabled, it cannot be hit again util the SW_A event deactivates again.
Obj_arg1.Name: Activation Mode

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the rotation when hit.
Obj_arg0.Name: Rotation Direction

Obj_arg2.Description: Sets the shadow drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

ArrowSwitch.Notes: A rotating switch object that can be activated using Spin Attacks.

RecoveryFloorControlArea.Notes: Normally, when the player falls into a PullBackArea, they won't be returned to the last position on Ice or GlassIce collision. Instead, the game treats several other collision types as safe rescuing positions. However, this area ignores the check for these two collision types so that these collision triangles are treated as proper rescuing positions.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

BombHeiRed.Notes: A friendly Bob-omb NPC that can be talked to.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will be defeated immediately.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after killing this enemy.

Obj_arg0.Description: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.
Obj_arg0.Name: Enable Returning

BegomanSpike.Notes: A rotating robot enemy that will make the player spin around if touched. If the player touches its spiky head, they will take damage. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well.

Obj_arg7.Description: The index of this launch star's path in the internal SpinDriverPathStorage class. This Arg is read by both games but only functions in SMG1.
Obj_arg7.Name: SpinDriverPathStorage Index

SW_A.Description: If set, the Launch Star will be shrunken (and not usable) until the switch is activated.

Obj_arg1.Description: The distance to drop the shadow. Default -1.
Obj_arg1.Name: Shadow Drop Distance

Obj_arg0.Description: The amount of time the flight takes to complete (in frames). Default 300.
Obj_arg0.Name: Flight Time

Obj_arg3.Description: The number of Cameras to be read from the camera file.
Obj_arg3.Name: Camera Count

Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the Launch Star won't pull the player towards it when they get near.
Obj_arg2.Name: Don't Grab Mario

Obj_arg5.Description: The rotation that the player lands at. (NOTE: Needs further research as the rotation angle seems inconsistent)
Obj_arg5.Name: Landing Rotation

Obj_arg4.Description: If enabled, the usual Launch Star appear jingle will not play.
Obj_arg4.Name: No Appear Jingle

Rail.Description: The path that the player will follow when flying.

SuperSpinDriver.Notes: A large star-shaped ring that launches the player from one point to another.

Obj_arg1.Description: If checked, the object doesn't cast a shadow.
Obj_arg1.Name: No shadow

Obj_arg0.Description: Possibly changes the animation from "Wait" to "WaitFree" (Needs research)
Obj_arg0.Name: Unknown 0

Obj_arg7.Description: Tries to load the model CapsuleCageNoKeyHole if enabled. This model does not exist anymore, though.
Obj_arg7.Name: Use Alternate Model?

SW_B.Description: If activated, the cage will be opened.

Obj_arg6.Description: If set, it will play the STM_STAR_CHANCE_3 music once it gets opened.
Obj_arg6.Name: Play Star Chance Music?

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after the cage disappears.

Camera.Description: Used when the cage gets opened.

Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what sound effect to play after the cage gets opened.
Obj_arg4.Name: Riddle SFX Type

CapsuleCage.Notes: A locked cage that can be opened by activating its SW_B switch.

Cactus.Notes: A simple object that damages the player and compatible objects, such as SandBirdParts objects.

CancelBeeMorphArea.Notes: An area that removes the Bee power-up from the player if they are inside this area.

Rail.Description: Specifies the flying path that it will move on.

Obj_arg1.Description: Range in which it will attack the player. Default is Detection Range + 1000.
Obj_arg1.Name: Attacking Range

Obj_arg0.Description: Range in which it will detect the player. Default is 2000.
Obj_arg0.Name: Detection Range

BasaBasa.Notes: A flying bat enemy. These enemies may be flying around passively, move on a path or hang from ceilings. If the player comes within its range, it will fly towards them to attack. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) will freeze the player if touched, provided that they are not using the Ice power-up. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Stomping and most other attacks. It can be stunned by shooting Star Bits at them. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) can be attacked if the player is not using the Ice power-up. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

DemoCast.Description: The object takes part in the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.
Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame

Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.
Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame

Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.
Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length

SimpleMapObjFarMax.Notes: A variant of SimpleMapObj. This is a generic map object with a model, collision and a maximum far clipping distance. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, the Star Ball will hold a Purple Coin instead of a Power Star.
Obj_arg0.Name: Holds Purple Coin

Obj_arg1.Description: Disables respawning after it dies.
Obj_arg1.Name: Disable Respawning?

SW_DEAD.Description: Activated after it explodes.

BombTeresa.Notes: A Boo variant that can be swung around using its tongue. It can be smashed into several objects to damage or destroy them. If the player swings it around and does not get rid of it after some time, it will blink red and explode.

LavaBubble.Notes: A small bubble of lava that jumps out and back into lava.

Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the camera vector register. Occupies two cameras.
Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Starting Index

SW_A.Description: Starts the intro cutscene if the switch gets activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after defeating the boss.

BattanKing.Notes:
A large stone block boss. He can summon Whimps that will try to attack the player like Whomps do. The boss himself can defeat those smaller blocks by crushing them. Like his smaller counterparts, this boss will try to fall onto the player to attack them. He can also attack using shockwaves that appear when he jumps. When he's lying on ground, the player can Ground Pound the weak spot on its back to damage him. After hitting the boss three times, he will be defeated. He always spawns a Power Star.
He uses two GeneralPos.  is used as his position after the battle.  is used to position the player after the battle. Several messages are also required. BattanKing000 specifies the introduction text. BattanKing001 specifies the text after defeating him. Lastly, the actual cutscenes have to be specified as well:  for the opening and  for the outro.

DemoCast.Description: Will be used during the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: Enables or disables collision binding.
Obj_arg1.Name: Binder Type

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after it is destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how the item appears after SW_APPEAR gets activated.
Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance Type

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies if the item is stored in a bubble or not.
Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble?

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the power-up falls down after appearing or not.

Obj_arg2.Name: Landing Type

Calculate shadow drop and direction from gravity once
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow & Clipping Type

Rail.Description: Specifies the path that it moves on.

MorphItemTeresa.Notes: A collectable item that turns the player into a Boo character. This power-up state allows them to hover around like a Boo and pass through some walls.

Obj_arg0.Description: The ID of the YellowChipGroup this Star Chip is linked to.
Obj_arg0.Name: Star Chip Group ID

Obj_arg3.Description: If checked, the chip will spawn inside an air bubble.
Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble

Obj_arg5.Description: The shape of the object's shadow.
Obj_arg5.Name: Shadow Shape

Obj_arg4.Description: The distance downwards that the object's shadow is projected.
Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Drop Length

YellowChip.Notes: A collectable yellow chip. Usually five of these are linked together by a YellowChipGroup to trigger a switch to spawn something like a Launch Star.

DemoCast.Description: Will be used during the cutscene.

Obj_arg1.Description: Enables or disables collision binding.
Obj_arg1.Name: Binder Type

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after it is destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how the item appears after SW_APPEAR gets activated.
Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance Type

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies if the item is stored in a bubble or not.
Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble?

Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the power-up falls down after appearing or not.

Values.Notes: Stays in position where it appeared

Obj_arg5.Name: Appearance Camera Type
